2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: Many professors who have expressed their views about race and politics this year have found themselves targets of both the left and right. Nothing is too abstrusely academic, it seems, to seed an attack campaign fueled by websites that surveil social media to find gotcha-worthy gems. The Professor Watch List, for one, created last year by the conservative group Turning Point USA, is helping drive a new level of scrutiny of professors who, it says, “discriminate against conservative students and advance leftist propaganda in the classroom.” Some sites even send out alerts to subscribers. The latest casualties:
2017-08-04.headline_main: Professors as Targets of Internet Outrage

After student protests and internal review, at least five universities, from the University of Texas at Austin to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, have renamed buildings that originally honored Ku Klux Klan members. Other universities have not.

2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: Marshall Ganz, shirt sleeves rolled up, spread his arms wide with a “join me.” Hands came together, slowly at first, then in a flurry of rapid, synchronized thwacks. A member of the old left — he dropped out of Harvard in 1964 to fight for civil rights in Mississippi and for California farmworkers with Cesar Chavez — Dr. Ganz was teaching the unity clap, the audible calling card of the United Farmworkers of America 50 years earlier.

2017-08-04.abstract: When he’s not on the road, the rapper and fashion designer likes to stroll through Harlem, where he grew up and still lives.
2017-08-04.snippet: When he’s not on the road, the rapper and fashion designer likes to stroll through Harlem, where he grew up and still lives.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: ASAP Ferg is hardly ever home. The rapper and fashion designer, born Darold Ferguson Jr., just wrapped up a tour, visited Russia last month and will soon go to South Africa and Australia. His second mixtape, “Still Striving,” will be released this month, which will mean more trips. Rarely is he able to sneak a few days in Harlem, where he grew up and still lives. Even then, he’ll often stay busy, with studio sessions and appearances in between shows that cause the days to blur together. But Sundays are for him. He recharges and catches up with his friends and family and, among other things, sits very still on his couch. If you squint, his Sundays kind of look like ours.
2017-08-04.headline_main: How ASAP Ferg, Rapper, Spends His Sundays

2017-08-04.snippet: Free outdoor concerts by Natalia LaFourcade, Flaco Jiménez and Daymé Arocena are happening in New York City.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: America’s music has always benefited from a permeable Southern border, and free concerts in the coming week celebrate interchanges and connections across the Americas. A concert at Lincoln Center Out of Doors features Natalia LaFourcade, a Mexican songwriter with half a dozen Latin Grammys. Her latest album, “Musas,” is split between folky, unplugged songs from around Latin America and her own new ones that belong among them; she’ll be backed by the guitar duo Los Macorinos. Sharing the bill is the indie-rocker Vagabon, born in Cameroon and based in Brooklyn. (Friday, Aug. 11, at 7:30; Damrosch Park, free.)
2017-08-04.headline_main: Border-Crossing Music from Mexico, Cuba and Texas Hits Manhattan

And in this corner, the wizard of warriors, the sultan of the supernatural, the ancestor of anime: Utagawa Kuniyoshi (1797-1861).
2017-08-04.headline_main: A Japanese Woodblock Smackdown!

2017-08-04.snippet: “Katherine Dunham: Dance and the African Diaspora” is by the historian Joanna Dee Das.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: The choreographer, dancer and social activist Katherine Dunham made headlines in 1944, when, after reluctantly performing for a racially segregated audience in Louisville, Ky., she declared that if the theater wanted her to return, it would have to integrate. This scene introduces an in-depth, necessary new book on Dunham and her trailblazing career, “Katherine Dunham: Dance and the African Diaspora” (Oxford University Press), by the dance historian Joanna Dee Das.

2017-08-04.abstract: The crime writer Elizabeth Peters (a.k.a. Barbara Mertz) died in 2013. But her friend and fellow novelist Joan Hess has completed her last manuscript.
2017-08-04.snippet: The crime writer Elizabeth Peters (a.k.a. Barbara Mertz) died in 2013. But her friend and fellow novelist Joan Hess has completed her last manuscript.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: LAST HURRAH: When the mystery writer Barbara Mertz died, in 2013, she left behind an unfinished manuscript in her long-running series about the early-20th-century Egyptologist and amateur sleuth Amelia Peabody. Mertz (who wrote the series under the name Elizabeth Peters) was herself an accomplished Egyptologist, with a Ph.D. from the University of Chicago, and she often based her novels on actual episodes from the discipline’s colorful history — as in the new book, “The Painted Queen,” about the discovery and theft of a priceless bust of Nefertiti. But she hadn’t made much progress when she fell ill, and was still working out details of the plot with occasional help from her friend and fellow novelist Joan Hess. So her estate, naturally enough, asked Hess if she would finish the book that Mertz had started. “My first response was an adamant refusal,” Hess writes in a preface to “The Painted Queen,” new at No. 7 on the hardcover fiction list. “The idea of attempting to capture her voice, her erudite style, her wit and her vast knowledge of archaeology in the early 20th century seemed ludicrous. I lost that one, obviously.”
2017-08-04.headline_main: A Final Mystery for Amelia Peabody, Egyptologist and Sleuth

2017-08-04.snippet: The celestial phenomenon will be fully visible in 14 states across the United States. These books tell you all you need to know.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: There has not been a coast-to-coast solar eclipse in the United States since 1918, so the upcoming celestial phenomenon on August 21st is exceedingly rare. It will be visible in cities across the country — Columbia, S.C., Nashville, Tenn., and Carbondale, Ill., to name a few. These books offer historical context and insight on the upcoming event. But beware: you may be tempted to impulse buy a flight to the city closest to you, if you haven’t already.
2017-08-04.headline_main: Missing the Eclipse? Read All About It

2017-08-04.snippet: Republicans say regulations hurt business. So why are they so intent on imposing big new regulations on immigration?
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: This week the Republican senators Tom Cotton of Arkansas and David Perdue of Georgia introduced  a bill that they said would cut legal immigration to the United States by 50 percent. They are right about that, but nearly everything else that they have said about their bill is false or misleading.
2017-08-04.headline_main: Ignorant Immigration Reform

2017-08-04.abstract: It’s a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. Here’s a sampling of cultural highlights this weekend and over the week ahead.
2017-08-04.snippet: It’s a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. Here’s a sampling of cultural highlights this weekend and over the week ahead.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: The title of this retrospective comes from one of Mr. Demme’s Neil Young concert films (“Neil Young: Heart of Gold,” showing on Aug. 20), but there are few directors who have such a generous, open view of humanity, an outlook that helped the director, who died in April, even on “The Silence of the Lambs” (Aug. 12). The series begins with “Something Wild” (Friday), in which a free spirit played by Melanie Griffith takes Jeff Daniels’s “closet rebel” banker for a whirl. The filmmaker Paul Thomas Anderson will participate in a Q. and A. after the 7 p.m. screening; on Saturday he will speak before the 4:20 p.m. showing of “Melvin and Howard” — Howard being Howard Hughes (Jason Robards), and Melvin being the luckless Everyman (Paul Le Mat) who befriends him. This near-comprehensive program, continuing through Aug. 24, has untold riches, but the most underrated may be “The Truth About Charlie” (Wednesday), a remake of Stanley Donen’s “Charade” and a loving homage to the French New Wave. BEN KENIGSBERG
2017-08-04.headline_main: 10 Things to Do in NYC Now

2017-08-04.abstract: Cheap rents, wild music, easy drugs and open stages: Friends and colleagues from the 1960s recall the dramatist’s beginnings.
2017-08-04.snippet: Cheap rents, wild music, easy drugs and open stages: Friends and colleagues from the 1960s recall the dramatist’s beginnings.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: Sam Shepard, who died last week at 73, used to say that he was lucky to have landed in New York at just the right time. Rents were cheap, rock ’n’ roll was blooming, sex and drugs were easy, and adventurous no-budget theaters were opening in makeshift spaces downtown. For a 19-year-old arriving from California in 1963, handsome and unpolished, the city was a charmed playground.
2017-08-04.headline_main: How Sam Shepard Hit Downtown New York and Reinvented Himself

2017-08-04.abstract: Marco Minniti, the interior minister, is drawing on his years of government experience to help solve a challenge for his country.
2017-08-04.snippet: Marco Minniti, the interior minister, is drawing on his years of government experience to help solve a challenge for his country.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: ROME — During a visit to Moscow in 1980, Marco Minniti, a bald and bold young functionary in the Italian Communist Party, mortified his comrades by asking a Red Army general why the Soviets had occupied Afghanistan. The general pointed south on a map and explained that the faraway land mattered for his country’s national security.
2017-08-04.headline_main: Italy’s ‘Lord of the Spies’ Takes On a Migration Crisis

2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: Investors liked what they saw in PayPal’s second-quarter financial results, reported by the digital and mobile payments giant on July 26. Revenues grew to $3.14 billion in the quarter that ended in June, an increase of 18 percent over the same period last year. Total payment volume of $106 billion was up 23 percent, year over year.
2017-08-04.headline_main: The Accounting Tack That Makes PayPal’s Numbers Look So Good

2017-08-04.abstract: The crimes of “Mr. Mercedes” involve cars, bombs and a crowded pop concert, but this TV adaptation avoids over-resembling actual events.
2017-08-04.snippet: The crimes of “Mr. Mercedes” involve cars, bombs and a crowded pop concert, but this TV adaptation avoids over-resembling actual events.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: Stephen King’s 2014 novel “Mr. Mercedes” opens with a psychopath plowing a stolen luxury car into a crowd at a job fair. Later, there’s an attempted bombing at a boy band concert teeming with girls — all of which might sound too gruesomely familiar to relive as entertainment.

2017-08-04.abstract: As he nears his 31st birthday, Bolt has been slowing down. He’s set to run his last race on Saturday night in London — or so he says.
2017-08-04.snippet: As he nears his 31st birthday, Bolt has been slowing down. He’s set to run his last race on Saturday night in London — or so he says.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Track and field, once the most universal of sports in reach and resonance, is now a niche diversion, outpaced long ago by the likes of soccer, basketball and tennis. But there has been nothing niche about Usain Bolt, whose winning ways and winning manner have translated to the masses like few athletes in any sport.
2017-08-04.headline_main: Usain Bolt, an Icon in Track and Field, Is About to Run His Final Race

2017-08-04.abstract: A Gowanus farmer’s writings from 1828 to 1830 describe burying them on property that includes the proposed site of a prekindergarten.
2017-08-04.snippet: A Gowanus farmer’s writings from 1828 to 1830 describe burying them on property that includes the proposed site of a prekindergarten.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: From 1828 to 1830, a Gowanus landowner, Adriance Van Brunt, paused several times a week to record in a diary the events of that day he deemed worthy of mention. The diary, in neatly inked handwriting stretching from edge to edge, offers a detailed portrait of farm life near what was then the Village of Brooklyn.
2017-08-04.headline_main: 19th-Century Diary Suggests Slaves Are Buried in Brooklyn Lot

2017-08-04.abstract: But nobody ever admits being wrong about anything.
2017-08-04.snippet: But nobody ever admits being wrong about anything.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: It seems like ancient history now, but five years ago there was a remarkable Beltway consensus that high unemployment was structural, the result of a mismatch between the skills workers had and the skills the economy needed. What made this consensus remarkable was that all the evidence pointed the other way: none of the telltale signs of a skill mismatch, like rising wages for some groups despite high unemployment, were in sight. Meanwhile, lots of other evidence – like the fact that unemployment was falling fastest in the same places and occupations where it rose most – pointed to a cyclical story, that is, that the economy was simply suffering from inadequate demand.
2017-08-04.headline_main: Structural Unemployment: Yes, It Was Humbug

2017-08-04.abstract: A stint over the flame brings out the best in all the components of these skirt steak tacos — even the salsa.
2017-08-04.snippet: A stint over the flame brings out the best in all the components of these skirt steak tacos — even the salsa.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: It’s not the warm tortilla or the tender filling that makes a taco for me — it’s the condiments. The main protein almost doesn’t matter, be it fish, beef tongue or crisp pork carnitas. As long as there are several kinds of salsas and hot sauces, alongside the lime wedges, sliced radishes and chopped onions available at the taco truck, you’ll find me happily dabbing, squeezing and layering before taking a bite.
2017-08-04.headline_main: These Tacos Get Their Fire From the Grill

2017-08-04.abstract: A federal appeals court tossed out sentences and a verdict stemming from a shooting in Baghdad in 2007 that left 31 Iraqi civilians dead or wounded.
2017-08-04.snippet: A federal appeals court tossed out sentences and a verdict stemming from a shooting in Baghdad in 2007 that left 31 Iraqi civilians dead or wounded.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal appeals court on Friday threw out lengthy prison sentences for three former Blackwater Worldwide security contractors and ordered a new trial for a fourth involved in a deadly 2007 shooting in Baghdad that became a symbol of unchecked, freewheeling American power in Iraq.
2017-08-04.headline_main: In Blackwater Case, Court Rejects a Murder Conviction and Voids 3 Sentences

2017-08-04.abstract: Block Shop's new framed woodblock prints are available beginning this week.
2017-08-04.snippet: Block Shop's new framed woodblock prints are available beginning this week.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: Beloved by Los Angelenos with an eye for elevated folk, the four-year-old sister-run company Block Shop is known for its modern California textiles, made with traditional Indian hand block printing techniques. As someone who comes very close to stealing the Block Shop-designed napkins at Kismet (they are the happiest color of grapefruit pink, with the restaurant’s logo charmingly hidden in the natural-white batik pattern), imagine my excitement upon learning that the company is releasing its first collection of woodblock prints.
2017-08-04.headline_main: Turning Cotton Scraps Into Beautiful Canvas

2017-08-04.snippet: This ancient species even survived a nuclear explosion. It has a message for us.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: DURHAM, N.C. — On Aug. 6, 1945, a 14-year-old schoolboy named Akihiro Takahashi was knocked unconscious by a deafening roar and a flash of blinding light. When he awoke, he found that he had been thrown many yards by the detonation of the atom bomb dropped on Hiroshima. He had survived because his school was about a mile from the epicenter of the blast.
2017-08-04.headline_main: The Whispering Leaves of the Hiroshima Ginkgo Trees

That makes life difficult for Ms. Acevedo, 61, and her husband, Raymond, 63, a retired ironworker who uses a walker and travels to the neighborhood for therapy sessions.

2017-08-04.abstract: Pop music is the opposite of nativism.
2017-08-04.snippet: Pop music is the opposite of nativism.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: On Friday, “Despacito,” the hit song by the Puerto Rican artists Luis Fonsi and Daddy Yankee, became the most watched video on YouTube ever, with nearly three billion views. And it got there faster than any music video in history. Just over two weeks ago Universal Music announced it was also the most streamed song in history, if you combine the number of times people played the original song or video with a remixed version featuring vocals from the Canadian singer Justin Bieber.
2017-08-04.headline_main: The Meaning of ‘Despacito’ in the Age of Trump

2017-08-04.abstract: The new French president’s boldest initiative is a bid to overhaul French capitalism. Just one thing may stand in his way: 3,324 pages of regulations.
2017-08-04.snippet: The new French president’s boldest initiative is a bid to overhaul French capitalism. Just one thing may stand in his way: 3,324 pages of regulations.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: PARIS — It is a mind-numbing 3,324 pages long and growing. Of those, 170 pages govern firings, 420 regulate health and security, 50 temporary work and 85 collective negotiations. Hundreds more are devoted to wages, specific industries and overseas departments.

2017-08-04.abstract: Scorpion scientists have identified three new species among these ancient arachnids.

2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: Scorpions are ancient. They have been on earth some 435 million years. Some of the older creatures, the ancestors of modern scorpions, grew to a length of up to four feet. Some of today’s scorpions can kill human beings, while others rarely sting or have venom that doesn’t affect humans or other mammals.

2017-08-04.abstract: Although they form chains to swim as a collective, these gelatinous marine organisms use uncoordinated strokes when not in danger, a study finds.
2017-08-04.snippet: Although they form chains to swim as a collective, these gelatinous marine organisms use uncoordinated strokes when not in danger, a study finds.
2017-08-04.lead_paragraph: What mysterious, gelatinous, clear blob that you might find washed up on a beach looks like a jellyfish but isn’t? Meet the sea salp. It typically lives in deep waters, where its barrel-shaped body glides around the ocean by jet propulsion, sucking in water from a siphon on one end and spitting it back though another. It swims alone for part of its life. But it spends the rest of it with other salps, linked together in chains arranged as wheels, lines or other architectural designs.
2017-08-04.headline_main: It’s Better to Swim Alone, Yet Together, if You’re a Salp

2017-08-05.abstract: Our Book Review’s poetry editor asked poets to let us in on their creative process. Some shared their drafts — full of edits, notes and doodles.
2017-08-05.snippet: Our Book Review’s poetry editor asked poets to let us in on their creative process. Some shared their drafts — full of edits, notes and doodles.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Everybody knows that a finished piece of writing rarely springs, fully formed, from the author’s mind. But how does it get from there to here? The cover of this week’s Book Review features the marked-up draft of a poem by Eduardo C. Corral — one of a series of such annotated manuscripts, from six different poets, that anchor a special poetry-themed issue. I love seeing drafts for the same reason I love seeing artists’ sketches: because they show the mind at play, solving creative problems, and they illuminate the sometimes painstaking process behind the finished piece. They let us eavesdrop on a kind of dialogue or argument between the writer and the work itself. I have long been on the lookout for an opportunity to bring in-the-works drafts into the Book Review, and the poetry issue offered a perfect fit.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Pulling Back the Curtain on Poetry

2017-08-05.abstract: Prince Philip, the very model of a post-feudal royal, gets a well-deserved rest.
2017-08-05.snippet: Prince Philip, the very model of a post-feudal royal, gets a well-deserved rest.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: There are not many people who in their lifetime have had films made about them, had their image stamped onto a coin or had their obituary printed. But then not that many people have maintained an arduous work schedule in a highly visible job to the age of 96, as has Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh and consort of Queen Elizabeth II who retired this week. He has royally earned the right to rest (some would say so has his wife, but then she’s only 91).

2017-08-05.snippet: David Phillips challenges us with a tough Saturday puzzle that nearly everyone will see differently.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — It’s not really a secret that we all see, feel, smell and hear things differently. If you have ever sat through a course in philosophy, you know that our perception of what is “real” is based not on what something actually is, but what we say it is. Which is always incredibly disappointing to a teenager who has come to college to discover the “real” world (“That’s it?! That’s all there is to it? Can I go now?”)
2017-08-05.headline_main: ‘We Do Not See Things as They Are’

He was skeptical of the sanctuary approach, and the ephemeral hopes he thought it generated in trying to shield undocumented immigrants in dramatic standoffs with authorities.

2017-08-05.abstract: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate weight loss vs. wellness, Gen. John Kelly’s presence in the White House and affirmative action.

2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.
2017-08-05.headline_main: ‘I’m Still Overweight, but Much Happier and Healthier’

2017-08-05.abstract: Diane Hendricks and her late husband saw opportunity in Beloit, a decaying industrial town. Now, she dreams of turning it into a mecca for start-ups.
2017-08-05.snippet: Diane Hendricks and her late husband saw opportunity in Beloit, a decaying industrial town. Now, she dreams of turning it into a mecca for start-ups.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: BELOIT, Wis. — When Diane Hendricks sees something she doesn’t like here, she buys it.
2017-08-05.headline_main: In Weary Wisconsin Town, a Billionaire-Fueled Revival

2017-08-05.abstract: Tehran’s accelerating campaign to exert influence threatens to undo 16 years and half a trillion dollars’ worth of American efforts to forge a stable democratic Afghan government.
2017-08-05.snippet: Tehran’s accelerating campaign to exert influence threatens to undo 16 years and half a trillion dollars’ worth of American efforts to forge a stable democratic Afghan government.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: FARAH, Afghanistan — A police officer guarding the outskirts of this city remembers the call from his commander, warning that hundreds of Taliban fighters were headed his way.
2017-08-05.headline_main: In Afghanistan, U.S. Exits, and Iran Comes In

2017-08-05.abstract: Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic stand to lose shared membership in the European Union, and reinstating a hard border would have psychological and practical implications.
2017-08-05.snippet: Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic stand to lose shared membership in the European Union, and reinstating a hard border would have psychological and practical implications.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland — Crossing the border between Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic used to involve delays, checkpoints, bureaucratic harassment and the lurking threat of violence. That it’s now virtually seamless — that you can drive across without even knowing it — feels close to miraculous.
2017-08-05.headline_main: On Irish Border, Worries That ‘Brexit’ Will Undo a Hard-Won Peace

2017-08-05.abstract: As the United States hardens its border, Mexico has become a goal for Central American migrants. But its asylum program is overwhelmed.
2017-08-05.snippet: As the United States hardens its border, Mexico has become a goal for Central American migrants. But its asylum program is overwhelmed.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — As the Trump administration pushes forward with its plans to harden the southwest border, Mexico has found itself under pressure to take in an increasing number of asylum seekers making their way north from Central America, many of them fleeing  gang violence.
2017-08-05.headline_main: A Flawed Asylum System in Mexico, Strained Further by U.S. Changes

2017-08-05.abstract: Disenchanted with life in capitalist South Korea, Kwon Chol-nam is asking to be repatriated, an impossibility under current law.
2017-08-05.snippet: Disenchanted with life in capitalist South Korea, Kwon Chol-nam is asking to be repatriated, an impossibility under current law.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — Divorced and out of money, Kwon Chol-nam fled North Korea for China in 2014 by wading across a river border at night and then crawling over a barbed-wire fence. After a perilous trek that included walking through a jungle in Laos, he reached Thailand, where he was allowed to fly to South Korea to start a new life.
2017-08-05.headline_main: North Korean Defector, ‘Treated Like Dirt’ in South, Fights to Return

2017-08-05.abstract: He is 79. His partner is 92. So why marry? “Like any couple who are in love, we want to make the public, legal and personal commitment to each other.”
2017-08-05.snippet: He is 79. His partner is 92. So why marry? “Like any couple who are in love, we want to make the public, legal and personal commitment to each other.”
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Dr. John Vincent Abbott Jr. and Dr. E. Gerald Dabbs were married Aug. 5 in the ballroom of Dr. Abbott’s home in Ridgefield, Conn. Patricia E. Henry, a retired State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn, officiated.
2017-08-05.headline_main: For a Couple a Combined 171 Years Old, a Young Love

2017-08-05.abstract: The couple met at Penn, and their path to romance began when they endured tales of their classmates’ wedding preparations.
2017-08-05.snippet: The couple met at Penn, and their path to romance began when they endured tales of their classmates’ wedding preparations.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Carla Nasr and Levi Watson Azia Quaintance were married Aug. 5 at Jefferson Market Garden in Manhattan. Erin E. Reitz, a friend of the couple who was ordained by the American Marriage Ministries, officiated.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Firming Up Tentative Plans

2017-08-05.abstract: He left the event without the ice cream party he had bid on but with her phone number.
2017-08-05.snippet: He left the event without the ice cream party he had bid on but with her phone number.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Jessica Hope Morganoff and Gideon Yaacov Sims were married on Aug. 5 at Battery Gardens in New York. Cantor Neil A. Berris led the ceremony.

2017-08-05.abstract: Natasha Fraser-Cavassoni, a daughter of Lady Antonia and Sir Hugh, discusses a dishy new memoir inspired by Andy Warhol and others in his circle.
2017-08-05.snippet: Natasha Fraser-Cavassoni, a daughter of Lady Antonia and Sir Hugh, discusses a dishy new memoir inspired by Andy Warhol and others in his circle.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: One might reasonably assume that Natasha Fraser-Cavassoni, the youngest daughter of the English historian and novelist Lady Antonia Fraser and the late politician Sir Hugh Fraser, had a posh upbringing. Private schools. Pretty clothes. A retreat in Scotland.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Of Mice and Men Like Mick Jagger: A Literary Scion Tells All

2017-08-05.abstract: The author of “The Glass Castle” spent years covering celebrities. When her book became a huge hit, she “skedaddled” to Virginia and didn’t look back.
2017-08-05.snippet: The author of “The Glass Castle” spent years covering celebrities. When her book became a huge hit, she “skedaddled” to Virginia and didn’t look back.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: ORANGE, Va. — Early in the “The Glass Castle,” the movie based on Jeannette Walls’s memoir of growing up destitute, Rex Walls sidles up to his little girl, who lies burned and bandaged in a hospital bed.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Jeannette Walls Settles Down Far From the Noise of New York

2017-08-05.abstract: For clients like Jeffrey Katzenberg and Reese Witherspoon, Yifat Oren orchestrates events that are, at $2,000 a guest, expensive but discreet.
2017-08-05.snippet: For clients like Jeffrey Katzenberg and Reese Witherspoon, Yifat Oren orchestrates events that are, at $2,000 a guest, expensive but discreet.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — As the evening sky faded to bluish white, Yifat Oren, 45, surveyed her handiwork. “Don’t light the candles just yet,” the event producer said to one of her assistants. “We need to wait for the wind to die down.” Another assistant was sent to fetch the seating chart for a quick rearrangement.
2017-08-05.headline_main: A Hollywood Party Planner Who Isn’t Instagram-Obsessed

2017-08-05.abstract: In the SoHo neighborhood of New York, lines form early and last long for the newest limited-edition product “drops.” A photographer and a writer collaborate to meet the young stalwarts and check out their spoils.
2017-08-05.snippet: In the SoHo neighborhood of New York, lines form early and last long for the newest limited-edition product “drops.” A photographer and a writer collaborate to meet the young stalwarts and check out their spoils.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: We wanted to see where stylish New York teenagers were gravitating. We found that just as music and fashion brought young people together in the past, streetwear and skater brands are bringing them together today.
2017-08-05.headline_main: SoHo’s New Geeks

2017-08-05.abstract: The Sugars answer a letter writer who asks how anyone can afford to have kids by calling someone who helped Cheryl Strayed through that same territory.
2017-08-05.snippet: The Sugars answer a letter writer who asks how anyone can afford to have kids by calling someone who helped Cheryl Strayed through that same territory.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: How does anyone afford to have children? That’s a question the Sugars receive in this week’s episode from a woman who calls herself Broke Potential Mother.
2017-08-05.headline_main: George Saunders on the Price of Dreams

2017-08-05.abstract: On Thursday, Antonio Argüelles, 58, of Mexico set out to cross the North Channel in his attempt to complete the Oceans Seven.
2017-08-05.snippet: On Thursday, Antonio Argüelles, 58, of Mexico set out to cross the North Channel in his attempt to complete the Oceans Seven.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Antonio Argüelles, 58, rose near dawn Thursday hoping for good fortune.
2017-08-05.headline_main: In a Swimmer’s Two-Year Quest, a Final 21-Mile Challenge

2017-08-05.abstract: The order said Huang Jing had tried to influence Singapore’s foreign policy on behalf of an unnamed foreign government.
2017-08-05.snippet: The order said Huang Jing had tried to influence Singapore’s foreign policy on behalf of an unnamed foreign government.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: BANGKOK — Singapore has ordered the expulsion of a noted American academic for what it said was his covert effort to influence Singapore’s foreign policy on behalf of an unnamed foreign government.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Singapore Orders Expulsion of American Academic

2017-08-05.abstract: The accusations against Mr. Khan by the female lawmaker have led to social media attacks on her, illustrating the rise of such vitriol in a nation considered highly dangerous for women.
2017-08-05.snippet: The accusations against Mr. Khan by the female lawmaker have led to social media attacks on her, illustrating the rise of such vitriol in a nation considered highly dangerous for women.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — When a Pakistani lawmaker said this past week that she had received “inappropriate text messages” from a male colleague, she was met with a wave of vitriol on social media.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Female Lawmaker in Pakistan Accuses Imran Khan of ‘Inappropriate’ Texts. Abuse Follows.

2017-08-05.abstract: Farhad and Mike discuss the latest in Silicon Valley, including Facebook’s video chat ambitions and rumors of a Snap acquisition by Google.
2017-08-05.snippet: Farhad and Mike discuss the latest in Silicon Valley, including Facebook’s video chat ambitions and rumors of a Snap acquisition by Google.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the week’s news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: A Snap and Google Tie-Up?

2017-08-05.abstract: A new co-op owner is told she cannot enter through the front door of her building if she is using a stroller.
2017-08-05.snippet: A new co-op owner is told she cannot enter through the front door of her building if she is using a stroller.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Q. About a month ago, my husband and I bought a co-op in Fort Greene, Brooklyn. Several times a day, we put our baby in a stroller and leave the building through the front door. As we returned home through that door recently, a person, who we believe works for the managing agent, told us that strollers must use a back entrance. An avid rule follower, I reread the resident handbook and found no rule about this. If a rule is not written, must it be followed?
2017-08-05.headline_main: Can a Stroller Be Sent to the Back Door?

2017-08-05.abstract: We can witness brutality, in the movie “Detroit” or on police dashcams, but what is the country unwilling to see?
2017-08-05.snippet: We can witness brutality, in the movie “Detroit” or on police dashcams, but what is the country unwilling to see?
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: In the thick of “Detroit,” a new film by Kathryn Bigelow about the uprising in that city — my native city — 50 years ago, a white cop kills a black man. His partner then asks a witness, a black man, what he saw. The witness says he saw nothing. The partner puts the same question to another witness, a black teen, who refuses to play along.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Racial Violence on the Screen

2017-08-05.abstract: A woman read a fellow passenger’s texts, written in an enlarged font, and reported him. “She’s definitely a hero in our eyes,” a detective said.
2017-08-05.snippet: A woman read a fellow passenger’s texts, written in an enlarged font, and reported him. “She’s definitely a hero in our eyes,” a detective said.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: On a flight from Seattle to San Jose, Calif., on Monday, a woman caught a glimpse of some text messages that alarmed her.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Texts on a Plane About Child Molestation Lead to Two Arrests

2017-08-05.abstract: Yes, designers should engage with politics. But there are right ways, and wrong ways.
2017-08-05.snippet: Yes, designers should engage with politics. But there are right ways, and wrong ways.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: It’s August in New York — a time when arriving to work from the subway and not looking like a drowned rat is a sartorial victory. What should working women wear to beat the heat? Linen, perhaps a romper. Or you could don the Refugee Dress.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Being a Refugee Isn’t a Fashion Statement

2017-08-05.abstract: Donald J. Trump’s presidency may only be warming up, but in public and private, Republicans are maneuvering for his job, whether or not he runs for re-election.
2017-08-05.snippet: Donald J. Trump’s presidency may only be warming up, but in public and private, Republicans are maneuvering for his job, whether or not he runs for re-election.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senators Tom Cotton and Ben Sasse have already been to Iowa this year, Gov. John Kasich is eyeing a return visit to New Hampshire, and Mike Pence’s schedule is so full of political events that Republicans joke that he is acting more like a second-term vice president hoping to clear the field than a No. 2 sworn in a little over six months ago.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Republican Shadow Campaign for 2020 Takes Shape as Trump Doubts Grow

2017-08-05.abstract: Teams in the hunt for the postseason realize the need for relievers is great and the talent pool is deep. So there is no reason not to jump in.
2017-08-05.snippet: Teams in the hunt for the postseason realize the need for relievers is great and the talent pool is deep. So there is no reason not to jump in.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Kenley Jansen was asleep on the Los Angeles Dodgers’ charter plane on Monday when David Vassegh, the team’s radio beat reporter, awoke him with news: The Dodgers had acquired Yu Darvish, an All-Star starting pitcher, in a trade with the Texas Rangers. Jansen, the Dodgers’ closer, had a curious reaction.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Recipe for a Run: Add Bullpen Muscle

2017-08-05.abstract: This Cox and Rathvon acrostic might be N.S.F.W.
2017-08-05.snippet: This Cox and Rathvon acrostic might be N.S.F.W.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — Usually, I can make my way into an acrostic by finding some gimmes, or answers that I know right off the bat. There are always a few of them, although the exact number depends on the puzzle itself. From there, I try to toggle between filling in the words in the grid and solving the clues.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Variety: Acrostic

2017-08-05.abstract: More than 60 percent of the roughly 3,500 voting employees opposed the union. The result underscored organized labor’s continued difficulties in the South.
2017-08-05.snippet: More than 60 percent of the roughly 3,500 voting employees opposed the union. The result underscored organized labor’s continued difficulties in the South.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: In a test of labor’s ability to expand its reach in the South, workers at a Nissan plant in Mississippi overwhelmingly rejected a bid to unionize, an election that the union quickly criticized.
2017-08-05.headline_main: U.A.W. Accuses Nissan of ‘Scare Tactics’ as Workers Reject Union Bid

2017-08-05.abstract: Nawaz Sharif sharply criticized the Supreme Court ruling that corruption allegations had disqualified him from the prime minister’s office, forcing him to step down last week.
2017-08-05.snippet: Nawaz Sharif sharply criticized the Supreme Court ruling that corruption allegations had disqualified him from the prime minister’s office, forcing him to step down last week.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — Pakistan’s ousted prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, sharply criticized the Supreme Court verdict that forced him to step down last week and said he was planning a big rally in his hometown, Lahore, to galvanize public support for his political party and his future.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Pakistan’s Ousted Leader Criticizes Court Ruling and Plans Public Rally

2017-08-05.abstract: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson will be in the same room as North Korea’s foreign minister, Ri Yong-ho, on Sunday, and the world will be watching.
2017-08-05.snippet: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson will be in the same room as North Korea’s foreign minister, Ri Yong-ho, on Sunday, and the world will be watching.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: MANILA — Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson will for the first time on Sunday be in the same room with his North Korean counterpart, and much of the world will be watching for whether the two even acknowledge each other.
2017-08-05.headline_main: All Eyes Are on Tillerson and North Korean Counterpart at Asean Meeting

2017-08-05.abstract: The practice in college admissions has evolved from race-based quotas of decades ago into a range of approaches that only occasionally produce the desired results.
2017-08-05.snippet: The practice in college admissions has evolved from race-based quotas of decades ago into a range of approaches that only occasionally produce the desired results.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Just a year ago, after the Supreme Court rejected a challenge to the University of Texas at Austin’s admissions program by a single swing vote, the question seemed to be edging, at last, toward an answer: Colleges could, the justices ruled, consider race when deciding whom to let through their gates.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Affirmative Action Policies Evolve, Achieving Their Own Diversity

2017-08-05.abstract: Twenty-three Marines were rescued after an Osprey aircraft entered the water off the eastern coast of Australia. The crash is being investigated.
2017-08-05.snippet: Twenty-three Marines were rescued after an Osprey aircraft entered the water off the eastern coast of Australia. The crash is being investigated.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Officials have suspended the search for three missing United States Marines after an MV-22 Osprey, a hybrid aircraft, entered the water off the eastern coast of Australia around 4 p.m. local time on Saturday.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Search Is Suspended for 3 Missing Marines Off Australia

2017-08-05.abstract: In a capital consumed with crime and punishment, Robert Mueller, a.k.a. Bobby Three Sticks, keeps the president in his sights.
2017-08-05.snippet: In a capital consumed with crime and punishment, Robert Mueller, a.k.a. Bobby Three Sticks, keeps the president in his sights.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As we contemplate crime and punishment in the Trump circle, it should be noted that our Russia-besotted president does share some traits with Dostoyevsky’s spiraling protagonist, Rodion Raskolnikov.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Bobby Sticks It to Trump

2017-08-05.abstract: The national interest lies between the extremes of nativism and open borders.
2017-08-05.snippet: The national interest lies between the extremes of nativism and open borders.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: The last time Gallup asked Americans if they thought immigration to the United States should increase or decrease, 35 percent chose a decrease, 24 percent an increase, and 38 percent preferred the present rate. Support for increasing immigration has been rising for a decade, but it remains relatively low. To the extent that there is a middle-ground position, it is for something like the status quo.
2017-08-05.headline_main: An Elusive Immigration Compromise

2017-08-05.abstract: Every decade experiences an unrealistic stock market mania, and it feels like we might be deep into one now.
2017-08-05.snippet: Every decade experiences an unrealistic stock market mania, and it feels like we might be deep into one now.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: At the height of a market mania in 1967, the author George Goodman captured the mood perfectly, comparing it to a surreal party that ends only when “black horsemen” burst through the doors and cut down all the revelers who remain. “Those who leave early are saved, but the ball is so splendid no one wants to leave while there is still time. So everybody keeps asking — what time is it? But none of the clocks have hands.”
2017-08-05.headline_main: When Will the Tech Bubble Burst?

2017-08-05.abstract: The president calls himself a deal maker. But any skills he had have failed him in the White House. Now Congress is pushing him to the side.
2017-08-05.snippet: The president calls himself a deal maker. But any skills he had have failed him in the White House. Now Congress is pushing him to the side.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: President Trump promised he’d make so many great deals that we’d all get “tired of winning.” He’s certainly left Americans feeling worn out, but not because of any transactional whirlwind.
2017-08-05.headline_main: What’s the Deal, Mr. Trump?

2017-08-05.abstract: Young Puerto Ricans are coming back to the island or staying put — with an entrepreneurial spirit that upends a narrative of dependency.
2017-08-05.snippet: Young Puerto Ricans are coming back to the island or staying put — with an entrepreneurial spirit that upends a narrative of dependency.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — Two young graduates from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology did the unthinkable last summer: They quit enviable jobs in New York and moved back to beleaguered Puerto Rico, bringing their plan for a start-up with them.
2017-08-05.headline_main: As Others Pack, Some Millennials Commit to Puerto Rico

2017-08-05.abstract: Trump won on the politics of racial backlash. Now he’s following through with an agenda meant to stoke it further.
2017-08-05.snippet: Trump won on the politics of racial backlash. Now he’s following through with an agenda meant to stoke it further.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: White resentment put Donald Trump in the White House. And there is every indication that it will keep him there, especially as he continues to transform that seething, irrational fear about an increasingly diverse America into policies that feed his supporters’ worst racial anxieties.
2017-08-05.headline_main: The Policies of White Resentment

2017-08-05.abstract: Work is where many older women get their superpowers.
2017-08-05.snippet: Work is where many older women get their superpowers.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: There’s something haywire about how women are expected to crunch our most celebrated achievements into a timetable that frequently lasts fewer than 20 years. Find a partner. Raise some chicks. Zoom to the top of your field. Check each box by 50.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Hire Women Your Mom’s Age

2017-08-05.abstract: Political instability, including high staff turnover, can hurt a nation’s productivity.
2017-08-05.snippet: Political instability, including high staff turnover, can hurt a nation’s productivity.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: At the end of last month, the International Monetary Fund downgraded its forecast for economic growth in the United States. Where the I.M.F. previously predicted the economy would grow at a rate of 2.3 percent in 2017 and 2.5 percent in 2018, it now expects 2.1 percent growth in both years.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Is Trump’s Turmoil Slowing Economic Growth?

2017-08-05.abstract: What did the Russian president do on his days off in August? Spearfishing, mushroom picking, boating and sunbathing in and around a Siberian lake.
2017-08-05.snippet: What did the Russian president do on his days off in August? Spearfishing, mushroom picking, boating and sunbathing in and around a Siberian lake.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: What did President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia do on his summer vacation?
2017-08-05.headline_main: Vladimir Putin’s Summer Vacation: A Siberia Scrapbook

2017-08-05.abstract: Last year, California allowed medical aid in dying. As a palliative care specialist, how am I supposed to deal with it?
2017-08-05.snippet: Last year, California allowed medical aid in dying. As a palliative care specialist, how am I supposed to deal with it?
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — I WAS leafing through a patient’s chart last year when a colleague tapped me on the shoulder. “I have a patient who is asking about the End of Life Option Act,” he said in a low voice. “Can we even do that here?”
2017-08-05.headline_main: Should I Help My Patients Die?

2017-08-05.abstract: The constituent assembly, established to rewrite the Constitution, dismissed Luisa Ortega and replaced her with an ally of the president.
2017-08-05.snippet: The constituent assembly, established to rewrite the Constitution, dismissed Luisa Ortega and replaced her with an ally of the president.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: BOGOTÁ, Colombia — Venezuela’s dissident attorney general sped away from her headquarters on a motorbike on Saturday as she was being ousted by the country’s new all-powerful assembly, which moved toward a swift consolidation of its power.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Venezuela’s Ousted Attorney General Retreats on a Motorbike

2017-08-05.abstract: What was once a wedding season slur is now seen for what it really is: one of many words designed to mock women for simply getting things done.
2017-08-05.snippet: What was once a wedding season slur is now seen for what it really is: one of many words designed to mock women for simply getting things done.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: For many of the thousands of American weddings that have taken place so far this summer, there have been two unspoken requirements: 1) that the events be stunning, awe-inspiring, love-filled, unique and fun all at once, and 2) that they appear to have occurred miraculously, with zero effort or emotional output on the part of the bride.
2017-08-05.headline_main: A Feminist Defense of Bridezillas

2017-08-05.abstract: I didn’t want to be tied to a house and all the baggage I thought came along with the keys.
2017-08-05.snippet: I didn’t want to be tied to a house and all the baggage I thought came along with the keys.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: LINCOLN, NEB. — My parents threw me a surprise party when I graduated from college. I was the first in my family to do so, and it was, in many ways, a party for all of us. They rented a banquet hall, invited everyone they felt had played a key part in my arriving at that moment — and told me we were going to a cousin’s baby shower. Shortly after everyone yelled “surprise,” my dad took the microphone and started the festivities by introducing one of the few white American families there.
2017-08-05.headline_main: The 30-Something’s Guide to Real Estate

2017-08-05.abstract: The resolution, intended to punish North Korea over its nuclear militarization, could reduce the country’s already meager annual export revenue by $1 billion.
2017-08-05.snippet: The resolution, intended to punish North Korea over its nuclear militarization, could reduce the country’s already meager annual export revenue by $1 billion.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — The United Nations Security Council on Saturday unanimously adopted a resolution to impose the most punishing sanctions yet against North Korea over its repeated defiance of a ban on testing missiles and nuclear bombs.
2017-08-05.headline_main: U.N. Security Council Imposes Punishing New Sanctions on North Korea

2017-08-05.abstract: Mr. Bolling, a longtime host at the network, was accused of sending photographs of male genitalia to at least three female colleagues.
2017-08-05.snippet: Mr. Bolling, a longtime host at the network, was accused of sending photographs of male genitalia to at least three female colleagues.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: Fox News suspended Eric Bolling, a longtime host at the network, on Saturday pending an investigation into reports that he sent lewd photographs to three female colleagues via text message.
2017-08-05.headline_main: Fox News Suspends Eric Bolling After Report of Lewd Text Messages

2017-08-05.abstract: There are efforts to end the harmful isolation of young people in prison, but the country still has a long way to go.
2017-08-05.snippet: There are efforts to end the harmful isolation of young people in prison, but the country still has a long way to go.
2017-08-05.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department took a farsighted step last year when it banned the use of solitary confinement for young people in federal prisons. The decision — based on research showing that isolation promotes mental illness and self-harm — followed the widely publicized suicide of Kalief Browder, a young man who had been unjustly accused of a minor crime and sent to New York’s infamous Rikers Island jail complex, where he spent two traumatic years in solitary confinement.

2017-08-06.snippet: The son of the city’s first black mayor is challenging its first white mayor in 40 years in an election that comes at a pivotal point for a remade Detroit.
2017-08-06.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Coleman A. Young II was settling into a diner booth with a mug of hot chocolate heaped with whipped cream when a stranger approached. “I adored your father, and I hope you’re just like him,” she said. Hours later, as Mr. Young rode in a car along a neighborhood street, someone called out, “I voted for your dad, man!” And when he stood before residents of an apartment complex, a woman rose to recount her memories of Mr. Young’s father, Coleman A. Young, Detroit’s first black mayor. “He made a whole lot of difference in this city,” she said.
2017-08-06.headline_main: Detroit’s Mayoral Election Is a Test of Recovery and Legacy

2017-08-06.abstract: Journalists who helped put together The New York Times’s solar eclipse-themed special section reflect on the cosmic event’s earthbound delights.
2017-08-06.snippet: Journalists who helped put together The New York Times’s solar eclipse-themed special section reflect on the cosmic event’s earthbound delights.
2017-08-06.lead_paragraph: As an eerie midday twilight settled over Baker, Ore., on June 8, 1918, the hearts of a group of astronomers began to sink. Clouds became dense, and their chance to watch the sun wink out was in jeopardy.
2017-08-06.headline_main: Where Were You During the Great American Eclipse of 2017?

2017-08-06.abstract: The mayor will announce a proposal for a tax on New York City residents who earn more than $500,000 to raise money for subway and bus improvements.

Another group wants to turn it into a high-rise condominium.

2017-08-06.snippet: The coal industry sued, protested and lobbied to block a rule increasing royalties for mining coal on federal land. Then President Trump was elected, and the rule was suspended. The inside story is told in documents collected by The New York Times

It is part of an aggressive push to both invigorate the struggling American coal industry and more broadly exploit commercial opportunities on public lands.

2017-08-06.abstract: Set yourself up tonight with Mexican-style hot slaw and carne asada, then cap the coming days with a roasted eggplant lasagna, chicken paprikash or smothered chicken.
2017-08-06.snippet: Set yourself up tonight with Mexican-style hot slaw and carne asada, then cap the coming days with a roasted eggplant lasagna, chicken paprikash or smothered chicken.
2017-08-06.lead_paragraph: Good morning. Elmore Leonard once cautioned against the use of weather to open a piece of writing. “The reader is apt to leaf ahead looking for people,” he said. (He allowed an exception: Barry Lopez, and that’s totally right. Read “Arctic Dreams,” and you’ll see why.) But Leonard never spent time on my block, this time of year, in early morning warmth with just a riffle of breeze coming down the cobblestones from the water, soft air scented with diesel and salt that flutters the leaves of the Callery pear trees, beneath a bluebird sky.
2017-08-06.headline_main: What to Cook This Week

2017-08-06.abstract: Funding is flowing into social media, where partisan organizations are specializing in creating viral messages to reach voters.
2017-08-06.snippet: Funding is flowing into social media, where partisan organizations are specializing in creating viral messages to reach voters.

2017-08-06.abstract: The singer and songwriter’s tour supporting her latest album, “Joanne,” was most powerful when she stripped back the pop ostentation and revealed her pain.

2017-08-06.lead_paragraph: TACOMA, Wash. — Lady Gaga introduced her performance of “Joanne” at the Tacoma Dome here on Saturday night with a long disquisition on what she called “generational grief” and how it shaped this song, the title track from her latest album. She dedicated the performance to people who have been affected by a pain so long-running they can’t remember a time before it, and let them know that they were not alone.

2017-08-07.snippet: While Washington lets the nation’s infrastructure crumble, some states are raising gas taxes to cover basic needs.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: One of the few practical job-building promises of the Trump presidential campaign — a $1 trillion investment in repairing the nation’s crumbling infrastructure — is turning out to be as hollow as a pothole. Mr. Trump’s vow to push for passage of the plan in the first 100 days of his presidency is sliding off the calendar amid the daily chaos of his incumbency and the Republican obsession with crippling Obamacare.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Trying to Make America a Little Better

2017-08-07.abstract: On this week’s episode, a surprisingly tense arm-wrestling match, and a musical blast from the past.
2017-08-07.snippet: On this week’s episode, a surprisingly tense arm-wrestling match, and a musical blast from the past.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: From the beginning, “Twin Peaks” has embedded a clue to unlocking the show in its title. David Lynch and Mark Frost are captivated by dualities, whether they’re giving their characters literal doppelgängers or they’re exploring the extremes of good and evil within humanity as a whole. What’s apparent on the surface counts for little in “Twin Peaks.” A homecoming queen from an upstanding family can turn out to be a drug addicted part-time prostitute, while her father can be a serial sex offender. Just because someone looks pleasantly familiar doesn’t mean they’re okay. Everyone is split.
2017-08-07.headline_main: ‘Twin Peaks’ Season 3, Episode 13: Starting Position

2017-08-07.snippet: In an invitation-only group, wives grapple with issues from finding a home in a new city to living with a player’s debilitating concussive injuries.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTE, N.C. — The chatter runs the gamut from the practical to the profound, from sharing recipes and finding a home in a new city to dealing with a husband’s growing dementia and applying for medical benefits. Touchy topics like alcoholism, depression and spousal abuse come up, too, mixed in with ideas on what to do with spare time.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Inside the Facebook Group Where N.F.L. Wives Share Anxieties and Advice

2017-08-07.headline_main: A Rare Round of Diplomacy From North Korea’s Top Diplomat

2017-08-07.abstract: The case for prioritizing children, not single-payer.
2017-08-07.snippet: The case for prioritizing children, not single-payer.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: For now, at least, the attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act appears dead. Sabotage by a spiteful Trump administration is still a risk, but there is — gasp! — a bipartisan push to limit the damage, with Democrats who want to preserve recent gains allying with Republicans who fear that the public will blame them for declining coverage and rising premiums.
2017-08-07.headline_main: What’s Next for Progressives?

2017-08-07.abstract: Congress has come close to defaulting before. This time, it’ll probably happen.
2017-08-07.snippet: Congress has come close to defaulting before. This time, it’ll probably happen.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Sometime in October, the United States is likely to default on its obligation to pay its bills as they come due, having failed to raise the federal debt ceiling. This will cost the Treasury tens of billions of dollars every year for decades to come in higher interest charges and probably trigger a severe recession.
2017-08-07.headline_main: The Debt-Ceiling Crisis Is Real

2017-08-07.abstract: In a bid for relevance, politicians are hammering the American president. That’s a mistake.
2017-08-07.snippet: In a bid for relevance, politicians are hammering the American president. That’s a mistake.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Believe it or not, there was a time when German politicians were cool. There was Helmut Schmidt, the 1970s chancellor, packing up the sails of his boat, sleeves rolled up, his face roughened by the wind, tobacco and the Cold War. But that was then; in the decades since, the country has been run by stolid men and women — and, until lately, we’ve been fine with that. For good reason, Germans have a certain allergy to political charisma.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Germany Joins the Resistance

2017-08-07.abstract: Slashing legal immigration would do nothing but energize the president’s nativist supporters.
2017-08-07.snippet: Slashing legal immigration would do nothing but energize the president’s nativist supporters.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: President Trump has endorsed legislation that would slash legal immigration by half, mainly by cutting the number of visas granted to relatives of citizens, while favoring people who speak English and have advanced degrees. The bill, which would do nothing to solve the country’s immigration and economic challenges, is unlikely to become law. The only way to understand Mr. Trump’s vocal support of an obvious turkey is as yet another attempt to energize his dwindling base of right-wing and nativist supporters.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Trump Embraces a Senseless Immigration Proposal

2017-08-07.abstract: The intensity of this summer’s forest fires is exceptional, and a harbinger of what climate change will bring. Europe needs to be better prepared.
2017-08-07.snippet: The intensity of this summer’s forest fires is exceptional, and a harbinger of what climate change will bring. Europe needs to be better prepared.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Lu Fraili, Sardinia — As my husband and I drove back from dinner one evening last month, we were stunned by something I had never seen in 25 years of summer visits to Sardinia: a corona of flames on the scrub-covered hills above the city of San Teodoro. We feared for the town we’ve known so well, and even for our home here, only about four miles away.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Around the Mediterranean, the Fire This Time

2017-08-07.abstract: Russia’s huge nature reserves are an unlikely Soviet legacy — thanks to the environmental activists who fought to preserve them.
2017-08-07.snippet: Russia’s huge nature reserves are an unlikely Soviet legacy — thanks to the environmental activists who fought to preserve them.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: NEW HAVEN — Atop a granite cliff in Siberia this past winter, I stood gazing at what became, 100 years ago, the first in the world’s largest system of most protected nature reserves. To my west glistened mile-deep Lake Baikal. To the east rose snowy mountains, including one that reminded me of sharp-cut Half Dome, an icon of America’s Yosemite National Park. I was looking across Barguzinsky Zapovednik, a conservation area protecting more than 600,000 acres so free from human impact that visitors may not enter.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Lenin’s Eco-Warriors

2017-08-07.abstract: The second Photo Vogue Festival will continue the debate over what is and isn’t acceptable in fashion photography, with an exhibition titled “Fashion & Politics” that brings together some of the magazine’s most tendentious shoots.
2017-08-07.snippet: The second Photo Vogue Festival will continue the debate over what is and isn’t acceptable in fashion photography, with an exhibition titled “Fashion & Politics” that brings together some of the magazine’s most tendentious shoots.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: When Vogue Italia published a spread by Steven Meisel that was inspired by the deadly Deepwater Horizon oil spill of 2010, it provoked criticism. Bloggers and fashion critics called it tasteless and exploitative, given the devastation to the Gulf of Mexico’s ecosystem. This was neither the first, nor the last time that the publication sparked controversy, and it reinvigorated the debate over what is and isn’t acceptable in fashion photography.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Fashion Photography as Social Commentary

2017-08-07.abstract: Judges are under pressure to punish presidential corruption, and the country’s discredited justice system is gaining credibility and independence.
2017-08-07.snippet: Judges are under pressure to punish presidential corruption, and the country’s discredited justice system is gaining credibility and independence.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru — As Peru prepares for the bicentennial of its independence from Spain in 1821, instead of looking forward with optimism, it is contemplating a dismal political landscape: Four of its former presidents are in jail or fugitives from justice for human rights crimes or corruption. A world record? Probably, but hardly one to celebrate.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Does Peru Need a Special Prison Just for Ex-Presidents?

2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Suzanne Randolph, 60, knows firsthand that it can be daunting for women to travel on their own. In her more than two decades of frequent solo travel, Ms. Randolph, a former art adviser, says she has encountered her fair share of challenges. “Finding a place to eat and getting plugged into the local scene of your destination isn’t easy when you’re alone,” she said.

2017-08-07.abstract: The soprano was careful and earnest in a coolly impersonal production conducted by Riccardo Muti and directed by the celebrated visual artist Shirin Neshat.

2017-08-07.abstract: The late designer may be finally getting his due, but his most passionate collector refuses to take him too seriously — just as Sottsass himself would have wanted.
2017-08-07.snippet: The late designer may be finally getting his due, but his most passionate collector refuses to take him too seriously — just as Sottsass himself would have wanted.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: In the early 1960s — almost two decades before he became the ringleader of the boisterous Memphis collective, a group of some 20 renegade postmodernists — the polymathic Austrian-born designer and architect Ettore Sottsass was touring India when he contracted life-threatening nephritis. Roberto Olivetti, of the Olivetti typewriter company, for whom Sottsass would later dream up a now-iconic cherry-red portable model, paid for his treatment at Stanford University Medical Center in Palo Alto, and during his tedious recovery, Sottsass amused himself by sketching pills stacked vertiginously high, like children’s blocks. When he was released, he wandered north to San Francisco, where he fell in with Allen Ginsberg and Jack Kerouac, a meeting that began his long association with the leading figures of the American counterculture.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Memphis in Paris: A Classic French Home Filled With Sottsass

2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: The Medicare Advantage program was supposed to save taxpayers money by allowing insurers to offer older Americans private alternatives to Medicare. The plans now cover 19 million people, a third of all those who qualify for Medicare. Enrollee satisfaction is generally high, and studies show that plans offer higher quality than traditional Medicare. But the government pays insurers more than they pay out for patient care — in some years, it turns out, a great deal more.

2017-08-07.headline_main: Secrecy and Suspicion Surround Trump’s Deregulation Teams

2017-08-07.abstract: Take it easy: Make Julia Moskin’s recipe for pasta with marinated tomatoes. Then, maybe consider some steak tacos or some ridiculously moist brownies.
2017-08-07.snippet: Take it easy: Make Julia Moskin’s recipe for pasta with marinated tomatoes. Then, maybe consider some steak tacos or some ridiculously moist brownies.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Good morning. We’re about halfway through summer right now, if you started counting at the June solstice and I did. Tonight, you can make Julia Moskin’s recipe for “the easiest summer dinner known to man” and celebrate.
2017-08-07.headline_main: The Easiest Summer Dinner

2017-08-07.abstract: France’s new young president, an untested centrist, is seeing his support quickly evaporate as he angers and alienates the left and the right, according to polls.
2017-08-07.snippet: France’s new young president, an untested centrist, is seeing his support quickly evaporate as he angers and alienates the left and the right, according to polls.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: PARIS — President Emmanuel Macron, who upended France’s political establishment with his election in May, is breaking ground again, but in an unwelcome way: a rapid and nearly unequaled drop in the polls.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Macron’s Honeymoon Comes to a Halt

2017-08-07.abstract: The Time Spans festival presented student composers as well as evenings devoted to works by John Luther Adams, Jürg Frey and Georg Friedrich Haas.
2017-08-07.snippet: The Time Spans festival presented student composers as well as evenings devoted to works by John Luther Adams, Jürg Frey and Georg Friedrich Haas.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Along with the master provocateur John Cage, Earle Brown (1926-2002) was a member of the mid-20th-century composers’ collective known as the New York School. Yet while Cage was scabrous about the value of recorded music, preferring to issue books that could accompany his written scores, Brown dove with gusto into the world of LP production, releasing 18 experimental titles on his Contemporary Sound Series, from 1960 to 1973. (The complete set has been reissued on CD by the Wergo label over the last decade.)
2017-08-07.headline_main: Five Nights of New Music, From Gentle to Terrifying

2017-08-07.abstract: The Mets pitcher, who has the looks of a Lannister, made a brief appearance in the battle between the armies of Danaerys Targaryen and Cersei Lannister.
2017-08-07.snippet: The Mets pitcher, who has the looks of a Lannister, made a brief appearance in the battle between the armies of Danaerys Targaryen and Cersei Lannister.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: It can be hard to compare the relative strengths of competing mythologies, but on this week’s episode of HBO’s “Game of Thrones,” it appeared that a Norse god could hold his own against a horde of Dothraki warriors, but was no match for a full-grown dragon.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Noah Syndergaard’s ‘Game of Thrones’ Cameo Ends in Fiery Death

2017-08-07.abstract: Four top Democratic members of Congress wrote a letter to the White House on Monday asking the Trump administration to release the names of all deregulation team members. Here is the letter.

2017-08-07.abstract: Juices for those who like their martinis dirty but free from olives.
2017-08-07.snippet: Juices for those who like their martinis dirty but free from olives.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Yes, you could add a splash of the liquid from a jar of olives to your martini. Or you could pop open a bottle of olive juice formulated for cocktails by Gaea, a Greek food company that sells fine olive oils. The juices are made using brines left over from the company’s olive and oil production. Green olive juice is for use with gin. Brine from pimento-stuffed olives is designated for vodka, and it has a nice little kick: Gaea Dirty Martini Juice, $2.49 for 8.5 ounces, gaeaus.com.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Dirty Cocktails Without the Pits

2017-08-07.abstract: Cameron’s, a seafood company, is now shipping its crab cakes and cream of crab soup nationwide.
2017-08-07.snippet: Cameron’s, a seafood company, is now shipping its crab cakes and cream of crab soup nationwide.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Cameron’s, a Maryland seafood company that has specialized in blue crabs and crab cakes since 1985, has started shipping its products fresh nationwide. The crab cakes, generous with chunks of snowy meat, require a simple sauté in butter. They are a hefty eight ounces each and can easily be divided into smaller portions. The company also sells luxurious cream of crab soup, whole steamed crabs, king crab legs, jumbo lump crab meat, shrimp and other seafood: Crab cakes, $9.99 each for four ounces, $19.99 each for eight ounces; cream of crab soup, $19.99 for one quart, cameronsseafood.com.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Crab Cakes Fresh From Maryland

2017-08-07.abstract: Despite conventional wisdom, no one knows if dogs can smell fear. But humans give them plenty of other reasons to attack.

2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Q. Can dogs smell fear?

2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE — The European Union on Monday notified the food safety authorities in Britain, France, Sweden and Switzerland to be on the lookout for contamination in eggs after a food scare in Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands.

2017-08-07.abstract: Hood River Cherry Company ripens its cherries on the branch, which extends the season till the end of summer.
2017-08-07.snippet: Hood River Cherry Company ripens its cherries on the branch, which extends the season till the end of summer.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: These dark, glossy cherries are firm and sweetly complex. Several varieties are grown in Oregon at high altitudes, handpicked and shipped by air. Because the cherries are tree-ripened, the season is later, with some available until the end of August: $89.95 for a five-pound box, including shipping, Hood River Cherry Company, 800-709-4722, hrcherrycompany.com.
2017-08-07.headline_main: A Dark and Sweet Cherry for the Dog Days of Summer

2017-08-07.abstract: North Korea threatened retaliation “thousands of times” for the most punishing sanctions yet. But history suggests North Korea will devise workarounds.

2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration has hailed the latest United Nations sanctions against nuclear-armed North Korea as the most severe yet, and the North’s fury over the penalties suggested they carried some sting.

2017-08-07.abstract: Mr. Chow replaces Eli Kaimeh, who is leaving for a three-month sabbatical.

2017-08-07.abstract: Plays in London spanning more than a century suggest how much and how little has changed for British women.
2017-08-07.snippet: Plays in London spanning more than a century suggest how much and how little has changed for British women.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Consider, if you will, the very different love lives of Georgie and Dee. Georgie, who is 29, sees her future shriveling into one long, gray vista of celibate loneliness and dependence on rich relations — that is, if she doesn’t land a husband fast, preferably this very day.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Women Without Options and Spoiled for Choice

2017-08-07.snippet: The South African president was likely to win, but he could face increasing pressure within his African National Congress.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: CAPE TOWN — Over his eight increasingly embattled years in power, President Jacob Zuma of South Africa has fended off five parliamentary no-confidence motions that would have forced him from office. On Tuesday, he is to face another, with a difference: Lawmakers will vote anonymously.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Zuma to Face No-Confidence Vote, This Time by Secret Ballot

The aprons are made of sturdy yet lightweight Turkish denim with a waxy stain-resistant coating. Each is named for a different culinary personality, and some of them have a charitable donation built into the price: Art of Simplicity by Sosa, $88 to $98, aosbysosa.com.

2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: The actress Florence Pugh’s performance in William Oldroyd’s arresting film “Lady Macbeth” has won her praise (and prizes) on the festival circuit this year. “There’s a scene toward the end that is quite shocking,” says the 21-year-old Brit, who plays the protagonist, Katherine. “Some people have gotten up and left, and to me, that’s so exciting because we have achieved the ultimate. We have affected you so much that you can’t sit and watch it anymore.”

2017-08-07.abstract: Frozen desserts made with sea buckthorn berries and rye are the stars at a new cart in Grand Central Terminal.
2017-08-07.snippet: Frozen desserts made with sea buckthorn berries and rye are the stars at a new cart in Grand Central Terminal.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Would some consider rye-and-gooseberry ice cream a tasty treat or not? For me, it’s an earthy, nutty delight. A tart-sweet golden sorbet, made from sea buckthorn berries and carrots, and a richly herbal sorrel ice cream are the other Scandinavian flavors at the new Great Northern Creamery, a cart tucked near the herb garden in the Great Northern Food Hall. Fear not if your tastes are more conventional. Chocolate and buttermilk ice creams and a raspberry sorbet are also available by the scoop or inside a warm, toasted brioche: Great Northern Food Hall, Grand Central Terminal, 89 East 42nd Street, 646-568-4020, greatnorthernfood.com.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Bracing Ice Cream Flavors From Scandinavia

2017-08-07.abstract: Students and alumni are frustrated by the turmoil in Harvard’s graduate theater program and have trained their ire on its leader, the director Diane Paulus.
2017-08-07.snippet: Students and alumni are frustrated by the turmoil in Harvard’s graduate theater program and have trained their ire on its leader, the director Diane Paulus.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. — Twelve years after finishing Harvard’s graduate theater program, Katierose Donohue still pays almost as much in student loans each month — about $650 — as for her share of the rent in Los Angeles. She recently stopped hosting her monthly sketch comedy show, “Ma’am,” because she didn’t always break even on her $200 budget. She’s now working side jobs as a dog walker and a social media copywriter, after past gigs serving at Starbucks and handing out free cigarettes for Camel.
2017-08-07.headline_main: $78,000 of Debt for a Harvard Theater Degree

2017-08-07.abstract: Amateurs pack the shores of the Kenai River, perhaps the most colorful, and contentious, fishing spot in America.
2017-08-07.snippet: Amateurs pack the shores of the Kenai River, perhaps the most colorful, and contentious, fishing spot in America.
2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: KENAI, Alaska — Wenceslous Fru, a physician assistant from Anchorage, stood on the sandy shore of the Kenai River and imagined the dinner he would put together once he felt the jostle of a salmon in his long-handled dip net. He would make it the way they do back home in Cameroon, splitting it down the belly and opening it like a book, rubbing it with ginger, garlic and spices, and then slipping it under the broiler.
2017-08-07.headline_main: Free Alaskan Salmon: Just Bring a Net and Expect a Crowd

Mr. Lamell, music director of the orchestra, invited the conservative talk show host and columnist Dennis Prager as guest conductor for the event.

2017-08-07.lead_paragraph: Gregory Benjamin Conocchioli, 63, has pursued several careers, but his latest was born from a wedding gift. Five years ago, he made 150 jars of preserves for his niece’s wedding, and afterward he received requests for more. So Mr. Conocchioli rented a church kitchen in his village, Carversville, Pa., and went into business. For the past three years, his marmalades and preserves have won medals in the World’s Original Marmalade Awards in Cumbria, England. Orange-almond-apricot and citrus-blend marmalades are just two of the outstanding choices: Gregory Benjamin Artisan Preserves and Marmalades, $9 to $16.50, preservesandmarmalade.com.

2017-08-08.lead_paragraph: Last week The Washington Post published transcripts of Donald Trump’s conversations with foreign leaders. A dear friend sent me an email suggesting I read them because they reveal how Trump’s mind works. But as I tried to click the link a Bartleby-like voice in my head said, “I would prefer not to.” I tried to click again and the voice said: “No thanks. I’m full.”
