2017-08-11.abstract: Every particulate-filled breath is a reminder of the wildfires working their way through our desiccated forests.
2017-08-11.snippet: Every particulate-filled breath is a reminder of the wildfires working their way through our desiccated forests.
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: BIGFORK, Mont. — I guess we should consider ourselves lucky. Folks down on Rock Creek have been praying for rain (sans lightning, of course) and hoping that the fire lines hold. Missoula is surrounded by wildfires, to the point that it really doesn’t matter which way the wind blows. North, east, south or west, the city’s population is still sucking smoke.
2017-08-11.headline_main: In Montana, Days of Smoke and Ash

2017-08-11.abstract: Vanessa Williams, Norm Lewis and others came to sing by Ms. Cook’s bedside as she lay dying. Others sent audio and video recordings to say goodbye.
2017-08-11.snippet: Vanessa Williams, Norm Lewis and others came to sing by Ms. Cook’s bedside as she lay dying. Others sent audio and video recordings to say goodbye.
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: On a flight home to New York last week, the jazz musician John Pizzarelli received a text message saying that Barbara Cook, the 89-year-old star of Broadway and cabaret, was in failing health. He and his wife, the singer Jessica Molaskey, had met Ms. Cook a decade earlier at Café Carlyle, one of her musical haunts, and they had become close. Would the couple like to come to her bedside and say their goodbyes?
2017-08-11.headline_main: In Barbara Cook’s Final Days, Her Friends Came to Sing at Her Bedside

2017-08-11.abstract: Prices have topped $1 million, but national museums and major auction houses have promoted works later said to be fraudulent.

2017-08-11.headline_main: Vietnamese Art Has Never Been More Popular. But the Market Is Full of Fakes.

2017-08-11.abstract: Embrace this weekend to cook as if summer won’t ever end, with pulled pork, a paella or some Nashville-style hot chicken.
2017-08-11.snippet: Embrace this weekend to cook as if summer won’t ever end, with pulled pork, a paella or some Nashville-style hot chicken.
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: Good morning. There’s a cool dish out of France called eclade de moules, in which you take a few pounds of mussels, put them on a board or rock, cover them with dried pine needles and then set the whole thing on fire. The intense heat of the burning pine opens the mussels and adds to their brininess the fragrance of the forest floor, and that would be a cool thing to do and eat this weekend if you have access to the pine, and a space in which to burn it. (Here’s a video of the process.)
2017-08-11.headline_main: What to Cook This Weekend

2017-08-11.abstract: It’s a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. Here’s a sampling of cultural highlights this weekend and over the week ahead.
2017-08-11.snippet: It’s a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. Here’s a sampling of cultural highlights this weekend and over the week ahead.
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: A fervid vocalist and full-bore entertainer, Mr. Mwenso has assembled a special three-part program for this concert. Taking place at 7 p.m. on Tuesday, it’s devoted to music of uplift and self-determination from across the African diaspora. The pianist Sullivan Fortner, a member of Roy Hargrove’s quintet, will play a sampling of African-American spirituals; the South African vocalist Vuyo Sotashe will introduce audiences to songs he learned in the townships of his homeland; and Mr. Mwenso, who hails from Sierra Leone, will debut a selection of newly composed anthems aimed at inspiration. GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO
2017-08-11.headline_main: 10 Things to Do in NYC Now

2017-08-11.abstract: A by-no-means exhaustive list of great things we've stumbled upon.
2017-08-11.snippet: A by-no-means exhaustive list of great things we've stumbled upon.
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: I have very high standards for new bathing suits. They should be as simple as possible, offer good coverage — and be completely devoid of frills. And yet each season, it seems that a good bathing suit is almost impossible to find. Solid and striped suits are attractive and yet ill-fitting on my body; one-piece Speedos are ideal in terms of comfort and yet out of place on a beach. Two brands — Marieyat and the wonderfully titled Babes in Bathers — offer new solutions.
2017-08-11.headline_main: Some Things T Editors Like Right Now

2017-08-11.abstract: In his new book, Jeff Flake says he was inspired by Barry Goldwater’s “The Conscience of a Conservative.” But are Goldwater’s truths all that timeless — or even useful?
2017-08-11.snippet: In his new book, Jeff Flake says he was inspired by Barry Goldwater’s “The Conscience of a Conservative.” But are Goldwater’s truths all that timeless — or even useful?
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: For conservatives buffeted by Trump-force winds, nothing looks so sturdy as the ballast of the past, which is perhaps why the Republican senator Jeff Flake chose to name his new book after an old one. Flake’s “Conscience of a Conservative” pays tribute to Barry Goldwater’s 1960 treatise — “one of the most influential political books of all time,” in Flake’s estimation (even if the premise of Flake’s jeremiad on the current “crisis” for conservatives suggests it wasn’t nearly influential enough) — and includes a lengthy list of plaintive questions about President Trump’s deeds under the heading “What Would Goldwater Do?”
2017-08-11.headline_main: Desperate Times Call for Old Measures

2017-08-11.abstract: A profiteering mayor threatens to displace a city park’s animal residents unless a grumpy squirrel named Surly can wreck his plans.
2017-08-11.snippet: A profiteering mayor threatens to displace a city park’s animal residents unless a grumpy squirrel named Surly can wreck his plans.

2017-08-11.abstract: Perri Hofmann sees New York as a collage of the actual city and images on display everywhere.
2017-08-11.snippet: Perri Hofmann sees New York as a collage of the actual city and images on display everywhere.
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: New York City is full of pastoral sights: white clouds floating in deep blue skies, lakes ringed by verdant hills, grassy expanses calling out for barefoot play. Such, anyway, are the sights on billboards and other signs scattered everywhere. Real life, often, struggles to compete.
2017-08-11.headline_main: Man Against Nature

2017-08-11.abstract: Puzzling behavior by senators in the health care debate makes a lot more sense if you view it as part of a signaling game.
2017-08-11.snippet: Puzzling behavior by senators in the health care debate makes a lot more sense if you view it as part of a signaling game.
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: Because economists generally assume that people behave rationally, you might expect members of my profession to have been flummoxed by the behavior of many United States senators during the repeated, failed attempts to repeal the Affordable Care Act.
2017-08-11.headline_main: It’s Not Irrational. It’s Signaling Behavior.

2017-08-11.abstract: The blog “Jeremiah’s Vanishing New York” has been a chronicle of loss for a decade.
2017-08-11.snippet: The blog “Jeremiah’s Vanishing New York” has been a chronicle of loss for a decade.
2017-08-11.lead_paragraph: On an unseasonably pleasant July evening, the line outside Housing Works Bookstore Cafe in SoHo stretched down most of Crosby Street. Inside, it was standing room only as Jeremiah Moss, bearded and in a black T-shirt, read from his book, “Vanishing New York: How a Great City Lost Its Soul” (Dey Street, 2017). The book chronicles how (and why) a city of diners and delis morphed into a string of interchangeable blocks filled with forgettable stores of the sort that could be found in a Long Island strip mall.
2017-08-11.headline_main: A Book From a Blogger About Disappearing New York

Last week, scientists published a study revealing how densely packed your dirty kitchen sponge is with microscopic bacteria. After I wrote an article about their work, readers flooded my inbox with good questions, so I asked around for some answers.
2017-08-11.headline_main: We Need to Talk Some More About Your Dirty Sponges

After all, you were rejected by a margin of nearly five million votes in the three states on the West Coast mainland, where more than 1 in 7 Americans live. We are the reason you lost the national popular vote by such a historic margin. Since you’ve been president, you’ve never set foot in our time zone.

I don’t like this new abnormal. It scares me and depresses me. So I check Twitter and hooray, I see Aaron Carter is trending because he has announced he’s bisexual. This is so great, because I don’t care! I’m only vaguely aware of who Aaron Carter is, and his sexuality couldn’t matter less to me, so I read more.

2017-08-12.abstract: Problems with the pumping and drainage system caused severe flooding in the city last weekend and put residents on edge.

2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — With rain threatening, work crews scrambled on Friday to repair New Orleans’s pumping and drainage network in the hopes of preventing a repeat of last weekend, when flooding inundated many neighborhoods and forced city officials to admit that vital pieces of the system were inoperable.
2017-08-12.headline_main: New Orleans Scrambles to Repair Drainage System After Severe Flooding

2017-08-12.abstract: Looking for money for subways? The state gave up a revenue source 18 years ago that would bring in almost $1 billion a year for the city.
2017-08-12.snippet: Looking for money for subways? The state gave up a revenue source 18 years ago that would bring in almost $1 billion a year for the city.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Even as New York’s political leaders talk about a new, higher tax rate for the rich to fix mass transit, they might consider reviving an old revenue source that state lawmakers eliminated 18 years ago, to New York City’s enduring harm. This is the commuter tax, a modest imposition on the paychecks of 811,000 suburbanites who make their living in the city and may reasonably be expected to contribute a little to help keep it running.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Make Commuters Pay Their Share Again

2017-08-12.abstract: Sales for some emergency prep companies have been down this year, but the standoff between the U.S. and North Korea has renewed interest in their wares.

Championship in anticipation of seeing him fishtail around the difficult finishing holes or smash a club.

2017-08-12.abstract: A recent Trump administration decision comes with flimsy justification.
2017-08-12.snippet: A recent Trump administration decision comes with flimsy justification.

The decision is unsettling even by the disquieting standards of this anti-science administration.

2017-08-12.snippet: Campaign finance filings on Friday showed that Sal F. Albanese had raised and spent enough money to qualify to debate Mayor Bill de Blasio twice.

2017-08-12.abstract: Kim Jong-un needs a David versus Goliath narrative to justify his military program. Now he has it.
2017-08-12.snippet: Kim Jong-un needs a David versus Goliath narrative to justify his military program. Now he has it.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — A few years ago, when I was a reporter working in Pyongyang, North Korea’s capital, I went to visit a kindergarten. While I was there, I picked up a children’s book called “A Hedgehog Defeats the Tiger.” It was a tale, a North Korean told me, about a feisty little hedgehog that bests a much larger and fiendishly ravenous tiger using the only weapons at its disposal: the small but sharp quills on its back. The tiny but clever hedgehog pounces on the big nose of the blundering tiger, blinding him into submission.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Donald Trump Is Giving North Korea Exactly What It Wants

2017-08-12.abstract: Kameron Austin Collins offers us a challenging puzzle, but if you are willing to learn and adapt, you just might pull this one off.
2017-08-12.snippet: Kameron Austin Collins offers us a challenging puzzle, but if you are willing to learn and adapt, you just might pull this one off.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — This might or might not be a popular opinion but it’s mine, so I’ll just say it: I love pop culture. I revel in it. But that is not all there is to me as a person or as a solver, so I’m always baffled by those who look down on pop culture in crosswords.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Ability to Learn and Adapt

2017-08-12.abstract: Thousands wrote in to share their opinion.
2017-08-12.snippet: Thousands wrote in to share their opinion.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: In my recent Sunday Review piece, I addressed the question of whether motherhood is a sacrifice or a privilege, whether it is selfless or selfish. I made the argument that we would go a long way to empowering women and mothers by reframing the way we think and talk about mothers by refusing the badge of martyrdom and by heeding the language we use when we talk about motherhood. By insisting on calling motherhood a selfless sacrifice, we take agency away from her.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Is Motherhood a Sacrifice or a Privilege?

2017-08-12.abstract: A tenant wants to stretch the 30-day limit on houseguests.
2017-08-12.snippet: A tenant wants to stretch the 30-day limit on houseguests.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Q. I have been living in the same rent-stabilized apartment in Midtown East for decades. I am planning a trip of as long as six weeks to Europe, swapping apartments with a friend who lives in Italy. There would be no exchange of money. My landlord says I am allowed to have a visitor for no more than 30 days. What would happen if I had two guests stay, one for 20 days and the other for 25 days?
2017-08-12.headline_main: What if Friends Stay Past the Landlord’s Limit?

2017-08-12.headline_main: Trump to Guam Governor: North Korea Threats Will Boost Tourism ‘Tenfold’

2017-08-12.snippet: Freeman, a slugging first baseman, offered to play third base upon his return from an injury in order to help his improving team.

2017-08-12.headline_main: Braves’ Freddie Freeman Sets a Moving Example

2017-08-12.abstract: Seven decades ago, the Knicks pushed to integrate a predecessor of the N.B.A. Their new general manager and president are breaking ground again.
2017-08-12.snippet: Seven decades ago, the Knicks pushed to integrate a predecessor of the N.B.A. Their new general manager and president are breaking ground again.

2017-08-12.abstract: President Trump’s suggestion that he was considering a “military option” to deal with the crisis in Venezuela could breathe life into some of the government’s more wild claims of American intentions.
2017-08-12.snippet: President Trump’s suggestion that he was considering a “military option” to deal with the crisis in Venezuela could breathe life into some of the government’s more wild claims of American intentions.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: The thought of military intervention in Venezuela probably took many Americans by surprise when it was floated on Friday by President Trump. But in Venezuela, it was a threat that would have sounded familiar, as if the words had been scripted by the government itself.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Trump’s Talk of ‘Military Option’ in Venezuela May Bolster Maduro’s Hand

2017-08-12.abstract: An internet platform like YouTube or Reddit is more than just an app or URL; for some users, it can be an identity that informs everything they do online.
2017-08-12.snippet: An internet platform like YouTube or Reddit is more than just an app or URL; for some users, it can be an identity that informs everything they do online.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: A loose agglomeration of right-wing pundits and personalities on YouTube have, in the last few years, accumulated substantial and devoted audiences. Their politics are severe; they are culture warriors with a new set of weapons. They make their arguments for people who might not be reached by other media — and do so in a novel, medium-specific way. Those audiences get to know their hosts, and each other, developing those who develop into fandoms while simultaneously experiencing ideological formation. This is the simple case for the relevance of the YouTube Right, which I wrote about for The New York Times Magazine earlier this month. After it was published, controversy erupted over a Google employee’s memo criticizing his company’s attitudes toward diversity; when the employee was fired, he granted his first interview to Stefan Molyneux, a central figure in the movement (and the piece).
2017-08-12.headline_main: In the Land of Internet Subcultures, Try Not to Look Like a Tourist

2017-08-12.abstract: Peter Madsen is facing an involuntary manslaughter charge even though the journalist, Kim Wall, remains missing.
2017-08-12.snippet: Peter Madsen is facing an involuntary manslaughter charge even though the journalist, Kim Wall, remains missing.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: COPENHAGEN — Did a Danish submarine owner kill his only passenger, a Swedish journalist who had accompanied him onboard for a story?
2017-08-12.headline_main: Submarine Owner Is Charged in Journalist’s Disappearance

2017-08-12.abstract: Mixing it up with Richard Silvestri.
2017-08-12.snippet: Mixing it up with Richard Silvestri.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — Sometimes your imagination can run away with you and you run into the danger of overthinking things. I really enjoyed Richard Silvestri’s cryptic crossword, especially since I am solving a lot of them right now. But I honestly thought he had laid an egg in his grid.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Variety: Cryptic Crossword

2017-08-12.abstract: Protests of a plan to remove a statue of a Confederate general led to clashes that left at least one person dead and 34 others injured, officials said.
2017-08-12.snippet: Protests of a plan to remove a statue of a Confederate general led to clashes that left at least one person dead and 34 others injured, officials said.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va. — The city of Charlottesville was engulfed by violence on Saturday as white nationalists and counterprotesters clashed in one of the bloodiest fights to date over the removal of Confederate monuments across the South.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Man Charged After White Nationalist Rally in Charlottesville Ends in Deadly Violence

2017-08-12.abstract: Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel, is said to be in talks about interviewing current and former senior officials, including Reince Priebus, the recently ousted chief of staff.
2017-08-12.snippet: Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel, is said to be in talks about interviewing current and former senior officials, including Reince Priebus, the recently ousted chief of staff.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a sign that the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election will remain a continuing distraction for the White House, the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, is in talks with the West Wing about interviewing current and former senior administration officials, including the recently ousted White House chief of staff, Reince Priebus, according to three people briefed on the discussions.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Mueller Is Said to Seek Interviews With West Wing in Russia Case

2017-08-12.abstract: The American president is trying to enlist Beijing in his struggle with North Korea even as the White House is set to announce trade crackdown.
2017-08-12.snippet: The American president is trying to enlist Beijing in his struggle with North Korea even as the White House is set to announce trade crackdown.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — In a diplomatic gamble, President Trump is seeking to enlist China as a peacemaker in the bristling nuclear-edged dispute with North Korea at the very moment he plans to ratchet up conflict with Beijing over trade issues that have animated his political rise.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Trump Eyes China Sanctions While Seeking Its Help on North Korea

2017-08-12.abstract: Lawyers for the man, an investment banker, said they had “irrefutable proof” that he was in the United States during the time of the incident in May.
2017-08-12.snippet: Lawyers for the man, an investment banker, said they had “irrefutable proof” that he was in the United States during the time of the incident in May.

2017-08-12.headline_main: American Is Cleared After Woman Is Shoved Into Path of London Bus

2017-08-12.abstract: Many in Washington and capitals across the Pacific are wondering whether President Trump’s fusillade of apocalyptic threats was more method or madness.
2017-08-12.snippet: Many in Washington and capitals across the Pacific are wondering whether President Trump’s fusillade of apocalyptic threats was more method or madness.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: BRIDGEWATER, N.J. — After a four-day fusillade of apocalyptic threats against North Korea, President Trump left many in Washington and capitals throughout the Pacific wondering whether it was more method or madness. Among those wondering were members of Mr. Trump’s own administration.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Trump Threats Are Wild Card in Showdown With North Korea

2017-08-12.abstract: Many believe the election was rigged, even though international observers concluded that it was fair and transparent.
2017-08-12.snippet: Many believe the election was rigged, even though international observers concluded that it was fair and transparent.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: KISUMU, Kenya — The sun had barely risen, but protesters were already bracing for another wave of confrontations with the police in the city of Kisumu on Saturday after an election disputed by supporters of Kenya’s opposition party.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Protests Rage On in Kenya After President Is Re-Elected

2017-08-12.abstract: Give this environmentally conscious abolitionist his rightful place in history.
2017-08-12.snippet: Give this environmentally conscious abolitionist his rightful place in history.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: It was September 1738, and Benjamin Lay had walked 20 miles, subsisting on “acorns and peaches,” to reach the Quakers’ Philadelphia Yearly Meeting. Beneath his overcoat he wore a military uniform and a sword — both anathema to Quaker teachings. He also carried a hollowed-out book with a secret compartment, into which he had tucked a tied-off animal bladder filled with bright red pokeberry juice.
2017-08-12.headline_main: You’ll Never Be as Radical as This 18th-Century Quaker Dwarf

2017-08-12.abstract: The Mets are out of contention this season, but they still have a full outfield. That has made it difficult to find playing time for the 24-year-old Brandon Nimmo.
2017-08-12.snippet: The Mets are out of contention this season, but they still have a full outfield. That has made it difficult to find playing time for the 24-year-old Brandon Nimmo.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: The odds against Brandon Nimmo’s becoming a major league baseball player were perhaps more daunting than those of many other talented players who are taken in the draft.
2017-08-12.headline_main: A Mets Outfielder Waits, and Waits, to Show What He Can Do

2017-08-12.snippet: The governor of Virginia declared a state of emergency in Charlottesville Saturday as white nationalists clashed with counterprotesters over a plan to remove the statue of a Confederate general from a city park.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: The governor of Virginia declared a state of emergency in Charlottesville Saturday as white nationalists clashed with counterprotesters over a plan to remove the statue of a Confederate general from a city park.

2017-08-12.abstract: Breakthroughs in immunotherapy and a rush to develop profitable new treatments have brought a crush of clinical trials scrambling for patients.
2017-08-12.snippet: Breakthroughs in immunotherapy and a rush to develop profitable new treatments have brought a crush of clinical trials scrambling for patients.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: With the arrival of two revolutionary treatment strategies, immunotherapy and personalized medicine, cancer researchers have found new hope — and a problem that is perhaps unprecedented in medical research.
2017-08-12.headline_main: A Cancer Conundrum: Too Many Drug Trials, Too Few Patients

2017-08-12.abstract: Hiking on the Pacific Crest Trail with the family.
2017-08-12.snippet: Hiking on the Pacific Crest Trail with the family.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: ON THE PACIFIC CREST TRAIL, NORTHWEST OF TRUCKEE, Calif. — This will make me sound grouchy and misanthropic, but I sometimes wonder if what makes America great isn’t so much its people as its trees and mountains.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Fleeing to the Mountains

2017-08-12.abstract: The legitimacy of my voice shouldn’t depend on the degree of my oppression.
2017-08-12.snippet: The legitimacy of my voice shouldn’t depend on the degree of my oppression.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: I’m a white man, so you should listen to absolutely nothing I say, at least on matters of social justice. I have no standing. No way to relate. My color and gender nullify me, and it gets worse: I grew up in the suburbs. Dad made six figures. We had a backyard pool. From the 10th through 12th grades, I attended private school. So the only proper way for me to check my privilege is to realize that it blinds me to others’ struggles and should gag me during discussions about the right responses to them.
2017-08-12.headline_main: I’m a White Man. Hear Me Out.

2017-08-12.abstract: What I really should tell women who want both families and careers in national security.
2017-08-12.snippet: What I really should tell women who want both families and careers in national security.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: I held the syringe up to the light above the bathroom mirror and flicked it a few times with my finger to make sure I had the exact dose of Lupron. I checked my watch to calculate the time in Washington. I pulled the waistline of my pants below my belly button, steadied my feet, wiped my abdomen with an alcohol swab and took a deep breath.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Send the Breast Pump With the Defense Attaché

2017-08-12.abstract: Readers discuss a doctor’s qualms when a terminally ill patient sought her aid in dying.
2017-08-12.snippet: Readers discuss a doctor’s qualms when a terminally ill patient sought her aid in dying.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-08-12.headline_main: When Doctors Help End Lives

2017-08-12.abstract: The region’s meager pay becomes a reason for holding down the federal minimum wage and an excuse for tightfisted employers to stay that way.
2017-08-12.snippet: The region’s meager pay becomes a reason for holding down the federal minimum wage and an excuse for tightfisted employers to stay that way.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Workers at a Nissan plant in Canton, Miss., picked a bird in the hand when they recently voted against forming a union, and that’s understandable. Veteran workers, who generally opposed the union, make $26 an hour. That is less than the nearly $30 an hour for similar autoworkers in unions at the major American carmakers — but almost twice the median hourly wage in Mississippi.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Union’s Loss Is the South’s Loss, Too

2017-08-12.abstract: My daughter won’t know a Rakim. But a crew of 30 will never accost her on a hot Brooklyn night, either.
2017-08-12.snippet: My daughter won’t know a Rakim. But a crew of 30 will never accost her on a hot Brooklyn night, either.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: “Think I’m ready to come home, Daddy.”
2017-08-12.headline_main: Definition of Summer Madness

2017-08-12.abstract: What we have in common with Donald Trump: We all want to check Twitter on vacation.
2017-08-12.snippet: What we have in common with Donald Trump: We all want to check Twitter on vacation.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump is on vacation, but the White House has made it clear that it’s not a real vacation. It’s 17 days away from Washington, but it’s a working vacation. Actually, it’s more of a working remotely situation. Actually, he’s working so hard he may as well be at the White House, do you understand? If you don’t, just check Twitter, where he will be giving hourly updates about how not relaxing this getaway is!
2017-08-12.headline_main: The Vacation-Taker Denier in Chief

2017-08-12.abstract: America has held a largely romantic view of the tech industry that is at odds with reality.
2017-08-12.snippet: America has held a largely romantic view of the tech industry that is at odds with reality.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Google processes more than three billion search queries a day. It has altered our notions of privacy, tracking what we buy, what we search for online — and even our physical location at every moment of the day. Every business trying to reach mass-market consumer demand online knows that Google is the gatekeeper.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Google Doesn’t Want What’s Best for Us

2017-08-12.abstract: Depression-era policies conferred enormous benefits on whites, but many blacks were left out.
2017-08-12.snippet: Depression-era policies conferred enormous benefits on whites, but many blacks were left out.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Jeff Sessions told the Senate Judiciary Committee 20 years ago that affirmative action irritated people (he meant white people) because it could cause them to lose opportunities “simply because of their race.” This sense of grievance lies behind the Justice Department’s recent memo seeking lawyers to investigate “race-based discrimination” in college admissions.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Making Affirmative Action White Again

2017-08-12.abstract: The entwining of wars and famine has multiplied the magnitude of death and displacement in Somalia.
2017-08-12.snippet: The entwining of wars and famine has multiplied the magnitude of death and displacement in Somalia.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Mogadishu, Somalia — As I waited for my ride to collect me from the Mogadishu airport, an officer told me an apocryphal tale: A starving goat, blind from hunger, mistook a baby wrapped in a green cloth for grass and bit off a mouthful of emaciated flesh from the baby’s upper arm. The baby’s anguished cry brought the mother to her knees and she wept in prayer. The next day, a friend I met in Mogadishu repeated a variation of the same tale.
2017-08-12.headline_main: This Is What Hunger Looks Like — Again

2017-08-12.abstract: Stumbling toward Armageddon: Can two belligerent leaders living in deranged fantasy worlds tweet and taunt us into a nuclear war?
2017-08-12.snippet: Stumbling toward Armageddon: Can two belligerent leaders living in deranged fantasy worlds tweet and taunt us into a nuclear war?
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A couple of chubby brats with big missiles and short fuses.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Will the Blowhard Blow Us Up?

2017-08-12.abstract: The coming total eclipse of the sun has stirred imaginations as well as tourism.
2017-08-12.snippet: The coming total eclipse of the sun has stirred imaginations as well as tourism.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: By now, countless Americans are eagerly mapping their proximity to the “path of totality.” No, not the possible trajectories of North Korea’s ballistic missiles, lately much in the news. This path of totality refers to a far less threatening and far more joyous event: the moon’s total eclipse of the sun on Aug. 21 in a 70-mile-wide swath in which darkness will snuff out daylight for two minutes or so as it glides across 14 states, silencing the birds and bestirring the humans.
2017-08-12.headline_main: A Cosmic Distraction From Earth’s Troubles

2017-08-12.abstract: What J.F.K.’s crisis and Trump’s Korean challenge have in common.
2017-08-12.snippet: What J.F.K.’s crisis and Trump’s Korean challenge have in common.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Here’s the good news, America: The Donald Trump versus Kim Jong-un showdown may be making you nervous, but it isn’t the first time a reckless, lecherous U.S. president obsessed with his own vigor and out of his depth on foreign policy faced off against a thirtysomething dictator armed with nukes. If we survived the Cuban missile crisis without a thermonuclear war, there’s probably a way to get through this one, too.
2017-08-12.headline_main: The Missiles of August

2017-08-12.abstract: Yes, there was repression behind the Iron Curtain. But it wasn’t sexual.
2017-08-12.snippet: Yes, there was repression behind the Iron Curtain. But it wasn’t sexual.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: When Americans think of Communism in Eastern Europe, they imagine travel restrictions, bleak landscapes of gray concrete, miserable men and women languishing in long lines to shop in empty markets and security services snooping on the private lives of citizens. While much of this was true, our collective stereotype of Communist life does not tell the whole story.
2017-08-12.headline_main: Why Women Had Better Sex Under Socialism

2017-08-12.abstract: A Breitbart editor feels attacked by the most iconic American symbol.
2017-08-12.snippet: A Breitbart editor feels attacked by the most iconic American symbol.
2017-08-12.lead_paragraph: Vogue’s September issue is to the fashion world what the Super Bowl is to football, and on Wednesday the glossy magazine unveiled four covers for next month, all featuring the actress Jennifer Lawrence. On one cover, she is dressed in a crimson gown, leaning on the rail of a ferry with the Statue of Liberty glowing behind her. “American Beauty,” reads the cover’s text. “Jennifer Lawrence on love, liberty and the freedom to be herself.”
2017-08-12.headline_main: When Lady Liberty Triggers Trump Supporters

2017-08-12.abstract: The president is seeking to fulfill hard-edge campaign promises on trade without alienating Beijing during the crisis over North Korea’s nuclear weapons program.

2017-08-13.abstract: It is disheartening for black folk to see such a vile and despicable replay of history.
2017-08-13.snippet: It is disheartening for black folk to see such a vile and despicable replay of history.
2017-08-13.lead_paragraph: The late, great Gore Vidal said that we live in “The United States of Amnesia.” Our fatal forgetfulness flares when white bigots come out of their closets, emboldened by the tacit cover they’re given by our president. We cannot pretend that the ugly bigotry unleashed in the streets of Charlottesville, Va., this weekend has nothing to do with the election of Donald Trump.
2017-08-13.headline_main: Charlottesville and the Bigotocracy

2017-08-13.abstract: Lindsay Hunter discusses her new novel about a man’s road trip as he searches for his drug-addicted son.
2017-08-13.snippet: Lindsay Hunter discusses her new novel about a man’s road trip as he searches for his drug-addicted son.
2017-08-13.lead_paragraph: In two collections of stories and her debut novel, “Ugly Girls” (2014), Lindsay Hunter has written vividly about the gritty lives of people, often young women, on society’s margins. Now, in her second novel, “Eat Only When You’re Hungry,” she takes a different tack. The book’s protagonist, Greg, is a suburban 58-year-old man who goes off in search of his drug-addicted adult son, who’s been missing for three weeks.
2017-08-13.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: ‘Eat Only When You’re Hungry’

2017-08-13.snippet: The presence of fighters with the Syrian affiliate of Al Qaeda, and their increasing power in a patch of northern Syria, endangers the civilians who have sought refuge there from the country’s war.

2017-08-13.abstract: During heightened tensions, thousands of young people turned out to a concert near the demilitarized zone.
2017-08-13.snippet: During heightened tensions, thousands of young people turned out to a concert near the demilitarized zone.
2017-08-13.lead_paragraph: MUNSAN, South Korea — “We can’t have another Korean War. Do you agree with me?” Jung Ki-youl, chairman of the local government here, asked an estimated 25,000 mostly young South Koreans at Nuri Peace Park, only five miles from the demilitarized zone that separates the two Koreas. The crowd was eagerly awaiting a two-hour concert on Saturday night featuring some of the biggest stars of K-pop, a popular genre of music in South Korea.
2017-08-13.headline_main: In South Korea, K-Pop Pleads for Peace

2017-08-13.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — The story of Detroit’s July 1967 riots is, in some ways, a tale of two cities, one black and one white. Now, 50 years later, three neighboring museums here are revisiting that fateful summer with exhibitions that portray and explore the riots in sharply different ways.

2017-08-13.snippet: Rich Proulx treats us to a toothsome puzzle.
2017-08-13.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — My family is an omnivorous household in the sense that, if we were to average it out, we all eat just about anything. My older child is a vegetarian who is allergic to mushrooms and dislikes green salads, my younger child eats maybe three foods (most of which involve meat), and I’m quite happy to try anything, as long as it doesn’t involve liver, cottage cheese, or has the head still on it. So our bases are covered.

2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Several times during this season of “Twin Peaks,” right before an episode has ended with a musical performance, the show has featured brief scenes of young people talking at the Roadhouse. Sometimes these characters have returned later. But for the most part, these sketches have been disconnected to anything else happening on the show. They’ve functioned more as a reminder that the current generation of fresh-faced Twin Peaks residents is as mired in melodrama as Donna Hayward, Audrey Horne, Laura Palmer, James Hurley and Bobby Briggs once were.

2017-08-14.abstract: The sweet story of Cherie, Crystal, Sabrina, Tyrone and one foster kitten — who modeled Japanese sweets for T.
2017-08-14.snippet: The sweet story of Cherie, Crystal, Sabrina, Tyrone and one foster kitten — who modeled Japanese sweets for T.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: To pose alongside the almost 200 Japanese sweets we photographed for T’s Fall Women’s Issue, our photo director, Nadia Vellam, cast five fabulous … felines. With the exception of one fledgling foster kitten, the models were all perfectly trained professionals, having starred in luxury fashion campaigns and high-profile commercials. But on set, even they could not resist the bright bounty before them: Piles of artfully crafted jellies, cakes and bonbons in fairy-tale hues and dazzling shapes, each, coincidentally, about the size and color of a cat toy.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Meet the Cats

2017-08-14.abstract: Seventy years ago, millions of people were uprooted as British India was carved up along religious and political lines. Here are some of their stories.
2017-08-14.snippet: Seventy years ago, millions of people were uprooted as British India was carved up along religious and political lines. Here are some of their stories.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: August marks the 70th anniversary of the end of British colonial rule in India and the creation of the two independent countries of India and Pakistan, carved along religious and political lines. More than 10 million people were uprooted. We asked readers how they or their families were affected. These are some of their stories.
2017-08-14.headline_main: ‘At the Stroke of Midnight My Entire Family Was Displaced’

2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: North Korea’s success in testing an intercontinental ballistic missile that appears able to reach the United States was made possible by black-market purchases of powerful rocket engines probably from a Ukrainian factory with historical ties to Russia’s missile program, according to an expert analysis being published Monday and classified assessments by American intelligence agencies.
2017-08-14.headline_main: North Korea’s Missile Success Is Linked to Ukrainian Plant, Investigators Say

2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: The right-wing media is obsessed with the supposed stifling of “free speech” on college campuses, but it seems to care only about protecting speech it likes. When progressives make provocative statements, conservative pundits react with wounded outrage. This double standard is especially striking in the internet era, as the negative coverage of progressives leads to unbelievable harassment of both professors and students.

2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Opponents of the 2015 Iran nuclear deal often complain that the deal doesn’t address the nefarious ways in which Iran is expanding its influence and further destabilizing the Middle East. Such concerns, while valid, are no reason to blow up the agreement, as President Trump is recklessly trying to do by pressing his administration to declare, with absolutely no evidence, that Iran is in violation of the terms.

2017-08-14.abstract: Beth Dubber has been photographing L.A. for a decade, offering a decidedly lighthearted take on street photography in a city not known for it.
2017-08-14.snippet: Beth Dubber has been photographing L.A. for a decade, offering a decidedly lighthearted take on street photography in a city not known for it.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Instagram and iPhones didn’t exist when Beth Dubber began taking street photographs in Los Angeles in 2006. She had moved there in 2003, hoping for a career as a set photographer for film and television. While waiting for her big break, she joined a local networking group where she got the idea to photograph Los Angeles one day a week, and share one picture with a weekly email list. Remember, this was 2006: Social media hadn’t taken off, and the list forced her into a habit of shooting weekly, no matter what.
2017-08-14.headline_main: A Lighthearted Look at L.A.

2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: When you have a health problem, your first stop is probably to your primary care doctor. If you’ve found it harder to see your doctor in recent years, you could be tempted to blame the Affordable Care Act. As the health law sought to solve one problem, access to affordable health insurance, it risked creating another: too few primary care doctors to meet the surge in appointment requests from the newly insured.

2017-08-14.abstract: The country’s effort to take a lead in the technologies of the future, often with the help of foreign companies, is the subject of a United States trade investigation.
2017-08-14.snippet: The country’s effort to take a lead in the technologies of the future, often with the help of foreign companies, is the subject of a United States trade investigation.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — In Chinese schools, students learn that the United States became a great nation partly by stealing technology from Britain. In the halls of government, officials speak of the need to inspire innovation by protecting inventions. In boardrooms, executives strategize about using infringement laws to fell foreign rivals.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Seeking Greater Global Power, China Looks to Robots and Microchips

2017-08-14.abstract: Find some good pickled eggs — no, really — then mix them with mayonnaise and blue cheese, pile it high on toast, and have a ball.
2017-08-14.snippet: Find some good pickled eggs — no, really — then mix them with mayonnaise and blue cheese, pile it high on toast, and have a ball.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.
2017-08-14.headline_main: What to Cook Right Now

2017-08-14.abstract: The violence in Charlottesville, Va., is prompting a new push to relocate prominent symbols of the Confederacy.
2017-08-14.snippet: The violence in Charlottesville, Va., is prompting a new push to relocate prominent symbols of the Confederacy.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Officials in several states are calling for the removal of public monuments that have become controversial symbols of the Confederacy, driven by the national outcry over the violence in Charlottesville, Va., that erupted on Saturday during a protest organized by white nationalists.
2017-08-14.headline_main: State Leaders Call for Confederate Monuments to Be Removed

2017-08-14.abstract: Migrants from Somalia and Ethiopia, forced overboard from two boats last week, came ashore in war-torn Yemen. They were hoping to find work in the countries of the Persian Gulf.
2017-08-14.snippet: Migrants from Somalia and Ethiopia, forced overboard from two boats last week, came ashore in war-torn Yemen. They were hoping to find work in the countries of the Persian Gulf.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: KHOUBIA, Yemen — For more than 24 hours, they were forced to sit on the floor of a plastic boat as it lurched across the sea, forbidden to get up even if they needed to urinate or vomit. The dates they had brought to eat on the journey were taken. Near dawn, when their smuggler thought he saw the lights of a patrol boat, they were ordered to jump overboard.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Fleeing Hardship, Then Pushed Into Sea, They Landed in a Country at War

2017-08-14.abstract: The N.H.L. team quickly condemned the use of a modified version of its logo by some marchers at the white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Va., over the weekend.
2017-08-14.snippet: The N.H.L. team quickly condemned the use of a modified version of its logo by some marchers at the white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Va., over the weekend.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Among the Nazi and Confederate flags unfurled by white nationalists marching in Charlottesville, Va., over the weekend was an incongruous symbol: the logo of the Detroit Red Wings.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Detroit Red Wings Denounce Use of Logo by White Nationalist Group

2017-08-14.abstract: Suddenly, just like during the 19th and 20th centuries, beauty products aim to cleanse not just our bodies, but our souls as well. But why?
2017-08-14.snippet: Suddenly, just like during the 19th and 20th centuries, beauty products aim to cleanse not just our bodies, but our souls as well. But why?
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: IN 1838, Robert Collyer, a British-born medical student turned American mesmerist, described New York City as a place where ‘‘much quackery abounds, where any one who has the impudence may leave his foreplane, or lapstone, or latherbrush, and become a Physician; where any unlettered biped who has sufficient cant and hypocrisy may become a Minister of the Gospel.’’ A bit rich coming from a man who based his life’s work on animal magnetism and phrenology — the idea that the size and shape of a person’s cranium was directly correlated to his intelligence and character — but in the aftermath of the Second Great Awakening, his diagnosis was sound.
2017-08-14.headline_main: The Familiar Promise of Health and Happiness in a Bottle

2017-08-14.abstract: The Sketch Guy spent a long time courting creativity the hard way. Then he discovered a simple method to expedite the process.
2017-08-14.snippet: The Sketch Guy spent a long time courting creativity the hard way. Then he discovered a simple method to expedite the process.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: I don’t know when it happened, but it seems like being a creative person has become a function of how you look, who you hang out with, or what kinds of books you read while drinking something warm in a coffee shop.
2017-08-14.headline_main: When You Need Creativity to Strike, Make Way and Gear Up

2017-08-14.abstract: On Monday, a judge said he would not grant bail to James Alex Fields Jr., suspected of ramming his car into a crowd in a deadly attack in Virginia on Saturday.
2017-08-14.snippet: On Monday, a judge said he would not grant bail to James Alex Fields Jr., suspected of ramming his car into a crowd in a deadly attack in Virginia on Saturday.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va. — The man suspected of ramming his car into a crowd here, an attack that the authorities said left one person dead and 19 more injured, was denied bail during his first court appearance in a downtown courtroom on Monday.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Suspect in Charlottesville Car Attack Is Denied Bail in Court Appearance

2017-08-14.abstract: If you want to capture your own images of next week’s solar eclipse, be sure to protect your eyes and your camera first.
2017-08-14.snippet: If you want to capture your own images of next week’s solar eclipse, be sure to protect your eyes and your camera first.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Q. Is it safe to take pictures of the sun with my digital camera during the solar eclipse this month?
2017-08-14.headline_main: Safely Snapping the Sun’s Disappearing Act

2017-08-14.abstract: Tablestick grinders from Unicorn in Nantucket, Mass., take their design from a popular waiter’s tool.
2017-08-14.snippet: Tablestick grinders from Unicorn in Nantucket, Mass., take their design from a popular waiter’s tool.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: For many years, I have used a sleek black Magnum pepper mill. It’s efficient and easy to fill. Now Tom David — whose company, Unicorn, makes the Magnum and other styles in Nantucket, Mass. — has introduced a consumer version of his Pepperstick, a mill meant for waiters. Unlike the Pepperstick, which is designed to be carried in an apron and cannot stand on its own, the new Tablestick comes with a stand. It is sold in black, part of a set with a matching white salt grinder: Tablestick Salt and Pepper Grinders, $55.99, unicornmills.com.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Elegant Grinders for the Seasoning Set

2017-08-14.abstract: The producer of Bruce Cost Ginger Ale now makes Brooklyn Crafted, a ginger beer that is just right for cocktails.
2017-08-14.snippet: The producer of Bruce Cost Ginger Ale now makes Brooklyn Crafted, a ginger beer that is just right for cocktails.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: The company that produces Bruce Cost Ginger Ale, BCGA Concept Corporation, has introduced an extra-spicy ginger beer called Brooklyn Crafted. It is refreshing on its own as well as in mixed drinks and cocktails. There are bits of ginger in the unfiltered drink. Two sugar-free versions are sweetened with Stevia: Brooklyn Crafted, $1.79 for 12 ounces, four for $6.99, at Gourmet Garage stores and a pack of 12 for $24.75 at taldepot.com.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Extra Spice Gives Ginger Beer a Refreshing Kick

2017-08-14.abstract: Only 20, Zverev, a German, has made himself one of the faces of tennis’s next generation, and a favorite for the coming United States Open.
2017-08-14.snippet: Only 20, Zverev, a German, has made himself one of the faces of tennis’s next generation, and a favorite for the coming United States Open.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: MONTREAL — In a men’s tennis season dominated by the ageless veterans Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal, the Rogers Cup in Montreal last week served as a sort of coming out party for the next generation of tennis stars.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Alexander Zverev Rises to No. 7 While Playing ‘Best Tennis of My Life’

2017-08-14.abstract: D’Artagnan has added two new meats to its lineup of air-cured saucisson sec.
2017-08-14.snippet: D’Artagnan has added two new meats to its lineup of air-cured saucisson sec.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Saucisson sec, an air-cured French-style salami, is conveniently snackable. Now D’Artagnan, which has been making a meaty, garlicky and slightly chewy heritage pork version for some time, has added two more varieties. The duck is tangy, spicy and somewhat soft. The wild boar is richly earthy and my favorite of the three. All are shelf-stable, making them ideal for picnics: Saucisson sec, $10.99 for 6 ounces for duck and wild boar, $9.99 for pork, dartagnan.com.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Duck and Wild Boar Salami for Summer Picnics

2017-08-14.abstract: The florist Kelsie Hayes floats flowers, dangling them above the dinner table like acrobats in flight.
2017-08-14.snippet: The florist Kelsie Hayes floats flowers, dangling them above the dinner table like acrobats in flight.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: At an alfresco dinner on the edge of Lake Montauk last month, one long table was decorated with a charming and unusual floral arrangement. Individual blossoms hung upside-down from a wire strung over the table. “I wanted to do something different and fresh,” said Kelsie Hayes, the florist. “It gives a floating effect.” She uses 100-pound fishing line to run a single strand horizontally over the table, between posts mounted at both ends. At home, the fishing line could be pinned to a wall, posts, lights or other vertical fixtures. Then she uses a lighter line, 25 pounds, to tie to individual stems with double knots and hang them from the crosswire. That’s it: Popup Florist, Gansevoort Market, 353 West 14th Street (Ninth Avenue), thepopupflorist.com.
2017-08-14.headline_main: High-Wire Feat for Single-Stem Flowers

2017-08-14.abstract: The prospect of further regulatory actions against the bank, whose misdeeds are far-reaching, appear to be diminishing under the Trump administration.
2017-08-14.snippet: The prospect of further regulatory actions against the bank, whose misdeeds are far-reaching, appear to be diminishing under the Trump administration.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: There is an adage that “it’s better to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission.” In the world of corporate misconduct, it seems that there is even less need to beg forgiveness these days as the government scales back how much it will police companies that appear to have violated the law.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Wells Fargo Shows Erosion of Corporate Accountability Under Trump

2017-08-14.abstract: The New York Times is following reaction to President Trump’s mocking attack on the chief executive of Merck, who resigned from one of the president’s advisory councils.
2017-08-14.snippet: The New York Times is following reaction to President Trump’s mocking attack on the chief executive of Merck, who resigned from one of the president’s advisory councils.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Kenneth C. Frazier, chief executive of Merck, the pharmaceuticals company, on Monday resigned from President Trump’s American Manufacturing Council after the president failed to directly condemn the white nationalist protesters at the center of violent protests in Charlottesville, Va., over the weekend.
2017-08-14.headline_main: C.E.O.s React After Trump Attacks Merck Chief

2017-08-14.abstract: Eunji Lee, the pastry chef at Jungsik, has designed a dessert menu that becomes more indulgent as the evening progresses.
2017-08-14.snippet: Eunji Lee, the pastry chef at Jungsik, has designed a dessert menu that becomes more indulgent as the evening progresses.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Eunji Lee, the pastry chef at Jungsik, has taken an approach that is at once delectable and intelligent to her dessert tasting menu at the Korean restaurant in TriBeCa. The courses progress from light to rich, starting with a tart granita of omija (magnolia berry) with lemon-basil sorbet. A bright, cream-filled strawberry tart is followed by a lifelike “banana” made of white chocolate and ice cream. The brown-rice cream puff with ice cream and pecan praline is sheer indulgence. A black truffle ice cream cone is an optional extra ($25). The menu is served at the bar only; dessert libations are available to sip alongside: Dessert tasting menu, $55 ($35 extra for wine pairings), Jungsik, 2 Harrison Street (Hudson Street), 212-219-0900, jungsik.com.
2017-08-14.headline_main: A Luxurious Menu of Korean Desserts

2017-08-14.abstract: In her epistolary memoir, “The Book of Emma Reyes,” the Colombian painter recounts her childhood in Bogotá, made vivid by the horrors of the workhouse.
2017-08-14.snippet: In her epistolary memoir, “The Book of Emma Reyes,” the Colombian painter recounts her childhood in Bogotá, made vivid by the horrors of the workhouse.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: THE BOOK OF EMMA REYESA MemoirBy Emma ReyesTranslated with an introduction by Daniel Alarcón177 pages. Penguin Books. $24.
2017-08-14.headline_main: An Artist’s Childhood, Etched in Trauma and Abandonment

2017-08-14.abstract: Arcade Fire, which debuted at the top last week, slipped to No. 38 while the new album by Brett Eldredge opened at No. 2.
2017-08-14.snippet: Arcade Fire, which debuted at the top last week, slipped to No. 38 while the new album by Brett Eldredge opened at No. 2.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: After three months, Kendrick Lamar has returned to the top of the Billboard album chart in a slow week of music sales during which last week’s best-seller, Arcade Fire, plunged to No. 38.

2017-08-14.abstract: This new musical comedy is scheduled to open in August 2018 at the Belasco Theater. The early announcement shows the hot competition for audiences and space.

2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: “Gettin’ the Band Back Together,” a new musical comedy about, well, a group of middle-aged friends getting their high school band back together, is to open on Broadway next summer, the producers said on Monday.
2017-08-14.headline_main: ‘Gettin’ the Band Back Together’ to Open on Broadway Next Summer

2017-08-14.abstract: The British bands Slowdive and Ride achieved critical acclaim in the 1990s and recently released new albums that have reverberated on both sides of the Atlantic.
2017-08-14.snippet: The British bands Slowdive and Ride achieved critical acclaim in the 1990s and recently released new albums that have reverberated on both sides of the Atlantic.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: In May, the British band Slowdive, a pioneer in the shoegaze genre, played a pair of shows at  Brooklyn Steel in Williamsburg. Two months later, a wash of more muscular fuzz made its way up through the tiers of Terminal 5 as Ride took the stage at that Manhattan club. Both bands formed in England in the late 1980s, achieved critical acclaim in the 1990s, reunited in 2014 and released new albums in the past few months that have reverberated on both sides of the Atlantic.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Shoegaze, the Sound of Protest Shrouded in Guitar Fuzz, Returns

2017-08-14.abstract: Suspects linked to white supremacist groups or with a history of anti-immigrant rhetoric have been charged in a string of lone-wolf attacks this year.
2017-08-14.snippet: Suspects linked to white supremacist groups or with a history of anti-immigrant rhetoric have been charged in a string of lone-wolf attacks this year.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: The death of Heather D. Heyer, who was killed on Saturday after a man drove a car into counterprotesters at a white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Va., was the latest in a string of fatal attacks that have raised the specter of far-right, racist or anti-immigrant violence.
2017-08-14.headline_main: Before Charlottesville, a String of Killings Raised the Specter of Far-Right Violence

2017-08-14.abstract: A driver parked his taxi to take a break in SoHo. He died behind the wheel. Then, for nearly a day, New Yorkers went about their lives — just feet from his body.
2017-08-14.snippet: A driver parked his taxi to take a break in SoHo. He died behind the wheel. Then, for nearly a day, New Yorkers went about their lives — just feet from his body.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: At 12:34 p.m. last Tuesday, a taxi driver named Mehari Bokrezion pulled into an empty spot next to a basketball court in SoHo in Manhattan, beneath a sign that told cabbies they could park for an hour and get some relief. He closed his eyes. Soon, he took his last breath.
2017-08-14.headline_main: For 18 Hours, Cabby Sat Dead in Front Seat

2017-08-14.headline_main: On Four-State Tour, Democratic Leaders Try to Reconnect With Workers

2017-08-14.abstract: After a white nationalist protest in Virginia erupted into violence over the weekend, concerns have escalated over what Mr. Trump’s arrival in New York might provoke.

2017-08-14.snippet: VF, the owner of North Face and Timberland, is acquiring the maker of apparel for workers in manufacturing and construction — industries the president has promised to revitalize.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: If President Trump lives up to his slogan of making America great again, there will be many more workers in factories, mines and the like. And they will need clothing, durable threads that are not necessarily fashionable.

2017-08-14.abstract: A total solar eclipse brings tears, screams, even reverence to those in its path.

2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: Some people scream. Some people cry.
2017-08-14.headline_main: During an Eclipse, Darkness Falls and Wonder Rises

2017-08-14.abstract: Cadet Simone Askew breaks a barrier by becoming the first female African-American first captain at the United States Military Academy at West Point.
2017-08-14.snippet: Cadet Simone Askew breaks a barrier by becoming the first female African-American first captain at the United States Military Academy at West Point.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As a 6-year-old child camping in the Virginia woods, Simone Askew marched for fun, wielding a plastic gun and leading her young sister and friends in formation. A few years later, the sight of Navy midshipmen striding across an Annapolis football field solidified her desire to be the person who led troops.
2017-08-14.headline_main: West Point Cadet, Simone Askew, Breaks a Racial and Gender Barrier

2017-08-14.abstract: His new words on Charlottesville — muted and late — weren’t enough.
2017-08-14.snippet: His new words on Charlottesville — muted and late — weren’t enough.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: We saw Donald Trump’s true colors on Saturday, when he was given the chance — a ready-made moment for presidential grace — to denounce the neo-Nazis in Charlottesville, Va., and instead found wrongdoing “on many sides.” That was Trump minus the pressure and the planning. That was his initial instinct, his first impulse.
2017-08-14.headline_main: President Trump Cannot Redeem Himself

2017-08-14.abstract: The neo-Nazi website had published a highly derogatory article about Heather Heyer, a Virginia woman who was fatally run over during the white supremacist rally in Charlottesville, Va.
2017-08-14.snippet: The neo-Nazi website had published a highly derogatory article about Heather Heyer, a Virginia woman who was fatally run over during the white supremacist rally in Charlottesville, Va.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: GoDaddy Inc., the web hosting company, severed ties with The Daily Stormer, a neo-Nazi and white supremacy website, after the site posted an article mocking Heather D. Heyer, the 32-year-old woman who was killed when a man drove into a crowd during a rally of white nationalists in Charlottesville, Va., on Saturday.
2017-08-14.headline_main: GoDaddy Severs Ties With Daily Stormer After Charlottesville Article

2017-08-14.abstract: Netia Jones’s staging of Hans Zender’s “composed interpretation” at Mostly Mozart added several layers of concept to the song cycle “Winterreise.”
2017-08-14.snippet: Netia Jones’s staging of Hans Zender’s “composed interpretation” at Mostly Mozart added several layers of concept to the song cycle “Winterreise.”
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: “The first and greatest of concept albums” is what the excellent English tenor Ian Bostridge calls Schubert’s song cycle “Winterreise” in his 2015 book, “Schubert’s Winter Journey: Anatomy of an Obsession.”
2017-08-14.headline_main: Review: A Funky Rethinking of Schubert’s Winter Journey

2017-08-14.abstract: Survivors in Freetown, the capital, resorted to stacking bodies on soccer fields, after heavy rain and mudslides killed as many as 200 people.
2017-08-14.snippet: Survivors in Freetown, the capital, resorted to stacking bodies on soccer fields, after heavy rain and mudslides killed as many as 200 people.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal — Torrents of water rushed through the streets of the Sierra Leone capital of Freetown on Monday, causing mudslides that killed hundreds and trapped hundreds more in their homes and vehicles, officials said.
2017-08-14.headline_main: ‘All We See Is Dead Bodies’: Sierra Leone Floods and Mudslides Ravage Freetown

2017-08-14.abstract: The coming solar eclipse will be a wondrous sight — if you get into viewing position in time, the clouds cooperate and you’re ready to have your mind blown.
2017-08-14.snippet: The coming solar eclipse will be a wondrous sight — if you get into viewing position in time, the clouds cooperate and you’re ready to have your mind blown.
2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: The United States has not seen a total solar eclipse sail from sea to shining sea in nearly a century. That means that next Monday, when the moon engulfs the sun in the sky, a new generation will experience a celestial extravaganza unlike anything else.
2017-08-14.headline_main: An Eclipse Chaser’s Guide to Your First Eclipse

2017-08-14.abstract: With the sun obscured, eclipses can be revelatory: Starting at least over 2,000 years ago, they have been fodder for significant discoveries.

2017-08-14.lead_paragraph: LONDON — “How do you know that something is alive?” That question is posed in the program for Wayne McGregor’s new “+/- Human” about the seven white computer-programmed orbs that float above 15 dancers, moving in ever-changing swarmlike patterns. The giant spheres are by the experimental art collective Random International (famous for its immensely popular “Rain Room”), and they maintain a mysterious relationship to the dancers throughout “+/- Human,” which opened at the Roundhouse here on Friday.

2017-08-15.abstract: Modesty is the most powerful answer. It means having the courage to see the world as complicated and progress as a product of balancing competing truths.
2017-08-15.snippet: Modesty is the most powerful answer. It means having the courage to see the world as complicated and progress as a product of balancing competing truths.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: We’re living in an age of anxiety. The country is being transformed by complex forces like changing demographics and technological disruption. Many people live within a bewildering freedom, without institutions to trust, unattached to compelling religions and sources of meaning, uncertain about their own lives. Anxiety is not so much a fear of a specific thing but a fear of everything, an unnamable dread about the future. People will do anything to escape it.
2017-08-15.headline_main: How to Roll Back Fanaticism

2017-08-15.abstract: The STEM talent pipeline is important. But what about the qualified female candidates right across the table?
2017-08-15.snippet: The STEM talent pipeline is important. But what about the qualified female candidates right across the table?
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: I am the co-founder of a company that helps clients find ways to diversify their work force. We recently set up an interview at a major company for a senior African-American woman software engineer. After meeting with the hiring panel, she withdrew her application, telling us she felt demeaned by the all-white male group that failed to ask her any questions about her coding skills. She described how one of the men had made it clear to her that she wasn’t a cultural fit and that therefore they didn’t need to proceed with technical questions.
2017-08-15.headline_main: The Maddeningly Simple Way Tech Companies Can Employ More Women

This investigation will provide the evidence for holding China accountable for a decades-long assault on the intellectual property of the United States and its allies.
2017-08-15.headline_main: China’s Intellectual Property Theft Must Stop

2017-08-15.abstract: San Francisco Bay was the heart of the counterculture. It was also the heart of the American effort in Vietnam.
2017-08-15.snippet: San Francisco Bay was the heart of the counterculture. It was also the heart of the American effort in Vietnam.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: In 1967, an ocean away from the escalating Vietnam War, the Summer of Love bloomed with psychedelic colors in San Francisco’s Haight Ashbury neighborhood. Most of us remember the two events as distinct phenomena: One was a story of firebases, napalm, jungles and the draft; the other of communes, L.S.D., flowers and rock music. In fact, the two were inextricably linked.
2017-08-15.headline_main: Summer of Love, Summer of War

2017-08-15.abstract: For the poor to find a way forward, they need confidence in their own abilities.
2017-08-15.snippet: For the poor to find a way forward, they need confidence in their own abilities.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: Seventeen years ago, Mauricio Lim Miller, a leader in the field of social services, received a phone call from Jerry Brown, who was the mayor of Oakland, Calif., at the time, that set him on a quest to understand how families really overcome poverty. Lim Miller had spent decades working in community development, leading an organization, Asian Neighborhood Design, that had grown into a nationally recognized model. In 1999, Lim Miller was one of the honorees, along with Rosa Parks, invited by President Bill Clinton to attend the State of the Union address.
2017-08-15.headline_main: When Families Lead Themselves Out of Poverty

2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: The legacy of El Salvador’s brutal civil war is etched on Raúl Valladares’s face in blue ink. “Eighteen” declares what he was, a member of one of El Salvador’s feared maras, or gangs, whose ruthless violence still spurs many of his countrymen to seek safe haven in the United States. Yet once here, they can’t really escape the violence, as we have seen with the spate of murders in Central American communities on Long Island in recent years.

2017-08-15.abstract: In the evolution of toy crazes since Beanie Babies, an object lesson in how technology has thrown the consumer economy into chaos.
2017-08-15.snippet: In the evolution of toy crazes since Beanie Babies, an object lesson in how technology has thrown the consumer economy into chaos.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, when Christine Osborne first realized that fidget spinners — those small devices that have, seemingly overnight, colonized playgrounds and classrooms — were going to become a huge hit, she felt a deep anxiety. This was surprising, because Osborne owns multiple toy stores in South Carolina. Twenty years ago, she would have greeted a new fad like fidget spinners with glee. But the economy has changed quite a bit in the last two decades, and so when Osborne began first noticing the spinner craze, all she could think was: This seems like trouble.
2017-08-15.headline_main: The Rise of the Fidget Spinner and the Fall of the Well-Managed Fad

2017-08-15.abstract: Writers like August Wilson, John Edgar Wideman and Michael Chabon have used the city as a backdrop for their stories.
2017-08-15.snippet: Writers like August Wilson, John Edgar Wideman and Michael Chabon have used the city as a backdrop for their stories.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: Of the 10 plays August Wilson wrote — two of which won him the Pulitzer Prize — nine were based in and around the Hill District in Pittsburgh; he chronicled the city’s changing landscape over decades. He is not the only writer to have chosen the Steel City as a backdrop. Below, one book explores the places that influenced Mr. Wilson’s plays, and two others reimagine Pittsburgh’s people and culture.
2017-08-15.headline_main: What to Read Before You Head to Pittsburgh

2017-08-15.abstract: We argue over violent speech, violent deeds, structural violence, symbolic violence. Are we spoiling for a fight, or trying to prevent one?
2017-08-15.snippet: We argue over violent speech, violent deeds, structural violence, symbolic violence. Are we spoiling for a fight, or trying to prevent one?
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: When did our national discourse become so consumed with the state of our national discourse? Rarely has so much public dialogue been dedicated to arguing over what can’t be said, who can’t say it and just how they shouldn’t put it. It has always been politically profitable to frame your opponents’ rhetoric as irrational, cruel, even dangerous. But our now-­constant public skirmishes over speech have moved to another level entirely: These days, the closer you can situate your opponents’ words to actual violence, the better.
2017-08-15.headline_main: America Is Struggling to Sort Out Where ‘Violence’ Begins and Ends

2017-08-15.abstract: Exploring the world Wilson wrote about isn’t easy: many of the hubs of black life he chronicled are gone. But the changing world is what defined his works.
2017-08-15.snippet: Exploring the world Wilson wrote about isn’t easy: many of the hubs of black life he chronicled are gone. But the changing world is what defined his works.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: As soon as you emerge from the Fort Pitt Tunnel in Pittsburgh the city’s impressive skyline appears, with the 44-story Art Deco Gulf Tower and the glassy, neo-Gothic PPG Place accentuating the view. Those two buildings tell the tale of the city. Once defined by its production of iron and steel, along with the ensuing smog, Pittsburgh now has self-driving cars being tested on its streets and rapid gentrification in many of its historically blue-collar neighborhoods.
2017-08-15.headline_main: August Wilson’s Pittsburgh

2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: An air of fustiness hovers over the very words ‘‘wicker furniture’’: One imagines sepia-toned photos of peacock-backed chairs on verandas in colonial India, and ornately curved chaises in Victorian conservatories. And indeed, the style is old — while wicker’s apex was in the 19th century, when trade routes from Asia brought a steady supply of rattan to Europe, the art of weaving objects from natural fibers actually goes back at least as far as ancient Egypt.
2017-08-15.headline_main: The Last Days of Wicker

2017-08-15.abstract: Sexual hypocrisy fuels a South African film about teenagers undergoing a circumcision ritual.
2017-08-15.snippet: Sexual hypocrisy fuels a South African film about teenagers undergoing a circumcision ritual.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: Young men and their elders together experiencing the rigors of the wilderness is a kind of rite all over the world. It can be a time of self-discovery and liberation. In “The Wound,” a group of South African teenagers and their adult caretakers gather in a camp near mountains to observe a Xhosa ritual. The young men, called novitiates, are circumcised, and spend multiple weeks in the camp healing under supervision of the adults, who themselves underwent the procedure years before.

2017-08-15.abstract: Inside the jewelry designer Raphaël Van Gend’s six-story 1920s townhouse in Brussels, after its gut renovation.
2017-08-15.snippet: Inside the jewelry designer Raphaël Van Gend’s six-story 1920s townhouse in Brussels, after its gut renovation.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: IN THE HANDS of Raphaël Van Gend, almost anything is possible. At 43, the Belgian-born designer has been a ballet dancer (he trained at Academy Saussin); a painter (he studied at the Brussels Royal Academy of Fine Arts); and a fashion model in New York City in the mid-90s. In 2000, Van Gend returned to Europe and opened a creative agency in Paris, representing photographers like Matthieu Salvaing and fashion designers such as Charles Anastase. On the side, he studied the spiritual philosophy of Jiddu Krishnamurti and produced electronic music albums. ‘‘I’m always searching, that’s my way. It’s very touche-à-tout,’’ which, Van Gend explains, is French for ‘‘someone who dabbles.’’ ‘‘I work intuitively but that means I don’t always know where I’m headed.’’
2017-08-15.headline_main: A Home So Uncluttered That It Almost Looks Empty

2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: SOLA PASTA BAR Four years ago, Massimo Sola saw a chef tossing pasta and sauce in a wok, and immediately he understood how effective the Chinese cooking utensil could be for the task. So now, at his pasta restaurant in SoHo, he’s using woks. There are five of them set into electric burners in the square kitchen that occupies most of the space, where chefs prepare pasta dishes in full view. “The chefs do the cooking and serving,” said Mr. Sola, who received a Michelin star in Varese, Italy. “They can explain and interact with the customers.” Mr. Sola’s menu features eight pastas, mostly familiar ones like penne all’arrabbiata, linguine with clams, fettuccine Bolognese and tagliatelle with porcini. A few salads, antipasti and desserts are also served. There are 16 seats at the kitchen counter, another 10 at a communal table to one side and 44 at banquette tables along one wall. (Opens Wednesday): 330 West Broadway (Grand Street), 646-692-4131, chefsola.com.
2017-08-15.headline_main: Sola Pasta Bar, From a Michelin-Starred Chef, Opens in SoHo

2017-08-15.abstract: The photographer is selling work from a few of his favorite artists, including Marilyn Minter and Martin Parr.
2017-08-15.snippet: The photographer is selling work from a few of his favorite artists, including Marilyn Minter and Martin Parr.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: “Easy is boring!” says the photographer Mario Testino, discussing his approach to buying art. “Sometimes I saw a work and didn’t like it. But then I’d ask myself why and come back to it. Some of the works that I had problems with are now my favorites.” Testino began collecting photography in the early 1980s — his first purchase was a portrait of the actress Vivien Leigh by the Surrealist photographer Angus McBean. Since then, he has amassed a formidable collection of contemporary photography that is unexpectedly subversive given the over-the-top glamour of Testino’s own subjects (“Not all my images are so glamorous!” he demurs). Part of his collection will be auctioned online at Sotheby’s from Sept. 1-15 to benefit Museo Mate in Lima, Peru, a nonprofit established by Testino in 2012. Above are our favorite images from the sale.
2017-08-15.headline_main: Amazing Photographs From Mario Testino’s Personal Collection

2017-08-15.snippet: Discord, a chat app for video game players, became a digital home for the alt-right before deciding to ban their chat rooms on Monday.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: They posted swastikas and praised Hitler in chat rooms with names like “National Socialist Army” and “Führer’s Gas Chamber.” They organized last weekend’s “Unite the Right” rally in Charlottesville, Va., connecting several major white supremacy groups for an intimidating display of force. And when that rally turned deadly, with the killing of a 32-year-old counterdemonstrator, they cheered and discussed holding a gathering at the woman’s funeral.
2017-08-15.headline_main: This Was the Alt-Right’s Favorite Chat App. Then Came Charlottesville.

2017-08-15.abstract: Wesley Morris and Jenna Wortham discuss the violence in Charlottesville.
2017-08-15.snippet: Wesley Morris and Jenna Wortham discuss the violence in Charlottesville.
2017-08-15.lead_paragraph: Expressions of white supremacy in this country aren’t new. But what happened in Charlottesville, Va., over the weekend was the largest public melee during a presidential administration that includes men with white nationalist ties. Three people were killed, dozens of people were injured and the country was thrown into a state of anguish and shock. The show was on vacation, but we came back early to talk about Charlottesville and why the violence there isn’t surprising, what it means to remove totems of the American Confederacy and what a verbal apology from President Trump is really worth.
2017-08-15.headline_main: Still Processing: Anguish and Anger Over Charlottesville
