2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: LONG BEACH, Calif. — If Ed Cunningham had not already seen enough, he would be back in a broadcast booth on Saturday afternoon, serving as the color analyst for another top college football game televised on ABC or ESPN. It is the work he has done each fall for nearly 20 years.
2017-08-30.headline_main: ESPN Football Analyst Walks Away, Disturbed by Brain Trauma on Field

2017-08-30.abstract: Crisscrossing Spain, a fleet of trucks gives viewers a new perspective on art as it zooms by on the highway.
2017-08-30.snippet: Crisscrossing Spain, a fleet of trucks gives viewers a new perspective on art as it zooms by on the highway.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: MADRID — Jaime Colsa owns a transport company that delivers ordinary consumer goods — computers, food, drinks. The contents of his trucks aren’t eye-catching, but his vehicles certainly are, adorned with paintings showing cartoonlike faces, dogs, brightly colored geometric patterns, spirals and landscapes.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Putting Art on Wheels and Taking It Back to the Streets

2017-08-30.abstract: Unclebrother, opened by Gavin Brown and Rirkrit Tiravanija in the town of Hancock, N.Y., is part restaurant, part art gallery.
2017-08-30.snippet: Unclebrother, opened by Gavin Brown and Rirkrit Tiravanija in the town of Hancock, N.Y., is part restaurant, part art gallery.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Type “250 East Front Street Hancock NY” into Google Street View and you’ll see a forlorn, aqua green car dealership, the kind of empty business that dots so many main streets in the Catskill Mountains these days.
2017-08-30.headline_main: A Catskills Art Scene Makes a Splash With Free Curry

2017-08-30.abstract: This Labor Day weekend is not the last long holiday weekend of the year, but it’s the last one of this summer. Here are five trip itineraries to consider from our 36 Hours series.
2017-08-30.snippet: This Labor Day weekend is not the last long holiday weekend of the year, but it’s the last one of this summer. Here are five trip itineraries to consider from our 36 Hours series.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: This Labor Day weekend in the United States is not the last long holiday weekend of the year, but it’s the last one of this summer. Why not take advantage of that extra day off to explore a new destination while it’s still warm? Here are five trip itineraries to consider from our 36 Hours series.
2017-08-30.headline_main: 5 Last-Minute Labor Day Destinations

2017-08-30.abstract: The rebuke by Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein said the president’s words could incite violence and had potentially dangerous consequences outside the United States.
2017-08-30.snippet: The rebuke by Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein said the president’s words could incite violence and had potentially dangerous consequences outside the United States.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: GENEVA — The United Nations human rights chief said on Wednesday that President Trump’s repeated denunciations of some media outlets as “fake news” could amount to incitement to violence and had potentially dangerous consequences outside the United States.
2017-08-30.headline_main: U.N. Human Rights Chief Condemns Trump’s Attacks on Media

2017-08-30.abstract: Scientists found in the remote rain forests in British Columbia that letting people hunt more moose led to fewer wolves and more endangered mountain caribou.
2017-08-30.snippet: Scientists found in the remote rain forests in British Columbia that letting people hunt more moose led to fewer wolves and more endangered mountain caribou.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: You like caribou. You like wolves. How do you preserve one without killing the other? Research supporting an unusual conservation approach suggests that it may have something to do with hunting moose, at least in one region of North America.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Hunting Moose in Canada to Save Caribou From Wolves

2017-08-30.abstract: Thirty partygoers board a bus bound for secret location and an immersive theater piece featuring a banquet, a naked swim and a plea for animal rights.
2017-08-30.snippet: Thirty partygoers board a bus bound for secret location and an immersive theater piece featuring a banquet, a naked swim and a plea for animal rights.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The revelers gathered Saturday evening outside a store on the Upper East Side with taxidermied parrots in the window: women in floor-kissing gowns and little black dresses, men in suits.
2017-08-30.headline_main: A Mystery Ball Where the Illuminati Have Cloven Hooves

2017-08-30.abstract: The deaths of several children, after oxygen was cut off for nonpayment of bills, result in charges of culpable homicide.
2017-08-30.snippet: The deaths of several children, after oxygen was cut off for nonpayment of bills, result in charges of culpable homicide.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — The chief of the Indian medical college where dozens of sick children died this month after the oxygen supply ran out has been arrested on charges of culpable homicide, the Indian authorities have said.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Head of Indian Medical College and His Wife Charged in Oxygen Shortage

2017-08-30.abstract: The average age of new dads in the United States has risen to almost 31, higher than ever.
2017-08-30.snippet: The average age of new dads in the United States has risen to almost 31, higher than ever.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: New fathers in the United States are getting older.
2017-08-30.headline_main: New Fathers Are Older Than Ever

2017-08-30.abstract: Federal officials say they have learned from the mistakes of Katrina and are taking their lead from local leaders. They are poised to help where needed.
2017-08-30.snippet: Federal officials say they have learned from the mistakes of Katrina and are taking their lead from local leaders. They are poised to help where needed.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: SEGUIN, Texas — More than 400 trailers packed with water, food, tarps and generators line a vacant airstrip in the farmland just northeast of San Antonio that has been transformed into a bustling logistics hub. Crews from the Department of Defense and the Federal Emergency Management Agency are working to dispatch aid to storm victims.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Trucks With Aid Roll Into FEMA Hub. Getting Aid Out Is the Challenge.

2017-08-30.abstract: For “Oh My Sweet Land,” Amir Nizar Zuabi’s one-woman play, Nadine Malouf will make fragrant kibbe while recounting stories of displacement in the Middle East.
2017-08-30.snippet: For “Oh My Sweet Land,” Amir Nizar Zuabi’s one-woman play, Nadine Malouf will make fragrant kibbe while recounting stories of displacement in the Middle East.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The rehearsal room smelled of onions slackening in a pan. They hissed on the stove, in the basement of a Lutheran church in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, as Nadine Malouf hacked at a slab of beef, her eyes fixed on her director, Amir Nizar Zuabi, and not the knife, which was closing in on her fingertips.
2017-08-30.headline_main: The Kitchen Is Her Stage. (It Could Actually Be Your Kitchen.)

2017-08-30.abstract: Tourists are visiting popular attractions that they see on Instagram, like the pink doors of a restaurant or a candy store.
2017-08-30.snippet: Tourists are visiting popular attractions that they see on Instagram, like the pink doors of a restaurant or a candy store.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: When Ashley Buchanan, a graduate student from Tampa, Fla., visited New York City a few weeks ago, she skipped the Statue of Liberty, the Empire State Building and the top of Rockefeller Center and headed to a tourist attraction she had bookmarked after seeing someone posing beside it on Instagram: the pink door of a restaurant on Delancey Street.
2017-08-30.headline_main: New York City’s Newest Hot Spot? Check Instagram

2017-08-30.abstract: The second allied strike since Monday to kill civilians comes a little more than a week after President Trump announced his new strategy for the war.
2017-08-30.snippet: The second allied strike since Monday to kill civilians comes a little more than a week after President Trump announced his new strategy for the war.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — At least 11 civilians were killed Wednesday in American airstrikes in southeastern Afghanistan, witnesses and officials said, the second deadly allied strike in three days to add to the country’s mounting civilian death toll.
2017-08-30.headline_main: At Least 11 Afghan Civilians Killed in American Airstrikes

2017-08-30.abstract: For 10 years, Governors Island has hosted the opposite of a big commercial art fair. It’s welcoming and intimate.
2017-08-30.snippet: For 10 years, Governors Island has hosted the opposite of a big commercial art fair. It’s welcoming and intimate.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: A lot of things have changed on Governors Island since 2008, when work began to turn the rundown former Coast Guard base into a grand park in New York Harbor. Ferry service now runs seven days a week during the season. You can drink the water. And acres of open space have been built where drab military housing once stood.
2017-08-30.headline_main: An Art Fair for the 99 Percent

2017-08-30.abstract: A mashed potato salad, the result of overmixing, can be a very good thing indeed, worth even making on purpose.
2017-08-30.snippet: A mashed potato salad, the result of overmixing, can be a very good thing indeed, worth even making on purpose.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Mashed potato salad seems like the kind of thing a person might make by mistake.
2017-08-30.headline_main: An Accidentally Creamier, Fluffier Potato Salad

2017-08-30.abstract: Daniil Simkin takes over the Guggenheim Rotunda with a high-tech show, “Falls the Shadow.”
2017-08-30.snippet: Daniil Simkin takes over the Guggenheim Rotunda with a high-tech show, “Falls the Shadow.”
2017-08-30.headline_main: Bouncing Off the Walls

2017-08-30.abstract: Members of the Onondaga Nation wanted one of their own as principal. In a compromise, a Native American teacher will be groomed to possibly take over.
2017-08-30.snippet: Members of the Onondaga Nation wanted one of their own as principal. In a compromise, a Native American teacher will be groomed to possibly take over.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: A dispute over who should lead an elementary school that serves almost exclusively Native American children has been resolved, just in time for the start of classes next week.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Compromise Reached in Boycott of Native American School

2017-08-30.abstract: Shows of work by Helen Frankenthaler at the Clark and Elizabeth King at Mass MoCA capture two risk-taking artists.
2017-08-30.snippet: Shows of work by Helen Frankenthaler at the Clark and Elizabeth King at Mass MoCA capture two risk-taking artists.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: WILLIAMSTOWN, MASS. — What do we talk about when we talk about abstraction? Two small, illuminating exhibitions of work by Helen Frankenthaler at the Clark Art Institute, one of paintings and the other of woodcuts, together suggest nature lurks throughout the imagery of this ostensibly unyielding formalist. At nearby Mass MoCA, the question is what makes figuration go live, raised by Elizabeth King in work that marries exacting handcraft and digital technology.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Berkshire Tour: Formalism Relaxes, Handcraft Goes Digital

2017-08-30.abstract: The killing of a man accused of stealing an amplifier from a mosque has opened a discussion about why vigilante violence is still common.
2017-08-30.snippet: The killing of a man accused of stealing an amplifier from a mosque has opened a discussion about why vigilante violence is still common.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: BEKASI, Indonesia — His last words were: “I’m not a thief.”
2017-08-30.headline_main: Lynched Over an Amplifier: Mob Justice Alarms Indonesians

2017-08-30.abstract: Mr. Pratchett, a wildly popular fantasy novelist who died in 2015, had requested that his unfinished work and computers be destroyed.
2017-08-30.snippet: Mr. Pratchett, a wildly popular fantasy novelist who died in 2015, had requested that his unfinished work and computers be destroyed.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Terry Pratchett, the well-known British fantasy author, had a wish fulfilled two years after his death: A hard drive containing his unpublished work was destroyed by steamroller.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Terry Pratchett’s Unpublished Work Crushed by Steamroller

2017-08-30.abstract: Volunteers came with their vessels from Baton Rouge, La., to Houston to assist in the rescue operation after Hurricane Harvey.
2017-08-30.snippet: Volunteers came with their vessels from Baton Rouge, La., to Houston to assist in the rescue operation after Hurricane Harvey.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Calling themselves the Cajun Navy, volunteers with bass boats, airboats and other small recreational vessels set off in a caravan from Baton Rouge, La., on Monday, bound for flood-devastated Houston.
2017-08-30.headline_main: ‘Cajun Navy’ Scours Houston Floodwaters for Stranded Residents

2017-08-30.abstract: Tiafoe, 19, learned the game as a son of a worker at the Junior Tennis Champions Center in College Park, Md.
2017-08-30.snippet: Tiafoe, 19, learned the game as a son of a worker at the Junior Tennis Champions Center in College Park, Md.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Frances Tiafoe, a 19-year-old from Hyattsville, Md., pushed  Roger Federer, a 19-time Grand Slam champion, deep into a fifth set in the first round of the United States Open on Tuesday night under the roof of Arthur Ashe Stadium before losing, 4-6, 6-2, 6-1, 1-6, 6-4.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Who Is Frances Tiafoe? Federer Sure Found Out

2017-08-30.abstract: David Madden, Fox’s president of entertainment, is leaving the network and is in discussions to lead programming at AMC. He will be replaced by Michael Thorn.
2017-08-30.snippet: David Madden, Fox’s president of entertainment, is leaving the network and is in discussions to lead programming at AMC. He will be replaced by Michael Thorn.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Fox tapped a new president of entertainment on Wednesday, as it continued to try to find a solution for its struggling programming slate. And the move may have opened the door for AMC to claim a new programming chief of its own.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Top Fox TV Executive Exiting, and May Join AMC

2017-08-30.abstract: Danielle Allen’s new book is about her cousin’s troubled life and death, and his experience in and out of the California criminal justice system.
2017-08-30.snippet: Danielle Allen’s new book is about her cousin’s troubled life and death, and his experience in and out of the California criminal justice system.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: On Sept. 17, 1995, Michael Allen attempted to carjack the Cadillac of a 44-year-old man in a drab neighborhood of Los Angeles. Allen didn’t have a driver’s license, and he didn’t have much of a talent for violent crime, either. He kept his gun pointed toward the ground the entire time, allowing his victim the chance to wrestle it from him and shoot him through the neck. In the ambulance, Allen immediately confessed to his offense; in the hospital, he waived his Miranda rights and added — out of guilt? naïveté? fear? — that he’d committed four robberies within the previous two weeks.
2017-08-30.headline_main: ‘Cuz’ Mourns a Loss and Denounces a System

2017-08-30.abstract: In Mumbai, a megacity of 18 million where torrential rain is an annual reality, the comparisons to Houston have not gone unnoticed.
2017-08-30.snippet: In Mumbai, a megacity of 18 million where torrential rain is an annual reality, the comparisons to Houston have not gone unnoticed.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — For many of the poor in this city, each year contains just two seasons: the demolition season and the rain.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Coping With Floods Is Only Half the Battle for Mumbai’s Poor

2017-08-30.abstract: At least 18,500 people have sought refuge across the border amid violence between militants and security forces in Myanmar.
2017-08-30.snippet: At least 18,500 people have sought refuge across the border amid violence between militants and security forces in Myanmar.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The number of Rohingya, a predominantly Muslim ethnic group, who have fled from Myanmar to Bangladesh since border clashes erupted five days ago has reached at least 18,500, the United Nations’ International Office of Migration said on Wednesday.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Violence in Myanmar Pushes at Least 18,500 Rohingya Into Bangladesh

2017-08-30.abstract: Dr. Yazdi’s calls for moderation were tolerated because of his early kinship with Ayatollah Khomeini, the father of the Iranian revolution.
2017-08-30.snippet: Dr. Yazdi’s calls for moderation were tolerated because of his early kinship with Ayatollah Khomeini, the father of the Iranian revolution.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Ibrahim Yazdi, who emerged as Iran’s foremost dissident after being rejected by fellow revolutionaries as insufficiently radical because he had rebuffed their seizure of the United States Embassy in Tehran in 1979, died on Sunday in Izmir, in western Turkey. He was 85.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Ibrahim Yazdi, Leading Iranian Dissident, Dies at 85

2017-08-30.abstract: Near Virunga National Park in the Democratic Republic of Congo, hydroelectric power plants provide electricity that could guard against deforestation and revitalize the war-torn country.
2017-08-30.snippet: Near Virunga National Park in the Democratic Republic of Congo, hydroelectric power plants provide electricity that could guard against deforestation and revitalize the war-torn country.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: VIRUNGA NATIONAL PARK, Democratic Republic of Congo — On the verdant savanna of Virunga National Park, a herd of elephants clustered near an umbrella-shaped acacia tree to seek shelter from the blazing morning sun. From a Cessna far above, the giant animals looked like brown-gray miniatures.
2017-08-30.headline_main: The Power Plants That May Save a Park, and Aid a Country

2017-08-30.abstract: A deal should deliver enough cost savings to justify paying a price of more than $20 billion. Greater size also promises increased negotiating heft with Boeing and Airbus.
2017-08-30.snippet: A deal should deliver enough cost savings to justify paying a price of more than $20 billion. Greater size also promises increased negotiating heft with Boeing and Airbus.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: United Technologies’ potential acquisition of Rockwell Collins could deliver enough cost savings to justify paying a reported price tag of nearly $23 billion. Greater size also promises increased negotiating heft with Boeing and Airbus. Investors would have good reason to clear a deal.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Why a United Technologies Bid for Rockwell Collins Would Make Sense

2017-08-30.abstract: Consumers complain that the summertime arrival of pumpkin spice products — already slowing in growth — smacks of Christmas creep.
2017-08-30.snippet: Consumers complain that the summertime arrival of pumpkin spice products — already slowing in growth — smacks of Christmas creep.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Retailers this year are reaching peak pumpkin before most consumers have changed out of their summer shorts.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Pumpkin Spice Glut Arrives Earlier Than Ever

2017-08-30.abstract: The rise of analysts — noncoaching assistants hired to scout, advise or second-guess — offers programs that can afford them a tactical advantage.
2017-08-30.snippet: The rise of analysts — noncoaching assistants hired to scout, advise or second-guess — offers programs that can afford them a tactical advantage.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: When Nick Saban, Alabama’s football coach, decided to replace his offensive coordinator, Lane Kiffin, in the run-up to last season’s national championship game, he had an experienced former head coach ready to step in.
2017-08-30.headline_main: College Football’s New Secret Weapon: Coaches Who Don’t Coach

2017-08-30.abstract: Join us on Sept. 6 for a conference call hosted by Gilbert Cruz, our television editor, and Jeremy Egner, our in-house “Game of Thrones” expert.
2017-08-30.snippet: Join us on Sept. 6 for a conference call hosted by Gilbert Cruz, our television editor, and Jeremy Egner, our in-house “Game of Thrones” expert.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Times Insider Events — live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Live Event: Discuss ‘Game of Thrones’ With The New York Times

2017-08-30.abstract: First order of business: face reality in a way the former chief executive, Travis Kalanick, wouldn’t.
2017-08-30.snippet: First order of business: face reality in a way the former chief executive, Travis Kalanick, wouldn’t.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Uber’s board has picked Dara Khosrowshahi, leader of the online travel company Expedia, to replace the embattled chief executive, Travis Kalanick. But the company’s troubles run deeper than Mr. Kalanick’s flubs and scandals, and new leadership alone won’t be able to right this distressed ship.
2017-08-30.headline_main: What Dara Khosrowshahi Must Do to Save Uber

2017-08-30.abstract: The devices are poised to get smarter as advances are made in scanning 3-D objects like your face.
2017-08-30.snippet: The devices are poised to get smarter as advances are made in scanning 3-D objects like your face.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — We all know the drill. For the last decade, smartphones have gotten thinner and faster and thinner and faster and, well, you get the picture.
2017-08-30.headline_main: The Smartphone’s Future: It’s All About the Camera

2017-08-30.abstract: A family-run business founded in 1927, Zaro’s once had 20 shops in the Bronx before mainly catering to hungry commuters in Manhattan.
2017-08-30.snippet: A family-run business founded in 1927, Zaro’s once had 20 shops in the Bronx before mainly catering to hungry commuters in Manhattan.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: In the hands of hungry commuters, the croissants, breads and cheesecakes from Zaro’s Family Bakery counters in Grand Central Terminal and Pennsylvania Station travel across the New York region and beyond.
2017-08-30.headline_main: In a Nod to Its Roots, Zaro’s Is Opening 2 Bakeries in the Bronx

2017-08-30.abstract: The complex interplay between nature and the world we have created exploded in Houston.
2017-08-30.snippet: The complex interplay between nature and the world we have created exploded in Houston.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: We were sitting around a cluttered table in his Bay City, Tex., office over a plate of barbecue, this old Jewish rice farmer and I, and before either of us knew it, we had chewed our way down to the shank of the afternoon talking about Texas, and the Talmud, and the weather.
2017-08-30.headline_main: A Texas Farmer on Harvey, Bad Planning and Runaway Growth

2017-08-30.abstract: Matt Furie, the cartoonist behind a frog now synonymous with the so-called alt-right, has forced the removal of a book with Pepe from distribution.
2017-08-30.snippet: Matt Furie, the cartoonist behind a frog now synonymous with the so-called alt-right, has forced the removal of a book with Pepe from distribution.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The illustrator behind Pepe the Frog, a cartoon frog initially created in the 2000s as a fun-loving post-college grad but eventually designated as a hate symbol by the Anti-Defamation League, has forced the removal of a children’s book from distribution that featured the frog.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Pepe the Frog Cartoonist Stops Distribution of Children’s Book

2017-08-30.abstract: The “American Bridge Project,” depicting an American flag and the First Amendment, will span the college’s sky bridges over Lexington Avenue.
2017-08-30.snippet: The “American Bridge Project,” depicting an American flag and the First Amendment, will span the college’s sky bridges over Lexington Avenue.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Before he shares a billing with Francisco Goya at the Brooklyn Museum next month, Robert Longo will present a public work above Lexington Avenue in Manhattan.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Robert Longo Installation Will Come to Hunter College

2017-08-30.abstract: Plus, your last chance to buy goodies from the Costume Institute’s Comme des Garçons shop and a selection of rare vintage T-shirts.
2017-08-30.snippet: Plus, your last chance to buy goodies from the Costume Institute’s Comme des Garçons shop and a selection of rare vintage T-shirts.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: On Thursday, the jewelry brand Gorjana will officially open its West Village shop, where you’ll find a gold Laguna lariat necklace ($90) and power stone bracelets strung with semiprecious gems like citrine and rose quartz ($38-$58). At 298 West Fourth Street.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Where to Find Labor Day Weekend’s Best Sales

2017-08-30.abstract: The City Council is following Europe’s example with a new department devoted to life after dark.
2017-08-30.snippet: The City Council is following Europe’s example with a new department devoted to life after dark.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: New York City is about to get a new kind of don, a title once reserved for the city’s crime bosses. In a move that follows in the footsteps of a clutch of European cities, New York is to appoint a director of night life, or a DON — an ambassador tasked with giving after-dark activities a more congenial reputation.
2017-08-30.headline_main: What Europe’s ‘Night Mayors’ Can Teach New York

2017-08-30.abstract: First spotted by Korean astronomers in 1437, scientists have found it again in the form of a violent star system that experienced a nova explosion.
2017-08-30.snippet: First spotted by Korean astronomers in 1437, scientists have found it again in the form of a violent star system that experienced a nova explosion.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Nearly six centuries ago, Korean astronomers scanning the night sky for omens of the future spotted a new star in the cluster of stars they called Wei, and what today’s star watchers consider the tail of the Scorpius constellation.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Casting Light on Mystery of a Star That Vanished After 14 Days

2017-08-30.abstract: Remember the photograph of women stuck in rising, murky floodwaters in Dickinson, Tex., on Sunday? Here’s where they are now.
2017-08-30.snippet: Remember the photograph of women stuck in rising, murky floodwaters in Dickinson, Tex., on Sunday? Here’s where they are now.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The photograph, on its face, is unexceptional. Taken on Monday, it shows several older women, smiling alongside staff in a sitting room at Laurel Court, a nursing center in Alvin, Tex.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Rescued Women Make It to Another Nursing Center. The Cat’s O.K., Too.

2017-08-30.abstract: The Defense Department had for years publicly disclosed only the number of troops taking part in the NATO-led mission in Afghanistan, not counterterrorism forces there.
2017-08-30.snippet: The Defense Department had for years publicly disclosed only the number of troops taking part in the NATO-led mission in Afghanistan, not counterterrorism forces there.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States has about 11,000 troops in Afghanistan, the Pentagon said on Wednesday, acknowledging for the first time publicly that the total forces there are higher than formally disclosed in recent years.
2017-08-30.headline_main: U.S. Says It Has 11,000 Troops in Afghanistan, More Than Formerly Disclosed

2017-08-30.abstract: The ruling was a preliminary victory for Travis Kalanick, Uber’s former C.E.O., who has been sued by Benchmark, an investor in the ride-hailing company.
2017-08-30.snippet: The ruling was a preliminary victory for Travis Kalanick, Uber’s former C.E.O., who has been sued by Benchmark, an investor in the ride-hailing company.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: GEORGETOWN, Del. — Travis Kalanick, the former chief executive of Uber, won a preliminary victory on Wednesday in his nasty legal clash with the venture capital firm trying to oust him from the ride-hailing company’s board when a judge ruled that the dispute should be moved to arbitration for now.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Kalanick’s Feud With Benchmark Goes to Arbitration for Now, Judge Rules

2017-08-30.abstract: A reader recalls picking up the paper at Sheridan Square in the 1970s to look at apartment listings.
2017-08-30.snippet: A reader recalls picking up the paper at Sheridan Square in the 1970s to look at apartment listings.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-08-30.headline_main: The Village Voice, Then and Now

2017-08-30.abstract: On this week’s podcast, the “Ten Days in the Valley” star reads Ellen Graf’s essay about how love is a universal language, and driving is not.
2017-08-30.snippet: On this week’s podcast, the “Ten Days in the Valley” star reads Ellen Graf’s essay about how love is a universal language, and driving is not.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: On this week’s podcast, the actress Kyra Sedgwick reads Ellen Graf’s essay “Our Joy Knows No Bounds, or Lanes,” about a love that transcends language and bad driving.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Modern Love Podcast: Kyra Sedgwick Reads ‘Our Joy Knows No Bounds, or Lanes’

2017-08-30.abstract: After playing three games in Tampa to escape the impact of Hurricane Harvey, the Astros will come home.
2017-08-30.snippet: After playing three games in Tampa to escape the impact of Hurricane Harvey, the Astros will come home.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: In a surprise decision, the Houston Astros will return home to play baseball this weekend rather than remain in Tampa, Fla., where they had been temporarily relocated because of the devastating effects of Hurricane Harvey.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Astros Will Return to Houston This Weekend, to Play the Mets

2017-08-30.abstract: A reader, in response to an article about a judge’s call for more female lawyers arguing cases, recalls an unusual day in court.
2017-08-30.snippet: A reader, in response to an article about a judge’s call for more female lawyers arguing cases, recalls an unusual day in court.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-08-30.headline_main: Women in the Courtroom

2017-08-30.abstract: The Museum of Contemporary Art, in the shadow of new downtown arrivals, soars with the first American retrospective of Anna Maria Maiolino’s work.
2017-08-30.snippet: The Museum of Contemporary Art, in the shadow of new downtown arrivals, soars with the first American retrospective of Anna Maria Maiolino’s work.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Next month is the official kickoff of Pacific Standard Time:LA/LA,  a festival of exhibitions and events throughout Southern California that, even in this era of biennials duplicated across borders and fairs franchised across continents, takes the prize for sprawl. PST, as it’s called, meanders into more than 60 museums, from Santa Barbara to San Diego, each of which presents an exhibition or more of art from Latin America or America’s Latino communities. Another 65 commercial galleries here are also getting in on the act: proof, if wearied New Yorkers like me needed it, that Los Angeles’s art scene is now second to none.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Weekend in Los Angeles: That Touch of Brazil

2017-08-30.abstract: The head of the A.F.L.-C.I.O. takes issue with the premise of an Economic Scene column.

2017-08-30.headline_main: Labor’s Stance on Nafta

2017-08-30.abstract: The ants spring into survival mode in floods, sticking together to form mats or log-shaped rafts that float through the waters.
2017-08-30.snippet: The ants spring into survival mode in floods, sticking together to form mats or log-shaped rafts that float through the waters.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The streets in Texas flooded by Hurricane Harvey brought upheaval to nature’s earthbound creatures, throwing them out of their natural habitats into a world overwhelmed with water.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Fire Ants Are Yet Another Hazard in Houston’s Flooded Streets

2017-08-30.abstract: The subarctic town of Churchill has been stranded since May, when floods washed out its only link to the south. And the rail’s American owners don’t want to fix it.
2017-08-30.snippet: The subarctic town of Churchill has been stranded since May, when floods washed out its only link to the south. And the rail’s American owners don’t want to fix it.

2017-08-30.headline_main: Canadian Town, Isolated After Losing Rail Link, ‘Feels Held Hostage’

2017-08-30.abstract: A lifelong entrepreneur from a wealthy family, he founded a succession of businesses catering to the affluent but also backed democracy for Hong Kong.
2017-08-30.snippet: A lifelong entrepreneur from a wealthy family, he founded a succession of businesses catering to the affluent but also backed democracy for Hong Kong.

2017-08-30.headline_main: David Tang, Fashion Retailer and Raconteur, Dies at 63

2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y. — “Come in! Back here!” André Leon Talley’s voice rang out, instructing a visitor to enter his elegant white colonial here, which is surrounded by a tidy lawn and large hydrangeas.

2017-08-30.abstract: In Berlin and in a handful of other European locales, the great outdoors is right in the heart of town.
2017-08-30.snippet: In Berlin and in a handful of other European locales, the great outdoors is right in the heart of town.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: From our apartment in central Berlin it only took 20 minutes to get to the lake and another few to get in. But instead of boarding a high-speed train, we took a wobbly old tram a handful of stops, and while floating in the water we could still see the city’s buildings peeking over the trees.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Swim in a Lake, Without Leaving the City

2017-08-30.abstract: They’re either in fashion or they’re out. And this season, there’s no questioning their appeal.
2017-08-30.snippet: They’re either in fashion or they’re out. And this season, there’s no questioning their appeal.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The classic style is one of men’s wear’s most fickle trends. It’s either extremely in fashion — or terribly out. This season, double-breasted suits are back in favor among designers. And in eye-catching colors, fabrics and constructions, their staying power is looking stronger than ever.

2017-08-30.abstract: In a letter to Congress, Michael Cohen disputed allegations about him contained in a dossier compiled by a former British spy.
2017-08-30.snippet: In a letter to Congress, Michael Cohen disputed allegations about him contained in a dossier compiled by a former British spy.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s longtime lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, has given Congress a point-by-point rebuttal of a dossier alleging that he has deep ties to Russian officials — an effort to clear his name as the Justice Department and congressional committees investigate Russia’s attempts to disrupt last year’s election.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Trump Lawyer ‘Vehemently’ Denies Russian Collusion

2017-08-30.abstract: New Jersey religious leaders say they are outraged by the disorder at Essex County College in Newark, which is in danger of losing its accreditation.
2017-08-30.snippet: New Jersey religious leaders say they are outraged by the disorder at Essex County College in Newark, which is in danger of losing its accreditation.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: A group of New Jersey religious leaders is calling for change at a public community college in Newark that is teetering on the brink of losing its accreditation after years of mismanagement and turmoil.
2017-08-30.headline_main: As Essex County College Teeters, a Call to End Turmoil

2017-08-30.abstract: Since Mayor de Blasio called for a review of all possible symbols of hate, he has been peppered with questions about how far it will go.
2017-08-30.snippet: Since Mayor de Blasio called for a review of all possible symbols of hate, he has been peppered with questions about how far it will go.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Elected to lead the biggest city in the nation, Mayor Bill de Blasio often seems to hunger for a brighter spotlight. He tried to shape the debate in the last presidential election, only to be spurned by candidates in his own party. He flew to Germany in July to speak at a rally during a meeting of world leaders, only to be criticized for leaving New York hours after a police officer was murdered.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Ordering Review of Statues Puts de Blasio in Tricky Spot

2017-08-30.abstract: Reports about the tech giant’s bullying of the New America Foundation raise concerns about how it shapes policy debates.
2017-08-30.snippet: Reports about the tech giant’s bullying of the New America Foundation raise concerns about how it shapes policy debates.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The first thing you see when you walk into the offices of the New America Foundation in Washington is the Eric Schmidt Ideas Lab, a space named after the executive chairman of Google’s parent company. Google, Mr. Schmidt and his family’s foundation are the principal funders of that think tank.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Google’s Disturbing Influence Over Think Tanks

2017-08-30.abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
2017-08-30.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

2017-08-30.headline_main: Houston, Tax Overhaul, Syria: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

2017-08-30.abstract: In her lawsuit, a former West Point cadet who said she was raped at the military academy accused her superiors of creating a culture that put female cadets at risk.
2017-08-30.snippet: In her lawsuit, a former West Point cadet who said she was raped at the military academy accused her superiors of creating a culture that put female cadets at risk.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: A lawsuit filed by a former cadet at the United States Military Academy at West Point, who said she had been raped by a fellow cadet, was ordered dismissed on Wednesday by a federal appeals panel.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Court Bans Ex-Cadet’s Lawsuit Against West Point Superiors

2017-08-30.abstract: Thousands are applying for federal assistance, but it may be slow to arrive and require them to take on debt that could take years to pay off.
2017-08-30.snippet: Thousands are applying for federal assistance, but it may be slow to arrive and require them to take on debt that could take years to pay off.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: As a brutal storm continues to pound the Gulf Coast, tens of thousands of homeowners are turning to the government for help in repairing and rebuilding. Much of the aid they receive will require taking on debt — an unpleasant surprise to those who may lack the income to pay it back.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Harvey Victims Face Hurdles, and Maybe Bills, in Getting Aid

2017-08-30.abstract: U.S. Open organizers let coaches talk to players from the seats when sitting on the same end of the court and allows hand signals from the other end.
2017-08-30.snippet: U.S. Open organizers let coaches talk to players from the seats when sitting on the same end of the court and allows hand signals from the other end.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Playing her first-round match at the United States Open on a damp side court Tuesday, the Paraguayan Verónica Cepede Royg was having a miserable time, dropping the first set to the American Nicole Gibbs at love. As Cepede struggled, she received running advice from her coach, Ramon Delgado, in the stands — a circumstance that was, technically, a rules violation.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Player (on the Court) Gets Input From Coach (in the Stands)

2017-08-30.abstract: Texas lawmakers say they voted against the 2013 aid bill because it included spending unrelated to Sandy. There’s a factual bone to pick with this claim.
2017-08-30.snippet: Texas lawmakers say they voted against the 2013 aid bill because it included spending unrelated to Sandy. There’s a factual bone to pick with this claim.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: As Tropical Storm Harvey barrels down the Gulf Coast and talk of a disaster-relief bill begins, Republican lawmakers from Texas are rushing to defend their 2013 votes against spending $50.5 billion on Hurricane Sandy relief.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Was 2013 Hurricane Sandy Relief Package ‘Full of Pork’?

2017-08-30.abstract: Already prevalent online, shorter ads are seen as a way to address shorter attention spans, and eventually reduce the length of commercial breaks.
2017-08-30.snippet: Already prevalent online, shorter ads are seen as a way to address shorter attention spans, and eventually reduce the length of commercial breaks.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: A new kind of advertising is coming to N.F.L. games and other programming on Fox Sports this fall: the six-second television commercial.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Six-Second Commercials Are Coming to N.F.L. Games on Fox

2017-08-30.abstract: Follow rescue volunteers in 360-degree video as residents of a Houston neighborhood were evacuated by boats on Tuesday after Tropical Storm Harvey dumped record amounts of rain this week.
2017-08-30.snippet: Follow rescue volunteers in 360-degree video as residents of a Houston neighborhood were evacuated by boats on Tuesday after Tropical Storm Harvey dumped record amounts of rain this week.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Follow rescue volunteers in 360-degree video as residents of a Houston neighborhood were evacuated by boats on Tuesday after Tropical Storm Harvey dumped record amounts of rain this week.
2017-08-30.headline_main: On Submerged Streets, ‘Houston Has Come Together’

2017-08-30.abstract: Four lawyers are under review for social media posts that mocked people in Family Court in Queens.

2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The Facebook posts were crass and left no doubt the authors did not approve of the attire that some people wore to Family Court in Queens.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Lawyers for Child Welfare and Legal Aid Under Scrutiny for Facebook Posts

2017-08-30.abstract: Houston in the wake of Harvey is a study in contrasts: of some neighborhoods moving on and of others doing anything but that.
2017-08-30.snippet: Houston in the wake of Harvey is a study in contrasts: of some neighborhoods moving on and of others doing anything but that.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The water has receded in some parts of the city, leaving cakes of mud, branches and garbage baking in the heat wherever the current dropped them. Abandoned cars, too, appear every so often, left where they were in the moment the storm overtook them.
2017-08-30.headline_main: The Sun Came Out in Houston. Here’s What Residents Saw.

2017-08-30.abstract: Among the storm’s victims were a married couple checking on family, and a young man who had set out to rescue his sister’s cat.
2017-08-30.snippet: Among the storm’s victims were a married couple checking on family, and a young man who had set out to rescue his sister’s cat.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: As Tropical Storm Harvey continues to deluge homes and sweep vehicles off roads in Texas and Louisiana, at least 38 deaths have been reported. Officials in affected counties are starting to learn the victims’ identities and piece together the circumstances around their deaths.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Harvey’s Victims: An Animal Lover, a Coach, a Police Officer

2017-08-30.abstract: If you want to avoid overly checking your messages while on vacation, send your important correspondents to their own special mailbox and add alerts.
2017-08-30.snippet: If you want to avoid overly checking your messages while on vacation, send your important correspondents to their own special mailbox and add alerts.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Q. I’m going on vacation next month and plan to mostly ignore the work email inbox on my iPhone, but I am expecting messages from a couple of people that I do need to answer. Is there a way to divert those contacts into my personal mailbox so I can just check there instead of having to plow through all my inboxes and possibly get pulled into work drama?
2017-08-30.headline_main: Setting Up Your Own Email V.I.P. List

2017-08-30.abstract: Dionne Searcey says that even with sometimes spotty internet connectivity, West Africans have embraced smartphones and apps like WhatsApp and Skype.
2017-08-30.snippet: Dionne Searcey says that even with sometimes spotty internet connectivity, West Africans have embraced smartphones and apps like WhatsApp and Skype.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Dionne Searcey, The Times’s West Africa bureau chief based in Dakar, Senegal, discussed the tech she’s using.
2017-08-30.headline_main: The Technology Our West Africa Bureau Chief Relies On

2017-08-30.abstract: With the major devastation in the area, it seems worth reminding companies about how generous local taxpayers have been in recent years.
2017-08-30.snippet: With the major devastation in the area, it seems worth reminding companies about how generous local taxpayers have been in recent years.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Even before the damage from Hurricane Harvey is tallied, big corporations are breaking out their checkbooks.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Houston Loves Big Business. How Much Should Big Business Now Love It Back?

2017-08-30.abstract: Los Angeles, Detroit, Boston and Chicago are among the other large cities that have imposed restrictions during trying times in the past half-century.
2017-08-30.snippet: Los Angeles, Detroit, Boston and Chicago are among the other large cities that have imposed restrictions during trying times in the past half-century.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: The mayor of Houston imposed a curfew in his city on Tuesday, ordering nearly everyone off the streets from midnight to 5 a.m. in an effort to stop “small-scale looting” and other crimes following prodigious flooding from Tropical Storm Harvey. Houston has a population of 2.3 million people spread across nearly 670 square miles, making the curfew among the largest and most expansive in United States history.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Houston Curfew Follows Many in Big Cities Facing Disaster or Unrest

2017-08-30.abstract: Homes and shelters were flooded and the largest oil refinery in the U.S. was shut down after heavy rains flooded Port Arthur, east of Houston, overnight Tuesday.
2017-08-30.snippet: Homes and shelters were flooded and the largest oil refinery in the U.S. was shut down after heavy rains flooded Port Arthur, east of Houston, overnight Tuesday.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Homes and shelters were flooded and the largest oil refinery in the U.S. was shut down after heavy rains flooded Port Arthur, east of Houston, overnight Tuesday.
2017-08-30.headline_main: In Port Arthur, Harvey Continues Path of Destruction

2017-08-30.abstract: An administration official refused to say what, if anything, the government would do to encourage people to sign up for health insurance under the Affordable Care Act.
2017-08-30.snippet: An administration official refused to say what, if anything, the government would do to encourage people to sign up for health insurance under the Affordable Care Act.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A Trump administration official said Wednesday that the administration wanted to stabilize health insurance markets, but refused to say if the government would promote enrollment this fall under the Affordable Care Act or pay for the activities of counselors who help people sign up for coverage.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Trump Administration Wants to Stabilize Health Markets but Won’t Say How

2017-08-30.abstract: For a coach who won more than 800 games, none was sweeter than the 1985 N.C.A.A. final against Georgetown.
2017-08-30.snippet: For a coach who won more than 800 games, none was sweeter than the 1985 N.C.A.A. final against Georgetown.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: Rollie Massimino, who coached Villanova University to one of the greatest upsets in N.C.A.A. basketball history, the defeat of powerful Georgetown to win the 1985 national championship, died on Wednesday in hospice care in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 82.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Rollie Massimino, 82, Dies; Rode Dark Horse Villanova to Basketball Glory

2017-08-30.abstract: The ruling comes amid a fight between conservationists and President Michel Temer over environmental protections and indigenous rights.
2017-08-30.snippet: The ruling comes amid a fight between conservationists and President Michel Temer over environmental protections and indigenous rights.
2017-08-30.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — A federal judge in Brazil has temporarily halted a plan by President Michel Temer to allow mining in a large area of the Amazon forest, dealing a victory to environmental activists who had denounced the initiative as potentially calamitous.
2017-08-30.headline_main: Brazilian Judge Stymies Plan to Allow Mining in Amazon Region

2017-08-31.abstract: The survivors of Hurricane Harvey do not need empty tweets and platitudes.
2017-08-31.snippet: The survivors of Hurricane Harvey do not need empty tweets and platitudes.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Before it began to rain in Houston last week, the spectacularly wealthy pastor Joel Osteen could have opened up his megachurch to serve as a logistics center. He could have announced that evacuees were welcome to take shelter there when Hurricane Harvey landed. Instead he wrote tweets like “God’s got this” and “don’t drift into doubt and fear … stay anchored to hope.” Only a couple of his posts on Twitter offered “prayers.”
2017-08-31.headline_main: The Cheap Prosperity Gospel of Trump and Osteen

2017-08-31.abstract: With the death toll of Hurricane Harvey climbing to 38, those who survived the storm are just now learning the names of those who did not.
2017-08-31.snippet: With the death toll of Hurricane Harvey climbing to 38, those who survived the storm are just now learning the names of those who did not.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Shivering from hypothermia, little Jordyn Grace was clutching her mother’s unresponsive body as the floodwaters rose around her. A rescue team in a Zodiac boat, on the lookout for those in distress in Beaumont, Tex., spotted the small pink backpack the girl was wearing and pulled her and her mother aboard.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Clinging to Her Drowning ‘Mama,’ a Little Girl Survives the Raging Flood

2017-08-31.abstract: As it reels from the impact of Hurricane Harvey, a muscular metropolitan area that embraced growth now wonders whether growth made its flooding woes worse.
2017-08-31.snippet: As it reels from the impact of Hurricane Harvey, a muscular metropolitan area that embraced growth now wonders whether growth made its flooding woes worse.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Not long after a pair of New York real estate speculators founded this city on the banks of a torpid bayou in the 1830s, every home and every business flooded. Though settlers tried draining their humid, swampy, sweltering surroundings, the inundations came again and again, with 16 major floods in the city’s first century.
2017-08-31.headline_main: A Storm Forces Houston, the Limitless City, to Consider Its Limits

2017-08-31.abstract: The $255 million in military aid will be put into escrow. Unlocking the funds will require Islamabad to stop supporting the Taliban.
2017-08-31.snippet: The $255 million in military aid will be put into escrow. Unlocking the funds will require Islamabad to stop supporting the Taliban.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration notified Congress on Wednesday that it was putting $255 million in military assistance to Pakistan into the equivalent of an escrow account that Islamabad can only access if it does more to crack down on internal terror networks launching attacks on neighboring Afghanistan.
2017-08-31.headline_main: U.S. Gives Military Assistance to Pakistan, With Strings Attached

2017-08-31.abstract: The temporary ruling prevents the state from going ahead with controversial provisions that were to go into effect on Friday.
2017-08-31.snippet: The temporary ruling prevents the state from going ahead with controversial provisions that were to go into effect on Friday.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — A federal judge in San Antonio on Wednesday blocked Texas from enforcing its ban on so-called sanctuary cities, questioning the constitutionality of a law that has pitted Republican state leaders against several Democratic-leaning cities.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Federal Judge Blocks Texas’ Ban on ‘Sanctuary Cities’

2017-08-31.abstract: Taylor Fritz, 19, had never won a main-draw match at a Grand Slam tournament until Wednesday, and his 7-month-old son might have provided him with a bit of good fortune.
2017-08-31.snippet: Taylor Fritz, 19, had never won a main-draw match at a Grand Slam tournament until Wednesday, and his 7-month-old son might have provided him with a bit of good fortune.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Taylor Fritz rattled off the names of various opponents: Jack Sock. John Isner. Stan Wawrinka. Gilles Müller.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Taylor Fritz Wins, Perhaps Aided by Good-Luck Charm That Sleeps Soundly

2017-08-31.abstract: Houston has begun assessing the damage of Harvey, but the storm marched on to conquer a new swath speckled with small towns and home to millions.
2017-08-31.snippet: Houston has begun assessing the damage of Harvey, but the storm marched on to conquer a new swath speckled with small towns and home to millions.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: NEWTON, Tex. — For the streets of Newton, a small town on the Texas side of the Louisiana state line, to become impassable, “the flood would have to be biblical,” Kristen Rogers was told when she peeked into the sheriff’s office looking for guidance.
2017-08-31.headline_main: As Houston Looks to Recover, Small Towns Now Bear the Brunt

2017-08-31.abstract: After Monday’s emotional return to tennis following a doping ban, Sharapova won a second-round match against Timea Babos of Hungary in three sets.
2017-08-31.snippet: After Monday’s emotional return to tennis following a doping ban, Sharapova won a second-round match against Timea Babos of Hungary in three sets.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: This time, Maria Sharapova did not shed any tears or fall to her hands and knees as if she had won a championship. She merely smiled, waved and advanced.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Maria Sharapova, With No Tears This Time, Advances to Third Round

2017-08-31.abstract: Pitching was sporadic and hitting was almost nonexistent in a sweep against the Indians. Manager Joe Girardi says a series against Boston is critical.
2017-08-31.snippet: Pitching was sporadic and hitting was almost nonexistent in a sweep against the Indians. Manager Joe Girardi says a series against Boston is critical.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Baseball managers generally hate doubleheaders. They deplete your bullpen, foul up your starting rotation and impose unnecessary wear and tear on your position players.
2017-08-31.headline_main: After Losing Two Games, Yankees Have 30 Left to Hold Their Spot

2017-08-31.abstract: The United States had complained that the force patrolling the Lebanon-Israel border was not preventing Hezbollah from amassing and hiding weapons.
2017-08-31.snippet: The United States had complained that the force patrolling the Lebanon-Israel border was not preventing Hezbollah from amassing and hiding weapons.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: The United Nations Security Council on Wednesday voted to renew the peacekeeping mission in Lebanon for another year after addressing American and Israeli complaints that the force was ignoring a Hezbollah arms buildup near Israel’s border.
2017-08-31.headline_main: U.N. Peacekeepers in Lebanon Get Stronger Inspection Powers for Hezbollah Arms

2017-08-31.abstract: Norlaila Kyrgios, who is a princess in Malaysia, accompanies her mercurial son on tour, picking up for him in every way imaginable.
2017-08-31.snippet: Norlaila Kyrgios, who is a princess in Malaysia, accompanies her mercurial son on tour, picking up for him in every way imaginable.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: After her son Nick had lost in torturous fashion yet again Wednesday, after she had been put through an emotional wringer with him, Norlaila Kyrgios leaned against a metal barrier in the front row of the makeshift Louis Armstrong Stadium at the United States Open.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Nick Kyrgios, With a Long-Suffering Mother Watching, Crashes Out of U.S. Open

2017-08-31.abstract: Zachary Spitz squares off.
2017-08-31.snippet: Zachary Spitz squares off.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: THURSDAY PUZZLE — We get quite a bit of mail about rebus puzzles, mostly asking why the editors don’t alert solvers to the fact that there is an unusual element in their crossword. The answer to that question is that part of the “fun” — I’m putting that in quotes for the benefit of those who are aggravated by rebuses — of solving a puzzle like that is figuring out that the element is there to begin with. Your mileage may vary, of course.

2017-08-31.abstract: If you want to improve at anything, you need to know where your mistakes are leading you.
2017-08-31.snippet: If you want to improve at anything, you need to know where your mistakes are leading you.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: I took up golf in a time of personal crisis. Last summer, after I moved back into my parents’ house in western North Carolina, I was overcome with a malaise so severe that I couldn’t do anything but get in bed and stay there. As listless days turned into listless months, it became clear that I was in the throes of a mental breakdown. The experience was akin to a perpetual hangover of the soul, which I tried to defeat not with ibuprofen and Netflix but with a lot of lying down and contemplating the futility of getting up.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: High-Visibility Golf Balls

2017-08-31.abstract: Queso gravy elevates the simple dish.
2017-08-31.snippet: Queso gravy elevates the simple dish.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Years ago, on a hot afternoon in a suburb of Dallas, I sat in a restaurant called Babe’s with the Texas food historian Robb Walsh and ate an enormous quantity of chicken-fried steak. We didn’t talk much because we were focused on our food, but when we did, it was about the mysteries of the delicious. A chicken-fried steak is nothing to champion, after all, at least on its face. It’s just cheap beef pounded thin, dressed in seasoned flour and fried, an Americanized taste of the schnitzel brought to Texas by German immigrants in the 19th century. Peppery cream gravy generally accompanies the steak. That gravy can be gummy when it’s not prepared well. And the steak beneath it can be dry, or soggy, or both. Ours was neither. Walsh and I marveled at the way the texture of the meat’s crisp exterior was heightened by the silkiness of the gravy, at the way sweet and salty combined in the dish and at the manner in which the whole experience was so much greater than the parts. Soon enough I went home to recreate the meal.
2017-08-31.headline_main: For Chicken-Fried Steak, Too Much Is Just Enough

2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: If you are, like me, a person with no sense of style and a stomach paunch, you might understand why dressing for a fashion show would be a psychological challenge. The day before my first one, I begged my best-dressed co-worker to chaperone my visit to a fast-fashion outlet. I’d coveted a pleated gold-foil skirt I’d seen on the store’s website. My co-worker had approved the skirt on the model. I tried it on. She did not approve it on me. In person, the gold foil looked cheap, the waistband of the skirt unflattering. Instead, she picked out a rose-colored accordion skirt that I would never have thought to buy. I put it on the next morning. Four hours later, I spilled steak juice all down my front.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Elaine Welteroth, Teen Vogue’s Refashionista

2017-08-31.abstract: Wesley Morris and Jenna Wortham discuss the comedian’s latest provocations.
2017-08-31.snippet: Wesley Morris and Jenna Wortham discuss the comedian’s latest provocations.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: This summer, Dave Chappelle returned to the stage for an ambitious, monthlong residency at Radio City Music Hall in New York. We saw the show independently, on separate nights. What we witnessed inspired us to dedicate an entire episode to the legacy of Chappelle’s comedy as he works to re-establish his place in American culture. But much has shifted in the decade since Chappelle, through his much-loved TV show, “Chappelle’s Show,” brilliantly explored how black people are represented and misrepresented: Nowadays, he’s no longer interested in speaking on behalf of anyone else. We consider his past to consider where he might be headed and whether we still need comedians — and comedy, for that matter — to help us make sense of the present.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Still Processing: The Transformation of Dave Chappelle

2017-08-31.snippet: Thursday: The potential for a megastorm in New York, a salsa extravaganza, and a call for high school memories.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Good morning on this sunny-soggy Thursday.
2017-08-31.headline_main: New York Today: Reflecting on Harvey, in the Northeast

2017-08-31.abstract: This documentary, directed by Peter Bratt, looks at Dolores Huerta and her fights for civil rights and worker protections.
2017-08-31.snippet: This documentary, directed by Peter Bratt, looks at Dolores Huerta and her fights for civil rights and worker protections.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: You can judge Dolores Huerta by what others say about her. Just choose a side: Bobby Kennedy, Barack Obama and Bill Clinton have sung her praises, while Richard Nixon, Rush Limbaugh and Bill O’Reilly have disparaged her ideas. Better yet, judge her by her accomplishments, which are outlined in “Dolores,” a documentary that extols her lifelong, and seemingly unlimited, fighting spirit in the service of workers’ rights.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: Workers Have a Friend in the Determined ‘Dolores’

2017-08-31.abstract: The United States and South Korea completed their annual joint military exercises by flying warplanes two days after a North Korean missile test over Japan.
2017-08-31.snippet: The United States and South Korea completed their annual joint military exercises by flying warplanes two days after a North Korean missile test over Japan.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — The United States and South Korea wrapped up their annual joint military exercises on Thursday by flying some of their most powerful warplanes in bombing drills in a show of force two days after North Korea fired a ballistic missile over Japan.
2017-08-31.headline_main: 2 Days After North Korea Missile Test, a Show of U.S. Airpower

2017-08-31.abstract: Loosening workplace regulations was a major campaign promise, but the measures could result short-term in more employees being fired.
2017-08-31.snippet: Loosening workplace regulations was a major campaign promise, but the measures could result short-term in more employees being fired.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: PARIS — After 30 years of fraught attempts to make France’s labor market more flexible, the government announced sweeping changes on Thursday with the potential to radically shift the balance of power from workers to employers.
2017-08-31.headline_main: France Unveils Contentious Labor Overhaul in Big Test for Macron

2017-08-31.abstract: Murdered women arouse adolescent hormones in this gorgeous Brazilian thriller.
2017-08-31.snippet: Murdered women arouse adolescent hormones in this gorgeous Brazilian thriller.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Like the teenage girls who monopolize its attention, “Kill Me Please” is moody, lovely, preening and libidinous. Burning hormones for fuel, this hyperconfident first feature from the Brazilian director Anita Rocha da Silveira vividly pinpoints a time when everything is heightened. Feelings, colors and sounds sear and blaze, and death delivers the same frisson as sex.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: ‘Kill Me Please,’ a Summer of Murder and Teenage Kicks

2017-08-31.abstract: The actions of troubled teenage boys have dire consequences in this Chilean drama.
2017-08-31.snippet: The actions of troubled teenage boys have dire consequences in this Chilean drama.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Teenage boys are all idiots. Some are harmless idiots, and some are brutish ones. Eventually most of them grow out of it. Some of the brutish ones don’t, and if they happen to do something particularly heinous during their idiot period, their chance to reform may be cut short.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: In ‘Jesús,’ a Delinquent Teenager in Trouble Too Deep to Handle

2017-08-31.abstract: The embattled Japanese company said it needed more time to choose an outside investor who could provide it with badly needed cash to cover losses elsewhere.
2017-08-31.snippet: The embattled Japanese company said it needed more time to choose an outside investor who could provide it with badly needed cash to cover losses elsewhere.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Toshiba, the embattled Japanese conglomerate, said on Thursday that it needed more time to choose an outside investor for its microchip business, extending a period of uncertainty for the company as it seeks a multibillion-dollar cash infusion to stabilize its finances.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Toshiba Misses Deadline to Find a Buyer for Its Chip Business

2017-08-31.abstract: As Washington bars Americans from traveling to North Korea, humanitarian groups are uncertain whether they’ll be able to continue work in the isolated country.
2017-08-31.snippet: As Washington bars Americans from traveling to North Korea, humanitarian groups are uncertain whether they’ll be able to continue work in the isolated country.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — A group of American and Canadian humanitarian workers who were traveling in North Korea recently had to make a tough decision: leave the country immediately and hope to return to their lifesaving work in the future, or stay in the North and face possible problems trying to go home later.
2017-08-31.headline_main: U.S. Deadline Forces American Aid Workers to Leave North Korea

2017-08-31.abstract: Painfully wounded in the atomic bombing when he was 16, he went on to become a prominent campaigner for the abolition of nuclear weapons.
2017-08-31.snippet: Painfully wounded in the atomic bombing when he was 16, he went on to become a prominent campaigner for the abolition of nuclear weapons.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Sumiteru Taniguchi, who survived the atomic bombing of Nagasaki as a teenager and went on to become a leading advocate for nuclear disarmament, died on Wednesday in Nagasaki. Overcoming a lifetime of debilitating pain and radiation-related illnesses, he lived to 88.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Sumiteru Taniguchi, 88, Who Survived Nagasaki to Become Activist, Dies

2017-08-31.abstract: Noomi Rapace plays an undercover C.I.A. agent in a film that serves up clichés with its suspense.
2017-08-31.snippet: Noomi Rapace plays an undercover C.I.A. agent in a film that serves up clichés with its suspense.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: The spy thriller “Unlocked” is an apt and not entirely unentertaining demonstration of the adage “the more things change, the more they stay the same.” The movie has a female lead (Alice Racine, played by Noomi Rapace) as its intrepid, smart, lethal spy, so that’s something. Instead of Cold War chess moves in the mode of “Funeral in Berlin,” it serves up the ostensible threat of Islamist terror. Racine is an undercover C.I.A. agent posing as an employment counselor in London. She’s loath to do fieldwork because she feels responsible for not thwarting a terrorist strike in Paris years ago. But she’s pulled back in by the prospect of a horrifying biological attack. She needs to interrogate — “unlock” in spy-speak — a courier whose message could set the plan in motion, or stop it.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: ‘Unlocked,’ a New Spy Thriller, Same as the Old Spy Thrillers

2017-08-31.abstract: An Atlanta theater still believes in “Holler if Ya Hear Me,” which makes use of the rapper’s songbook but stumbled on Broadway in 2014.
2017-08-31.snippet: An Atlanta theater still believes in “Holler if Ya Hear Me,” which makes use of the rapper’s songbook but stumbled on Broadway in 2014.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — A rehearsal hall at the Southwest Arts Center here bursts at the seams with the sound of a young cast belting the lyrics to Tupac Shakur’s “Keep Ya Head Up,” with its powerful refrain: “Got our name from a woman and our game from a woman/I wonder why we take from our women/Why we rape our women, do we hate our women?”
2017-08-31.headline_main: A Tupac Musical Gets a Second Chance

2017-08-31.abstract: Steven Spielberg’s 1977 film “Close Encounters of the Third Kind” will be in theaters for a week, with a screening at Devils Tower National Monument.
2017-08-31.snippet: Steven Spielberg’s 1977 film “Close Encounters of the Third Kind” will be in theaters for a week, with a screening at Devils Tower National Monument.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: The French director François Truffaut once said that “when a film achieves a certain success, it becomes a sociological event.” Such was the case with Steven Spielberg’s “Close Encounters of the Third Kind,” a movie in which Truffaut himself appeared as a scientist exploring the possibility of extraterrestrial life, and which was initially greeted with something like religious awe.
2017-08-31.headline_main: ‘Close Encounters’ Was When the Movies Got New-Age Religion

2017-08-31.abstract: Thursday: The disruption of San Fernando Valley’s porn industry, a Sacramento County sheriff’s deputy is killed, and Los Angeles drops Columbus Day.
2017-08-31.snippet: Thursday: The disruption of San Fernando Valley’s porn industry, a Sacramento County sheriff’s deputy is killed, and Los Angeles drops Columbus Day.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2017-08-31.headline_main: California Today: The Man Who Took Over Porn

2017-08-31.abstract: The episode was one of a host of new dangers that have emerged in the aftermath of the storm as floodwaters recede.
2017-08-31.snippet: The episode was one of a host of new dangers that have emerged in the aftermath of the storm as floodwaters recede.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: With drinking water cut off, its river still rising, and most routes in and out of the city flooded, Beaumont suffered the worst of Texas’ hardships on Thursday, and they showed no sign of abating.
2017-08-31.headline_main: New Worries About Storm Damage as Beaumont’s Drinking Water Shuts Off

2017-08-31.abstract: All I can remember is clutching the steering wheel tightly, inching forward as water splashed against the car.
2017-08-31.snippet: All I can remember is clutching the steering wheel tightly, inching forward as water splashed against the car.

2017-08-31.snippet: Three married couples outwit a documentary filmmaker in Lake Bell’s sex comedy.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: The most valuable takeaway from “I Do ... Until I Don’t,” Lake Bell’s pained sex comedy, is that there’s a lot of money in happy endings. And not the kind that are typically tacked onto movies like this one.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: In ‘I Do ... Until I Don’t,’ Love and Loathing in Florida

2017-08-31.abstract: Two longtime friends, played by Alexandra Daddario and Kate Upton, take a trip to Florida and end up vying for their seatmate’s attention.
2017-08-31.snippet: Two longtime friends, played by Alexandra Daddario and Kate Upton, take a trip to Florida and end up vying for their seatmate’s attention.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: The Bechdel test — to pass it, a movie must show two women talking to each other about something other than a man — has gotten a lot of attention in recent years. But “The Layover,” which probably scrapes by thanks to a line here or there, plays as if it were designed to thumb its nose at the concept.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: Fighting Dirty, Over a Man, in ‘The Layover’

2017-08-31.abstract: Individuals own fewer than half of all rental units in the United States, according to a recent Census report.
2017-08-31.snippet: Individuals own fewer than half of all rental units in the United States, according to a recent Census report.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Institutional investors own a growing share of rental properties in the United States, according to a report by the Harvard Joint Center for Housing Studies. This think tank based its conclusion on the 2015 Rental Housing Finance Survey, recently released by the United States Census Bureau, and earlier census data going back to 2001.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Mom and Pop Own Fewer Rental Units

2017-08-31.abstract: The battle for Tal Afar, which lasted just 11 days, was another sign that the militant group’s days of administering territory are numbered.
2017-08-31.snippet: The battle for Tal Afar, which lasted just 11 days, was another sign that the militant group’s days of administering territory are numbered.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — Another city in Iraq has slipped the grasp of the Islamic State, the extremist group that three years ago controlled a vast caliphate straddling Iraq and Syria that threatened to rewrite Middle Eastern borders drawn after World War I.
2017-08-31.headline_main: ISIS Loses Another City to U.S.-Backed Iraqi Forces

2017-08-31.abstract: Keeping a high school football team together is tough, between a Russian Orthodox sect leery of the outside world and the chores of life in an isolated village.
2017-08-31.snippet: Keeping a high school football team together is tough, between a Russian Orthodox sect leery of the outside world and the chores of life in an isolated village.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: VOZNESENKA, Alaska — The football players wore their black and yellow jerseys to class last Friday, a day before the home opener for Voznesenka School, the smallest high school in Alaska to field a team.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Football Among the Old Believers, in Alaska

2017-08-31.abstract: Since 9/11, combat has been a constant in American life. New series about special-forces warfare are turning it into just another action genre.
2017-08-31.snippet: Since 9/11, combat has been a constant in American life. New series about special-forces warfare are turning it into just another action genre.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: In the pilot of CW’s “Valor,” Capt. Leland Gallo (Matt Barr) tells the helicopter pilot Nora Madani (Christina Ochoa) why secretive special-operations units, like the one they belong to, have become so central to American fighting.
2017-08-31.headline_main: War Is Hell? In New Military Dramas, It’s One-Dimensional

2017-08-31.abstract: The final top 25 poll last season did not include a single Texas team. Will 2017 be any better?
2017-08-31.snippet: The final top 25 poll last season did not include a single Texas team. Will 2017 be any better?
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: FRISCO, Tex. — Gazing forward optimistically to the 2017 season during a news media address over the summer, Gary Patterson, the longtime football coach at Texas Christian, also took a moment to reflect on his state’s dismal 2016.
2017-08-31.headline_main: In Lone Star State, a Shutout Everyone Wants to Forget

2017-08-31.abstract: This film is a handsome, fleet look at the months leading up to the end of British colonial rule in India.
2017-08-31.snippet: This film is a handsome, fleet look at the months leading up to the end of British colonial rule in India.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Cramming ample history into a compact running time without sacrificing flow or interest, “Viceroy’s House” is a handsome, fleet look at the months leading up to India’s independence from Britain in 1947, a milestone that just passed its 70th anniversary. The film carries a trace of the sweep of a great screen epic along with the straightforward, explanatory qualities of mass-audience TV, and is never less than absorbing.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: In ‘Viceroy’s House,’ the Birthing Pains of Two Nations

2017-08-31.abstract: Keeping tabs on a young new driver is easier than it used to be, thanks to several new apps and services intended for nervous parents.
2017-08-31.snippet: Keeping tabs on a young new driver is easier than it used to be, thanks to several new apps and services intended for nervous parents.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Q. I have a new teenage driver in the family. What’s the best way to keep tabs on his whereabouts when he is out with the car? Will regular location-tracking phone apps work?
2017-08-31.headline_main: Apps to Provide Peace of Mind With a Teenager Behind the Wheel

2017-08-31.abstract: For the most innovative designers working today, form is just as important as flora.
2017-08-31.snippet: For the most innovative designers working today, form is just as important as flora.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Spiked Bismarck palm fronds, dramatic clusters of ­flamingo-pink anthuriums, flowering quince branches — MetaFlora’s bold arrangements are unexpected and irreverent, marrying ikebana-inflected minimalism with a dash of kitsch. Founder Marisa Competello, a former fashion stylist, constructs her sculptural compositions — which she often coats in layers of spray paint — from her Chinatown studio in Manhattan. ‘‘My work is an overdose of the ’80s,’’ she says.
2017-08-31.headline_main: The New Wave in Floral Arrangements

2017-08-31.abstract: New and exciting things in the worlds of fashion, art, food, travel and design.
2017-08-31.snippet: New and exciting things in the worlds of fashion, art, food, travel and design.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Since moving to Marrakesh from Geneva over a decade ago, French-Swiss designer Romain Michel-Ménière has outfitted the city’s most stylish spots, including the intimate Riad Mena & Beyond and the farm-to-table Nomad restaurant. Now, Michel-Ménière, who has a knack for mixing minimal pieces into traditional surroundings, has a stylish spot of his own: Berber Lodge, a rural retreat a half-hour’s drive outside of town, high in the cool Atlas Mountains.
2017-08-31.headline_main: On T’s Radar: A Mountain Getaway, Lumpy Design & More

2017-08-31.snippet: The Trump administration has reversed an Obama-era rule that would have required companies to be more transparent about pay. But would it have helped?
