2017-08-31.abstract: What to do when a close friend is rough on a special-needs child. Or when you’re crushing on your dermatologist.
2017-08-31.snippet: What to do when a close friend is rough on a special-needs child. Or when you’re crushing on your dermatologist.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: A close friend asked me, jokingly, whether my 8-year-old daughter’s challenging behavior comes from her Down syndrome or from being a jerk. (My heart sank.) Later, when she was visiting, she reprimanded my daughter harshly for interrupting her. This didn’t go over well, and my daughter indicated that she didn’t want to share a sofa by kicking her. My friend became hysterical. I took my daughter to her room; my friend left, texting me that we could discuss the situation later. Since then, she has not reached out or replied to me. I miss her. Do I continue waiting for an apology?
2017-08-31.headline_main: Waiting for That Elusive Apology

2017-08-31.abstract: Scientists dropped heated panels into the seas off the Antarctic coast. Some microscopic species thrived; others suffered.
2017-08-31.snippet: Scientists dropped heated panels into the seas off the Antarctic coast. Some microscopic species thrived; others suffered.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Climate change will dramatically alter life in the oceans, scientists say, but there’s so much still to learn about marine ecosystems that it’s hard to know exactly how.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Hot Spots in a Freezing Ocean Offer Lessons in Climate Change

2017-08-31.abstract: The McEvoy Foundation for the Arts, opening Oct. 28, will display photographs and other works Nion McEvoy has amassed.
2017-08-31.snippet: The McEvoy Foundation for the Arts, opening Oct. 28, will display photographs and other works Nion McEvoy has amassed.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The debut of the photography center at the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMoMA) last year called attention to the remarkable concentration of local collectors in the field.
2017-08-31.headline_main: With New Arts Space in San Francisco, a Private Collection Becomes Public

2017-08-31.abstract: The Galleries column ventures to the West Coast for a look at several shows currently on view in Los Angeles.
2017-08-31.snippet: The Galleries column ventures to the West Coast for a look at several shows currently on view in Los Angeles.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: The Galleries column this week is taking a quick tour of Los Angeles, where  several fine shows are now on view. Start at Karma, in the West Adams neighborhood, near the Underground Museum; the others are downtown.
2017-08-31.headline_main: What to See in Los Angeles Art Galleries This Week

2017-08-31.abstract: On the Irrawaddy River in Myanmar, dolphins help fishermen herd fish into nets, but overfishing, pollution and a lack of interest among the young threaten that bond.
2017-08-31.snippet: On the Irrawaddy River in Myanmar, dolphins help fishermen herd fish into nets, but overfishing, pollution and a lack of interest among the young threaten that bond.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: MANDALAY, Myanmar — On a recent sweltering afternoon on the Irrawaddy River, about 10 miles upstream from the city of Mandalay, a Burmese fisherman tapped a small teak dowel against the hull of his squat wooden boat, producing a xylophonic beat.
2017-08-31.headline_main: In a Fragile Partnership, Dolphins Help Catch Fish in Myanmar

2017-08-31.abstract: Some storm recovery advice for the afflicted of southeast Texas from New Yorkers who have unfortunately been there, unfortunately done this.
2017-08-31.snippet: Some storm recovery advice for the afflicted of southeast Texas from New Yorkers who have unfortunately been there, unfortunately done this.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Bathe your kids at their accustomed times. Use the gas of wrecked cars to fuel your generator. Beware of taking too much time off from your job. The sight of a squirrel might help.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Tips for Harvey Survivors, From Those Who Lived Through Sandy

2017-08-31.abstract: The Rolex Daytona, perhaps the most famous timepiece in the world, has resurfaced and is up for auction. Collectors think it could fetch $10 million.
2017-08-31.snippet: The Rolex Daytona, perhaps the most famous timepiece in the world, has resurfaced and is up for auction. Collectors think it could fetch $10 million.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Maybe you missed out on Jimi Hendrix’s “Woodstock” Stratocaster, which sold for a reported $1.3 million in 1993. Perhaps you were too slow to raise the paddle for the prototype Apple 1 computer, thought to be Steve Jobs’s and Steve Wozniak’s first, that fetched $815,000 last year.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Paul Newman’s Rare Rolex Has Auction Watchers Buzzing

2017-08-31.abstract: James Poniewozik and Manohla Dargis talk about “Twin Peaks: The Return,” which was much more than a simple sequel series.
2017-08-31.snippet: James Poniewozik and Manohla Dargis talk about “Twin Peaks: The Return,” which was much more than a simple sequel series.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: On Sunday, one of the year’s most fascinating television events will come to a close when “Twin Peaks: The Return” airs its two-hour finale. It’s now apparent that the show’s co-creators, David Lynch and Mark Frost, had something very different in mind than a simple sequel series. Until this week’s episode, the original show’s beloved main character, the F.B.I. agent Dale Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) was nowhere to be found. Sort of. It’s complicated.
2017-08-31.headline_main: We Haven’t Seen That Before: A Critics’ Conversation About ‘Twin Peaks: The Return’

2017-08-31.abstract: Juli Rush of Houston was one of hundreds who shared their Harvey experiences through videos, photographs and voice mail messages. "People keep asking us questions like, 'Why didn’t you guys evacuate, why didn’t Houston do a better job?'” Ms. Rush said. "No amount of planning could have spared us."
2017-08-31.snippet: Juli Rush of Houston was one of hundreds who shared their Harvey experiences through videos, photographs and voice mail messages. "People keep asking us questions like, 'Why didn’t you guys evacuate, why didn’t Houston do a better job?'” Ms. Rush ...
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Juli Rush of Houston was one of hundreds who shared their Harvey experiences through videos, photographs and voice mail messages. "People keep asking us questions like, 'Why didn’t you guys evacuate, why didn’t Houston do a better job?'” Ms. Rush said. "No amount of planning could have spared us."

2017-08-31.abstract: We asked people to show and tell us how Harvey affected them, using photos and voice mail messages. Here are some of their stories.
2017-08-31.snippet: We asked people to show and tell us how Harvey affected them, using photos and voice mail messages. Here are some of their stories.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: For days after Hurricane Harvey first hit the Houston area, the floodwaters kept rising. With thousands of people in the storm’s path, The New York Times wanted to hear directly from those who were affected by Harvey and its aftermath.
2017-08-31.headline_main: ‘No Amount of Planning Could Have Spared Us’: How Texans Experienced Harvey

2017-08-31.abstract: The move is a bold step for an unpretentious company, especially because it is situated in one of Manhattan’s pricier neighborhoods.
2017-08-31.snippet: The move is a bold step for an unpretentious company, especially because it is situated in one of Manhattan’s pricier neighborhoods.

2017-08-31.headline_main: The Flea, an Off Off Broadway Fixture, Opens New Theater in TriBeCa

2017-08-31.abstract: The order to close the consulate and two diplomatic annexes, in New York and Washington, was expected since Russia told the United States to cut its diplomatic staff there.
2017-08-31.snippet: The order to close the consulate and two diplomatic annexes, in New York and Washington, was expected since Russia told the United States to cut its diplomatic staff there.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration ordered Russia on Thursday to close its consulate in San Francisco and two diplomatic annexes, in New York and Washington, in a carefully calculated riposte to Russia’s order that the United States cut its diplomatic staff in Russia.
2017-08-31.headline_main: In Retaliation, U.S. Orders Russia to Close Consulate in San Francisco

2017-08-31.abstract: Gil Schafer, an architect known for his traditional style, created a summer house that’s anything but.
2017-08-31.snippet: Gil Schafer, an architect known for his traditional style, created a summer house that’s anything but.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Gil Schafer, an architect known for his traditional style, created a summer house that’s anything but.
2017-08-31.headline_main: A Classical Designer’s Modern House in Maine

2017-08-31.abstract: For Gil Schafer, an architect known for his traditional style, a summer house that’s surprisingly modern.
2017-08-31.snippet: For Gil Schafer, an architect known for his traditional style, a summer house that’s surprisingly modern.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: For those familiar with the architect Gil Schafer’s work, his house in Brooklin, Me., may come as a shock. Mr. Schafer, best known for conceiving historically focused houses rooted in classical and vernacular architecture, has created a seaside home that is breezily modern.
2017-08-31.headline_main: A Classical Designer Takes a Modern Turn in Private

2017-08-31.abstract: The album, titled “Musik,” will feature the renowned photographer playing his own compositions and improvisations on the synthesizer.
2017-08-31.snippet: The album, titled “Musik,” will feature the renowned photographer playing his own compositions and improvisations on the synthesizer.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: William Eggleston’s photographs have adorned album covers for years: He has lent his singular eye to projects by Big Star, Joanna Newsom and Spoon. But on Oct. 20, Mr. Eggleston, now 78, will release an album of his own.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Photographer William Eggleston Will Release His First Album

2017-08-31.abstract: A late career position switch has made DaMarcus Beasley, 35, a factor in the United States national team’s World Cup qualifying campaign.
2017-08-31.snippet: A late career position switch has made DaMarcus Beasley, 35, a factor in the United States national team’s World Cup qualifying campaign.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: WHIPPANY, N.J. — The United States national soccer team continues to get younger. Less than a year after making his debut for the squad, the 18-year-old midfielder Christian Pulisic is his country’s most indispensable player. Kellyn Acosta, 22; Jordan Morris, 22; and Bobby Wood, 24, have also become key figures in Coach Bruce Arena’s planning.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Old Reliable: Beasley Is Back for the U.S., Eyeing a Fifth World Cup

2017-08-31.abstract: A Georgia officer has left his job after comments he made to a white woman during a traffic stop. The police chief suggested the comments might have been sarcastic.
2017-08-31.snippet: A Georgia officer has left his job after comments he made to a white woman during a traffic stop. The police chief suggested the comments might have been sarcastic.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: A police officer in Georgia has left his position after he was recorded on a dashboard camera trying to convince a white woman that she had nothing to worry about during a traffic stop because she was not black.
2017-08-31.headline_main: ‘We Only Kill Black People,’ Police Officer Says During Traffic Stop

2017-08-31.abstract: The planned film, based on a 1954 novel, will be written and directed by two men, inflaming skepticism of the concept.

2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: A planned film adaptation of “Lord of the Flies,” the 1954 novel that examined the inherent evil of humanity through an island of boys without adult supervision, will have a provocative twist: This time, the island will be full of girls.

2017-08-31.abstract: Researchers have identified the molecule from plants that finds its way into the “bee bread” fed to honeybee larvae and determines their destiny.
2017-08-31.snippet: Researchers have identified the molecule from plants that finds its way into the “bee bread” fed to honeybee larvae and determines their destiny.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: “You are what you eat” is a common adage among humans, but a new study explains why it might be more apt for honeybees.
2017-08-31.headline_main: The Secret Ingredient That Stops Honeybees From Becoming Queens

2017-08-31.abstract: As talks on Brexit intensify, Mrs. May is seeking to reassert authority over her feuding Conservative Party, but the odds are stacked against her.
2017-08-31.snippet: As talks on Brexit intensify, Mrs. May is seeking to reassert authority over her feuding Conservative Party, but the odds are stacked against her.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: For Britain’s prime minister, Theresa May, the good news is that she still has her job, almost three months after she lost her parliamentary majority in a botched general election she need not have called.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Britain’s Theresa May Makes News by Saying She Won’t Quit

2017-08-31.abstract: Georgia Power has asked regulators to approve its proposal to complete two huge new reactors — the only nuclear units still under construction nationwide.
2017-08-31.snippet: Georgia Power has asked regulators to approve its proposal to complete two huge new reactors — the only nuclear units still under construction nationwide.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even as the rest of the United States backs away from nuclear power, utilities in Georgia are pressing ahead with plans to build two huge reactors in the next five years — the only nuclear units still under construction nationwide.
2017-08-31.headline_main: The U.S. Backs Off Nuclear Power. Georgia Wants to Keep Building Reactors.

2017-08-31.abstract: Solange will perform a benefit concert in Boston on Sept. 28, with all proceeds going toward storm relief efforts.
2017-08-31.snippet: Solange will perform a benefit concert in Boston on Sept. 28, with all proceeds going toward storm relief efforts.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Solange, a Houston native, has announced a benefit concert for Hurricane Harvey relief on Sept. 28 at the Orpheum Theater in Boston, with all proceeds going toward “victims and families.” The concert will be part of her performance series “Orion’s Rise” and will feature the Sun Ra Arkestra.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Solange and Other Musicians Join Harvey Relief Efforts

2017-08-31.abstract: Timothy J. Sloan’s long tenure at the bank makes it hard for him to credibly overhaul the culture at a huge institution under intense scrutiny.

2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Long after the floodwaters recede, and even during cleanup and rebuilding, the people who lived through Hurricane Harvey will face another form of recovery — from the storm’s blows to physical and mental health.
2017-08-31.headline_main: The Long-Term Health Consequences of Hurricane Harvey

2017-08-31.abstract: A writer is disappointed that the new Tappan Zee Bridge in New York has no rail link.
2017-08-31.snippet: A writer is disappointed that the new Tappan Zee Bridge in New York has no rail link.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-08-31.headline_main: Rail Links to Bridges

2017-08-31.abstract: A century ago, factory workers went on strike to demand better conditions. Today, start-up “hustlers” celebrate their own exploitation.
2017-08-31.snippet: A century ago, factory workers went on strike to demand better conditions. Today, start-up “hustlers” celebrate their own exploitation.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley prides itself on “thinking different.” So maybe it makes sense that just as a lot of industries have begun paying more attention to work-life balance, Silicon Valley is taking the opposite approach — and branding workaholism as a desirable lifestyle choice. An entire cottage industry has sprung up there, selling an internet-centric prosperity gospel that says that there is no higher calling than to start your own company, and that to succeed you must be willing to give up everything.
2017-08-31.headline_main: In Silicon Valley, Working 9 to 5 Is for Losers

2017-08-31.abstract: The political party of former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto called the decision to free the militants accused in her killing “a triumph of Taliban and Al Qaeda.”
2017-08-31.snippet: The political party of former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto called the decision to free the militants accused in her killing “a triumph of Taliban and Al Qaeda.”
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — In a surprise development, a terrorism court in Pakistan on Thursday acquitted five suspected Taliban and Al Qaeda militants in the 2007 assassination of former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto and declared the former leader Pervez Musharraf a fugitive in the case, lawyers said.
2017-08-31.headline_main: 5 Suspects in Bhutto Assassination Are Cleared by Pakistani Court

2017-08-31.abstract: A reader critiques notions on what brides are expected to do for their weddings.

2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-08-31.headline_main: A Bride, Not a Bridezilla

2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:

2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Defense Secretary Jim Mattis said on Thursday that he had signed deployment orders for some of the American reinforcements that are to be sent to Afghanistan.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Mattis Orders First Group of Reinforcements to Afghanistan

2017-08-31.abstract: Maria Sharapova entered the United States Open as a long shot, but a few wins and a few upsets changed everything. That is making some people uneasy.

2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Maria Sharapova had us going for a few days there, didn’t she?
2017-08-31.headline_main: Sharapova, a Momentary Underdog, Is Hunting Wins Again

2017-08-31.abstract: Fans of this Spanish wine, short on modern history, are still determining what makes it distinctive.
2017-08-31.snippet: Fans of this Spanish wine, short on modern history, are still determining what makes it distinctive.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: No wine can be said to possess an innate character. How a wine ultimately evolves depends on a balance of place, grape, grower and producer.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Godello, a Case Study in the Character of Wine

2017-08-31.abstract: These excellent reds deserve to be better known. They are spicy, fruity and subtle, but for now seem to have attracted only a small following.
2017-08-31.snippet: These excellent reds deserve to be better known. They are spicy, fruity and subtle, but for now seem to have attracted only a small following.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: I don’t like to predict which wines will become the next big things because, really, who knows where the vast numbers of impressionable consumers will swerve to next?
2017-08-31.headline_main: Your Next Lesson: Blaufränkisch From Austria

2017-08-31.abstract: The storm’s victims need all the help we can provide. But this calamity should make us reconsider our broader social contract.
2017-08-31.snippet: The storm’s victims need all the help we can provide. But this calamity should make us reconsider our broader social contract.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: For all of the uncertainties that await Houston and coastal Texas, we can be reasonably sure about one thing: Many of those flooded out by Hurricane Harvey will watch their investments and savings collapse into debt and bankruptcy. And the heaviest burdens, of course, will fall on the shoulders of low- and middle-income residents.
2017-08-31.headline_main: In Hurricane Harvey’s Wake, We Need a Green ‘New Deal’

2017-08-31.abstract: The annual Labor Day celebration attracts revelers to a storied tradition, but violence often overshadows the festivities.
2017-08-31.snippet: The annual Labor Day celebration attracts revelers to a storied tradition, but violence often overshadows the festivities.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Every year around this time, the rhythm of steel drums rises in Central Brooklyn, signaling the approach of Caribbean Carnival, as seamstresses put the final touches on elaborate costumes adorned with feathers and rhinestones.
2017-08-31.headline_main: As Excitement Builds for J’ouvert, So Do Hopes for Peace

2017-08-31.abstract: In its third report since President Trump took office, the International Atomic Energy Agency said Iran was well within the limits of the nuclear agreement.
2017-08-31.snippet: In its third report since President Trump took office, the International Atomic Energy Agency said Iran was well within the limits of the nuclear agreement.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: The world’s nuclear inspectors complicated President Trump’s effort to find Iran in violation of the two-year-old nuclear accord with the United States and five other world powers, declaring on Thursday that the latest inspections found no evidence that the country is breaching the agreement.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Contradicting Trump, U.N. Monitor Says Iran Complies With Nuclear Deal

2017-08-31.abstract: Group weddings, Korean pop, a superannuated Peter Pan and a transgender Emily Post are among the promising theatrical experiences of September.
2017-08-31.snippet: Group weddings, Korean pop, a superannuated Peter Pan and a transgender Emily Post are among the promising theatrical experiences of September.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: What’s better than a quadruple wedding to end the summer? How about two? Dueling visions of “As You Like It,” Shakespeare’s most connubial comedy, frame September in what promise to be polar-opposite productions. In between you can find almost anything under the sooner-setting sun, including a Korean pop factory, a transgender Emily Post, and a mother just getting by.
2017-08-31.headline_main: 5 Shows to See if You’re in New York in September

2017-08-31.abstract: David Harewood (TV’s “Homeland”) and Edwina Findley Dickerson (“The Wire”) star as strangers looking for salvation in a story of faith and heartbreak.
2017-08-31.snippet: David Harewood (TV’s “Homeland”) and Edwina Findley Dickerson (“The Wire”) star as strangers looking for salvation in a story of faith and heartbreak.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: God’s grace seems cruelly missing in “Free in Deed,” a quiet, unsettling story of faith found and tragically lost. Set in present-day Memphis, it focuses on two people who are just barely clinging to the margins. Abe (David Harewood) works as a janitor, pushing brooms and cleaning up other people’s waste; he spends much of the rest of his time in church. Melva (Edwina Findley Dickerson), a single mother, has a desk job but pours much of her energy into the care of her two children, particularly a son she can scarcely control and whose outbursts slip into frightening violence.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: Faith Found and Lost in ‘Free in Deed’

2017-08-31.abstract: Sounds of life in the maternity ward of the Parisian hospital where Diana was taken after her fatal car crash.
2017-08-31.snippet: Sounds of life in the maternity ward of the Parisian hospital where Diana was taken after her fatal car crash.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: When she was alive, Diana, Princess of Wales, never held much interest for me. I didn’t watch her wedding or pay attention to what she wore to parties and ribbon-cutting ceremonies or care that she was unhappy in her marriage to Prince Charles.
2017-08-31.headline_main: My Princess Diary

2017-08-31.abstract: In this romantic comedy, a man can’t handle his best friend’s revelation that he’s gay, throwing their circle of friends and family into disarray.
2017-08-31.snippet: In this romantic comedy, a man can’t handle his best friend’s revelation that he’s gay, throwing their circle of friends and family into disarray.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Can a movie about gay panic make people laugh in 2017? The filmmakers behind “Hazlo Como Hombre” are counting on it. Otherwise, there's little appeal to this romantic comedy’s protagonist, a man so unlikable the movie opens with an M.P.A.A.-style warning for the character’s sexism, homophobia and machismo.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Review: ‘Hazlo Como Hombre’ Mistakes Manhood for Intolerance

2017-08-31.abstract: Two books explore the contentious issue, while another demonstrates why such corrective policies may not be enough.
2017-08-31.snippet: Two books explore the contentious issue, while another demonstrates why such corrective policies may not be enough.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: Though the Supreme Court’s decision in Fisher v. University of Texas last year upheld the university’s right to use race as a factor in admissions, affirmative action policies continue to be scrutinized. This month, The New York Times reported that President Trump’s Justice Department would begin to investigate and even sue colleges over “intentional race-based discrimination.” Critics contend that the proffering of special consideration or benefits to blacks and Latinos is a form of “reverse discrimination,” while supporters argue that affirmative action merely evens the playing field; a recent analysis found that even with these measures, black and Latino students are still more underrepresented in the country’s top colleges and universities today than they were 35 years ago. Below, two books delve into the debate, while another shows why affirmative action may not be enough.
2017-08-31.headline_main: Deep Thinking on Affirmative Action

2017-08-31.abstract: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2017-08-31.snippet: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2017-08-31.lead_paragraph: It’s a sentimental week for parent readers. Fans of Karl Ove Knausgaard’s sprawling and often dark six-volume autobiographical novel, “My Struggle,” might be surprised to find the author showing his short-and-sweet side in “Autumn,” a slender book of essays about the material world addressed to his daughter. In time for school, we also recommend several books for parents, educators and kids. Lenora Chu’s “Little Soldiers” compares the schooling systems in China and the United States. Bruce Handy’s “Wild Things” is a spirited grown-up’s tour through classics of children’s literature. And new books for children feature a girl who grows up at a Renaissance faire, a cat who helps us with our ABC’s and a track star stepping up to challenges at home.
2017-08-31.headline_main: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week
